jobText: TXT/50430753.txt	§Health & Safety Business Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health & Safety Business Partner§§Advertiser: §H2R Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§ §4 month contract (could extend)§ §Based in Hamilton§ §Your skills and experience will be highly valued!§ §We are looking for a Health & Safety Business Partner for a large Waikato based organisation.  Help implement recommendations and embedding of H&S policies, practices and strategic objectives across the organisation.  Assist in building higher awareness around Health & Safety and support managers to deliver on their people management accountabilities.§ §We are looking for someone at the Senior Advisor, Business Partner level to work within a team to provide additional assistance during this busy time.  There will be a focus on compliance and assurance as well as auditing and reviews.  You will be a team player, ready to muck in and hit the ground running.  We are looking for an immediate start and must have NZ H&S experience.§ §Interested to hear more…§ §To apply for this role please visit our website at www.h2r.co.nz and refer to reference number 26208§ § or hit APPLY NOW.  For further information please contact Lissa Crook on §09 368 7300§.  All applications will be acknowledged by email. § §Lissa Crook§ §Contracting Specialist§ §H2R Consulting§ §09 368 7300§§§§

jobText: TXT/50477036.txt	§Senior HR Advisor - 12 Month Fixed Term Contract§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior HR Advisor - 12 Month Fixed Term Contract§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior HR Advisor - 12 Month Fixed Term Contract §      §        §ABOUT US: The Neptune Group operates market leading brands in shipping and logistics services across 18 Pacific Island markets. The Company is a vertically integrated providing supply chain solutions between worldwide markets and the Pacific Island. Neptune is the largest carrier in its core Pacific Island markets operating eight container ships and servicing eighteen Pacific Island nations. The downstream businesses include six container depot sites, six significant warehouse sites, substantial plant and equipment and a large team diversified culture.  §        §Established in 1997, §Neptune Pacific Line§ (NPL) has grown from strength to strength, originally connecting Australia, New Zealand and Fiji trades in liner and bulk shipping services, to today, providing services for most Pacific Island nations, Australia, NZ as well as extending services to Asia, the Indian subcontinent, Europe, South Africa, and North America.  In 2014, NPL continued to strengthen its presence in the South Pacific through Pacific Forum Line, a joint venture with the Government of Samoa.  §Pacific Direct Line§ (PDL) joined the Neptune Group in March 2020, expanding Neptune’s shipping and agency networks, as well as a vertical asset, providing deeper supply chain services including sea and airfreight, 3PL, warehousing, trucking, fumigation and energy trading. §        §THE ROLE: Reporting to the Senior Director of HR, we have a 12 month fixed-term assignment for an Senior HR Advisor to provide generalist HR support to the Neptune Group, including group projects and initiatives whilst we work through an acquisition. You will help support the implementation of culture change, process improvement, talent acquisition & management and leadership development. §        §Here what you'll do: §        §          §Drive and implement organizational and people initiatives aimed at improving HR services in line with The Wonderful Way values, strategies and objectives§          §Deliver hands on support and guidance for leaders on capability, workforce succession planning and recruitment to achieve business outcomes§          §Review, develop and recommend Group policies and procedures§          §Provides managers and supervisors with advice in employee relations matters§          §In conjunction with the International HR Team, administer and coordinate other HR activities including the remuneration and performance review process§          §Partner with assigned business group hiring managers to develop effective and efficient recruiting and sourcing strategies§          §Communicate effectively with hiring managers to establish job specifications, write new or modify existing job descriptions, develop an appropriate marketing strategy, define roles§          §In-person interviewing, identify qualified candidates for multiple business units, conduct references, negotiate and present offers§          §Build on Neptune Group EVP and brand in marketplace§          §Maintain knowledge of human resource industry trends and new employment related legislation and communicate policies and procedures revisions as necessary§          §Participate on committees, project teams and special projects as required.§          §Carry out other duties as required§        §        §Here's what you'll bring to the role: §        §          §Tertiary qualification in Human Resources or related discipline desirable§          §3-5 years HR generalist experience (shipping / logistics industry desirable)§          §Excellent interpersonal skills, with experience supporting senior leaders across multiple locations§          §Strong knowledge of New Zealand employment legislation (international employment legislation desirable)§          §Excellent consulting, influencing, negotiation and facilitation skills§          §Self-directed; ability to thrive in complex, fast-paced and ever-changing environment§          §Intellectually curious mindset§          §Ability to handle matters of confidentiality with utmost tact and diplomacy.§          §Ability to employ creative and innovative thought processes.§          §Tech savvy with intermediate Microsoft Office experience§          §Operational experience in HRIS (ADP) and ATS (SmartRecruiter or GreenHouse) advantageous§ skills, written and verbal§          §Proven track record of successful sourcing (traditional and more innovative methods i.e. social media) and placing candidates.§          §Demonstrated flexibility Maintain Employment Law knowledge and provide sound advice, HR policies and procedures and Employment Agreements. §              §Successfully resolve employment relationship issues.§ HR Business Partner/HR Manager.§              §Degree level tertiary qualifications in human resources management.§              §Sound knowledge and understanding of employment legislation and current HR best practice.§              §A background in engineering /environmental professional services consultancy is preferred but not essential.§              §A “people person”; you believe in respectful manner.§              §Ability to negotiate and resolve employee issues.§              §You strive for excellence and constantly look for ways to exceed expectations.§ We deliver 360º recruitment, training and career solutions to organisations and individuals across the employment life cycle.§ § Due to an internal promotion, we are seeking a results-driven individual to maximise our relationships with new and existing Strategic accounts and contribute to our Adecco’s continuous growth and success. Reporting to the Sales Director, this National Strategic Account Manager will be a key player amongst the Senior Management team. We’re seeking a passionate individual who is experienced in their strategic approach to business relationships and confident in their ability to foster trusted relationships with our clients and internal stakeholders as they are critical to your success in this role.§ § Your success will be measured by successfully executing your strategic account management plans, delivering on client SLA’s and maximising profit through market share or by providing additional solutions. Your value will be in the guidance you provide our operational branches in respect to your client portfolio, and your ability to covert opportunities into revenue.§ § If you are ready to take your recruitment career onward and upwards with our successful and supportive company, this could be the role for you!§ § To be considered, you will need:§        §          §Strong negotiation skills and financial acumen§          §An ability to trouble shoot and problem solve§          §Tender writing experience, ideally large volume or national business§          §Experience in high level account management, paired with a strong understanding of SLAs§          §5 years + experience in recruitment and managing stakeholder engagement§          §Leadership capability§          §Natural curiosity, teamed with critical and strategic thinking ability§        §        §This is an all-encompassing position that will see you working at a high level, yet also requires the ability to roll up your sleeves and understand what is needed. We are looking for someone who is equally passionate about what we do as a business, and has the enthusiasm to work alongside your team to achieve the best results.§ § What’s in it for you?§        §          §Work for a global leader in HR solutions§          §Modern offices based in central Auckland§          §Competitive remuneration package plus bonus§          §Local and global career progression opportunities§          §Work with dedicated teams across the NZ branch network§        §        §If you are ready for your next challenge and have what it takes to be successful in this role, we would love to hear from you. Apply now, or contact Sarah English, Sales Director on §0272135669§ for a confidential conversation.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Adecco Group is the world's leading provider of HR solutions. We deliver 360º recruitment, training and career solutions to organisations and individuals across the employment life cycle.§ § Due to an internal promotion, we are seeking a results-driven individual to maximise our relationships with new and existing Strategic accounts and contribute to our Adecco’s continuous growth and success. Your value will be in the guidance you provide our operational branches in respect to your client portfolio, and your ability to covert opportunities into revenue.§ § If you are ready to take your recruitment career onward and upwards with our successful and supportive company, this could be the role for you!§ § To be considered, you will need:§Strong negotiation skills and financial acumen§An ability to trouble shoot and problem solve§Tender writing experience, ideally large volume or national business§Experience in high level account management, paired with a strong understanding of SLAs§5 years + experience in recruitment and managing stakeholder engagement§Leadership capability§Natural curiosity, teamed with critical and strategic thinking ability§This is an all-encompassing position that will see you working at a high level, yet also requires the ability to roll up your sleeves and understand what is needed. jobText: TXT/50541570.txt	§People and Safety Manager - Kaiteriteri Recreation Reserve§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People and Safety Manager - Kaiteriteri Recreation Reserve§§Advertiser: §Intepeople Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §People and Safety Manager - Kaiteriteri Recreation Reserve §      §        §          §The best role and location ever!§          §Part time role, 20 hours per week§          §Variety and scope across strategy and implementation§        §        §The Kaiteriteri Recreation Reserve, at the gateway to the stunning Abel Tasman National Park, is set in 250 hectares of public conservation land.  Operating for over 80 years and famous for its golden beaches, it offers accommodation, conferencing, retail, hospitality and recreation services.  Employing over 40 staff, swelling to 120 during peak season, it is a dynamic, lively and interesting environment.  §This new and critical role of People and Safety Manager has been created to provide leadership and capability across HR, H&S and wellbeing.  Reporting to, and working closely with the CEO, this busy and varied position spans both strategic and operational responsibilities for building culture, accountability and capability.   You will continue to enhance and maintain a high-performance safety culture, combined with a strategic and planned approach to training, development, talent management, reporting and metrics, compliance and ER.  Ensuring the Reserve has strong leadership and systems, particularly over the peak summer period is essential, as is a positive and professional engagement with managers, team members and stakeholders. § §To be successful you will need a breadth and depth of experience across all aspects of HR, safety, people management and development.  Strategic yet pragmatic, you have a track record of leading initiatives that enhance both people and performance of businesses.  Engaging and building credibility with a range of people and personalities will be critical to your success. §This is a part time role for 20 hours per week. The hours are flexible and there is the option of occasionally working from home - although why would you want to with a location this fabulous!  Other benefits include assistance with travel costs and discounted staff purchasing on groceries and activities.§A truly unique role and location, this is an opportunity to have a positive impact on the people and performance of one of New Zealand’s premiere coastal outdoor recreation destinations.§        §View job description§        §Apply now!§For further enquiries, please contact Odette Shearer 021 270 8657 or §odette.shearer@intepeople.co.nz§Whereas we welcome international enquiries, only applicants that are legally entitled to work permanently in New Zealand will be considered for this role.§ §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §The best role and location ever!§ §Part time role, 20 hours per week§ §Variety and scope across strategy and implementation§The Kaiteriteri Recreation Reserve, at the gateway to the stunning Abel Tasman National Park, is set in 250 hectares of public conservation land.  Operating for over 80 years and famous for its golden beaches, it offers accommodation, conferencing, retail, hospitality and recreation services.  Employing over 40 staff, swelling to 120 during peak season, it is a dynamic, lively and interesting environment.  §This new and critical role of People and Safety Manager has been created to provide leadership and capability across HR, H&S and wellbeing.  Reporting to, and working closely with the CEO, this busy and varied position spans both strategic and operational responsibilities for building culture, accountability and capability.   You will continue to enhance and maintain a high-performance safety culture, combined with a strategic and planned approach to training, development, talent management, reporting and metrics, compliance and ER.  Ensuring the Reserve has strong leadership and systems, particularly over the peak summer period is essential, as is a positive and professional engagement with managers, team members and stakeholders. § §To be successful you will need a breadth and depth of experience across all aspects of HR, safety, people management and development.  Strategic yet pragmatic, you have a track record of leading initiatives that enhance both people and performance of businesses.  Engaging and building credibility with a range of people and personalities will be critical to your success. §This is a part time role for 20 hours per week. The hours are flexible and there is the option of occasionally working from home - although why would you want to with a location this fabulous!  Other benefits include assistance with travel costs and discounted staff purchasing on groceries and activities.§A truly unique role and location, this is an opportunity to have a positive impact on the people and performance of one of New Zealand’s premiere coastal outdoor recreation destinations.§View job description§Apply now!§For further enquiries, please contact Odette Shearer 021 270 8657 or §odette.shearer@intepeople.co.nz§Whereas we welcome international enquiries, only applicants that are legally entitled to work permanently in New Zealand will be considered for this role.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50544055.txt	§Grove Mitre 10 - Learning & Development Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Grove Mitre 10 - Learning & Development Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Mitre 10§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Grove Mitre 10 - Learning & Development Coordinator §      §        §At Grove Mitre 10 we are currently seeking a seasoned L&D Coordinator to join our HR team. §        §If learning is your passion, this could be the opportunity you have been looking for to develop your career in this area further. You might have recently completed a qualification in L&D or have a few years’ experience in an HR coordinator role and feel like the time has come to step into a more specialized direction.§        §The role§        §Reporting to the HR Advisor, the role will have a strong focus on compliance training, inductions and facilitation. All three aspects come with a high administrative component, so being highly organised is definitely a must. §        §With a hands-on approach, the role will be involved in implementing our learning portfolio, and embed our competency framework, to ensure capability is adequate and roles are performed at their full potential for maximum results. Since we are a group of 3 stores in different locations, travel between stores will be necessary, as will be some flexibility to support the team in other different HR projects.§        §The ideal candidate§will have some knowledge of learning design and delivery, will display exceptional customer service, have a flexible and adaptable approach, plenty of initiative, and will enjoy working in a truly collaborative environment. §        §We are looking for:§        §          §Experience in identifying key learning priorities, leveraging stakeholders for their expert knowledge and creating practical experiential learning solutions that can be implemented on the shop floor.§          §Demonstrated experience and ability to facilitate group training with confidence§          §Ability to create content and material that is accessible to a wide audience§          §Exceptional communication, creative thinking and influencing skills§          §Retail experience is highly preferable and would be a real benefit in this role§          §Demonstrated ability and comfort around the use of IT and systems: MS applications, LMS, H&S platforms, videoconferencing, Survey Monkey, Canva etc.§          §Strength in building and maintaining effective relationships §          §Availability to work across the Onehunga, Glenfield and Browns Bay stores is essential§        §        § §        §What can you expect in return§        §A supportive team, passionate about their people and their success in the business. A competitive salary, on-going training and development and a high level of expertise. §        §Opportunities to grow your career in the Learning and Development space don't become available too often, so if you think you have all that it takes, we can't wait to hear from you!§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§At Grove Mitre 10 we are currently seeking a seasoned L&D Coordinator to join our HR team. §If learning is your passion, this could be the opportunity you have been looking for to develop your career in this area further. You might have recently completed a qualification in L&D or have a few years’ experience in an HR coordinator role and feel like the time has come to step into a more specialized direction.§The role§Reporting to the HR Advisor, the role will have a strong focus on compliance training, inductions and facilitation. Since we are a group of 3 stores in different locations, travel between stores will be necessary, as will be some flexibility to support the team in other different HR projects.§The ideal candidate§will have some knowledge of learning design and delivery, will display exceptional customer service, have a flexible and adaptable approach, plenty of initiative, and will enjoy working in a truly collaborative environment. §We are looking for:§Experience in identifying key learning priorities, leveraging      stakeholders for their expert knowledge and creating practical      experiential learning solutions that can be implemented on the shop floor.§Demonstrated experience and ability to facilitate      group training with confidence§Ability to create content and material that is accessible to a wide audience§Exceptional communication, creative thinking and influencing skills§Retail experience is highly preferable and would be      a real benefit in this role§Demonstrated ability and comfort around the use of IT and systems: MS applications, LMS, H&S platforms, videoconferencing, Survey Monkey, Canva etc.§Strength in building and maintaining effective relationships §Availability to work across the Onehunga, Glenfield and Browns Bay      stores is essential§ §What can you expect in return§A supportive team, passionate about their people and their success in the business. jobText: TXT/50556247.txt	§HR Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Advisor§§Advertiser: §AND Management Company Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Salary§§$25 - $34.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§The Group:§ §Situated in the heart of Dunedin, The Octagon, are the group's four businesses:§ § §Vault21 - Dunedin's premier fusion-inspired dining experience, bar, entertainment and nightlife https://vault21.co.nz/§ §Prohibition Smokehouse - a sophisticated venue specialising in southern style BBQ cuisine constructed with fine attention to detail, and an indulgent cocktail menu to match http://prohibitionsmokehouse.co.nz/§ §Catacombs Nightclub – Dunedin’s most immersive nightclub experience which is host to international DJs, weekly club nights, and an exclusive VIP lounge https://www.catacombs.co.nz/§ §Deja Vu Eats - Asian street food served in a quirky neon bright restaurant with a fun atmosphere.§ §The Role:§ §This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced HR generalist looking to work in a part time capacity as the sole HR Advisor for a hospitality group in Dunedin. Hours of work will be approximately 18-20 hours each week across three days. Offices are centrally located in The Octagon.§ §Duties and Responsibilities:§ § §Providing advice, assistance and coaching on performance issues, including conflict and disciplinary action. Employment relations§ §Job analysis, evaluation and reviews§ §Recruitment and on boarding§ §Running weekly payroll§ §Interpreting employment legislation, regulations, policies and employment agreements§ §Develop and create policies and procedures.§ §The successful candidate will have:§ § §At least 2 years' experience in an HR generalist role§ §Knowledge across a broad range of HR areas is required and a sound working knowledge or current employment legislation§ §High level of attention to detail§ §Ability to connect and relate well to employees, management and external stakeholders§ §Must be flexible with hours of work - working Tuesdays is a requirement for payroll§ §For a confidential conversation about the role, please call Judith Appleton on §03 479 2117§.§ §If you believe that you are the right person to take on this challenging, varied and rewarding role, please APPLY NOW with your CV and covering letter.§ §Applications close end of day on Sunday 20th September 2020.§ §Applicants must be eligible to work in New Zealand.§ §No applications from employment agencies will be accepted.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50556307.txt	§People & Capability Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & Capability Manager§§Advertiser: §Consult Recruitment Limited§§More jobs    §      §People & Capability Manager §      §A Little Bit About the Company§ § Finally - this is the HR role you’ve been looking for!  Enjoy the best of all worlds in this New Zealand owned and operated construction company that values excellence, people, innovation, and collaboration.§   § §The Role§ This is a brilliant role for someone who wants to make a difference and create value in an organisation.  The HR function is in place and operational, but the purpose of this role is to take the organisation to the next level from an HR perspective, to facilitate growth and to support the MD and COO with their growth and operational plans.§   § The role will report to the MD and partner with senior leaders across the business to promote practices and objectives that will provide an employee-oriented, high-performance culture that emphasises empowerment and involvement, safety and wellbeing and ongoing development of a superior workforce.§   § More broadly,  this will involve:  §        §          §Lead a People & Capability team to accomplish the company's visions and goals.§          §Develop organisational strategies and interventions.§          §Identify and mitigate risk for both HR/HSE, whilst ensuring compliance with legislation and standards in both of these areas.§          §Following, implementing and ensuring compliance of all Health and Safety policies, procedures, and processes.§          §Workforce and skills planning and optimisation§          §Reviewing current HR systems for optimisation and future growth§          §Developing a plan for supporting the Regional Managers and future leaders with their own personal development and their people concerns.§          §Supporting the business growth from an HR perspective around recruitment, retention, and reporting§          §Helping the leadership team to evolve the culture and the connection in a business that is diverse in locations, operations and focuses.§          §Managing the ER aspects of the business (not the technical aspects but the leadership aspects).§ § §        § §So Who Are You?§ It goes without saying that this is a hugely exciting role and one where you’ll be motivated to make a difference.§   § You’ll either currently be in an HR Leadership role, ideally within construction or manufacturing, and looking for your next opportunity to add value and make a difference to an organisation or you’ll currently be an HR Manager who is looking to step up into a leadership role.  Either way - you will have the energy and ambition to make a difference.§   § You’ll have solid generalist HR experience (ER experience is welcome but not vital), you’ll be able to convey your commercial acumen and you’ll be ambitious. §   § Personality wise, you’ll be someone who can adapt to different cultures and environments, but what is key is your resilience, tenacity, enthusiasm, confidence and leadership ability.  You’ll be an influencer, someone who is supportive but also is capable of driving change in leadership and performance of the organisation.  Someone who enjoys working in growth environments, you’ll be adept at working with people from different backgrounds - you’ll be a relationship builder and someone who is positively focused on making the HR function a crucial value-added part of the organisation.§   § There are very few HR roles like this around and this presents a career-defining opportunity for someone special.§If this sounds like you please hit apply and if you need any further detail, contact Kym Farnham §09 410 7235§.§      § legislation and standards in both of these areas.§ §Following, implementing and ensuring compliance of all Health and Safety policies, procedures, and processes.§ §Workforce and skills planning and optimisation§ §Reviewing current HR systems for optimisation and future growth§ §Developing a plan for supporting the Regional Managers and future leaders with their own personal development and their people concerns.§ §Supporting the business growth from an HR perspective around recruitment, retention, and reporting§ §Helping the leadership team to evolve the culture and the connection in a business that is diverse in locations, operations and focuses.§ §Managing the ER aspects of the business (not the technical aspects but the leadership aspects).§ § § § §So Who Are You?§ It goes without saying that this is a hugely exciting role and one where you’ll be motivated to make a difference.§   § You’ll either currently be in an HR Leadership role, ideally within construction or working in growth environments, you’ll be adept at working with people from different backgrounds - you’ll be a relationship builder and someone who is positively focused on making the HR function a crucial value-added part of the organisation.§   § There are very few HR roles like this around and this presents a career-defining opportunity for someone special.§If this sounds like you please hit apply and if you need any further detail, contact Kym Farnham §09 410 7235§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work jobTitle: HR Manager Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50556701.txt	§HR Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Manager§§Advertiser: §H2R Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §HR Manager §        §          §            §Be part of something inspirational§            §Regional travel required§            §Hamilton based§          §          §Reporting into the Executive Director of People, this role will be working with a variety of stakeholders based across multiple sites. A key to your success will be your strategic thinking, exceptional stakeholder management and excellent communication/relationship building skills.§          §The purpose of this position is to lead the development and delivery of HR practices and procedures by supporting managers to create a high-performance culture within their teams. There is also the responsibility of contributing to both the strategic and operational direction through change management.§          §We are looking for a relationship builder, mentor, coach, and consultant to lead a team of three direct reports, and support portfolio leaders. This role will require a partnership approach and will be responsible for HR services within the central North Island.§          §You will have proven experience in developing HR Strategy, but still like to keep your hands busy doing-the-doing.  You must be comfortable with travelling to build relationships across your region. Whilst not essential, an understanding of Māori values, culture, tikanga and an understanding of basic Te Reo Māori phrases, mihi and greetings would be beneficial.§          §If you have strong technical skills, no ego, and can build collaborative relationships within a complex environment,  this is an opportunity for you to make a real difference.  Interested to hear more?§          §To apply for this position please visit www.h2r.co.nz, and refer to reference number #26310.  For further information please contact Rachael O’Sullivan on §09 368 7300§.  All applications will be acknowledged by email.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§ §Be part of something inspirational§ §Regional travel required§ §Hamilton based§ §Reporting into the Executive Director of People, this role will be working with a variety of stakeholders based across multiple sites. A key to your success will be your strategic thinking, exceptional stakeholder management and excellent communication/relationship building skills.§ §The purpose of this position is to lead the development and delivery of HR practices and procedures by supporting managers to create a high-performance culture within their teams. There is also the responsibility of contributing to both the strategic and operational direction through change management.§ §We are looking for a relationship builder, mentor, coach, and consultant to lead a team of three direct reports, and support portfolio leaders. This role will require a partnership approach and will be responsible for HR services within the central North Island.§ §You will have proven experience in developing HR Strategy, but still like to keep your hands busy doing-the-doing.  You must be comfortable with travelling to build relationships across your region. Whilst not essential, an understanding of Māori values, culture, tikanga and an understanding of basic Te Reo Māori phrases, mihi and greetings would be beneficial.§ §If you have strong technical skills, no ego, and can build collaborative relationships within a complex environment,  this is an opportunity for you to make a real difference.  Interested to hear more?§ §To apply for this position please visit www.h2r.co.nz, and refer to reference number #26310.  For further information please contact Rachael O’Sullivan on §09 368 7300§.  All applications will be acknowledged by email.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50557089.txt	§Senior Recruitment Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Recruitment Consultant§§Advertiser: §Kinetic Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Recruitment Consultant §      §        §          §Wellington based; Base, bonus, perks within a well-established company §          §Mix of established accounts with development opportunity to expand and grow§          §Hybrid desk offering broad range of roles to recruit, temp, permanent and contract§        §        §With four offices around New Zealand and a growing client base, we need a person who has experience in recruitment to step in and take over an established and billing base. This is a generalist role, where you will be recruiting a number of positions throughout your clients, in temporary, permanent and contract positions.§        §What Kinetic looks for in a person joining the business consists of a few important traits. Fundamentally, you must be genuine. You need to be a highly motivated person who will work hard for your clients and candidates, providing a high-quality service to both. This could come into "after hours" but if you are in recruitment, you work it because everything has an impact.§        §We like people who talk fast, work fast and follow it up with the detail. We are dealing with people’s careers, and clients have high expectations that we want to meet every time. This role is needing a confident, fast moving and driven experienced recruiter who can pick up systems and processes quickly.§        §Honesty is very important, we say it how it is, and we offer a consultative service to everyone who deals with us as a business. §        §You will be able to work with a diverse range of clients and roles, with plenty of variety and opportunity to not only grow your business but diversify as a recruiter and keep things interesting. §        §We are a flexible employer and offer staff a very supportive environment which allows you to work from the office and/or home, a large number of the consultants at Kinetic mix it up. §        §If you are looking for change and ready for a role to further your career with so much variation and challenge, this is honestly it. It is hard to find anything better. §        §To submit your interest, hit apply now attention Stacey. Alternatively phone Stacey on §093669977§ for a confidential discussion.   §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Wellington based; Base, bonus, perks within a well-established company § §Mix of established accounts with development opportunity to expand and grow§ §Hybrid desk offering broad range of roles to recruit, temp, permanent and contract§ §With four offices around New Zealand and a growing client base, we need a person who has experience in recruitment to step in and take over an established and billing base. Fundamentally, you must be genuine. You need to be a highly motivated person who will work hard for your clients and candidates, providing a high-quality service to both. This could come into "after hours" but if you are in recruitment, you work it because everything has an impact.§ §We like people who talk fast, work fast and follow it up with the detail. We are dealing with people’s careers, and clients have high expectations that we want to meet every time. This role is needing a confident, fast moving and driven experienced recruiter who can pick up systems and processes quickly.§ §Honesty is very important, we say it how it is, and we offer a consultative service to everyone who deals with us as a business. § §You will be able to work with a diverse range of clients and roles, with plenty of variety and opportunity to not only grow your business but diversify as a recruiter and keep things interesting. § §We are a flexible employer and offer staff a very supportive environment which allows you to work from the office and/or home, a large number of the consultants at Kinetic mix it up. § §If you are looking for change and ready for a role to further your career with so much variation and challenge, this is honestly it. jobTitle: HR Analytics Specialist Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50557441.txt	§HR Analytics Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Analytics Specialist§§Advertiser: §Link Alliance - City Rail Link§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Other§§§§§§About us:§ The City Rail Link (CRL) Project is a game changer for Auckland and is the largest transport infrastructure project ever undertaken in New Zealand. The CRL is a 3.45km twin tunnel, transforming the dead-end station at Britomart, creating two new stations at Aotea and Karangahape Road and reconnecting to the network at a redeveloped Mt Eden station.§ § §About the role:§ §The People & Capability team are seeking an HR Analytics specialist that brings exceptional skill in being able to translate huge amounts of people data into comprehensive reports that give a narrative around the health of our organisation.  This requires an eye for detail, but being able to simultaneously see the bigger picture.  A background in the construction industry would be a major plus.  The HR Analytics specialist will support the HR Manager on workforce planning analysis and play a pivotal role in reporting across a range of HR subjects. § § §Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:§ § §Support the HR Manager to maintain the Project Workforce Plan, ensuring the quality and accuracy of data, and deliver a suite of HR reports to various stakeholders§ §Utilize workforce data to run analytics and develop narratives around the ‘health of our project organization’§ §Work in collaboration with other functional areas to develop further reports as we move through the project phases, from mobilization, to people development, to offboarding§ §Become familiar with other tools and systems that capture ‘people’ data, so that we can draw from and use for HR analytics purposes (e.g. JobAdder recruitment system, SharePoint, Site Security System, etc.)§ §Support the project recruitment team and respective hiring managers by keeping the ‘active recruitment plan’ up-to-date§ §Provide our Alliance Partner Home Organizations (OAPs) with timely and accurate reporting, including the allocation of roles§ §Responsible for maintaining the New Starters tracker, which feeds into numerous onboarding processes§ § §About you: § § §Experience working in the HR analytics space or HR reporting§ §An expert in Microsoft Excel!§ §Strong attention to detail, but with the ability to see the ‘bigger picture’§ §Experience working in a fast-pace environment and comfortable managing several topics at the same time§ §A team player with a very collaborative approach§ §Takes initiative; recognizes when there is a sense of urgency and is able to prioritize accordingly§ §Has an affinity for systems and technology and is willing to learn about how this can help with analytics.§ §   § All successful applicants will be required to pass a pre-employment drug test and medical.§ § *Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. No candidates presented through an agency will be considered for any of our roles advertised, unless previously arranged. We would strongly encourage all candidates interested in these roles, to apply directly online through the portal provided, otherwise your application will not be considered.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

We are dealing with people’s careers, and clients have high expectations that we want to meet every time. This role is needing a confident, fast moving and driven experienced recruiter who can pick up systems and processes quickly.§ §Honesty is very important, we say it how it is, and we offer a consultative service to everyone who deals with us as a business. § §You will be able to work with a diverse range of clients and roles, with plenty of variety and opportunity to not only grow your business but diversify as a recruiter and keep things interesting. § §We are a flexible employer and offer staff a very supportive environment which allows you to work from the office and/or home, a large number of the consultants at Kinetic mix it up. § §If you are looking for change and ready for a role to further your career with so much variation and challenge, this is honestly it. It is hard to find anything better. § §To submit your interest, hit apply now attention Stacey. Alternatively phone Stacey on §093669977§ for a confidential discussion.   §§§§

jobText: TXT/50560828.txt	§Work Health & Safety Consultant | Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Work Health & Safety Consultant | Wellington§§Advertiser: §Employsure§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Rest of Wellington Region§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§The opportunity§Employsure has experienced astonishing growth over the last 9 years! Our award-winning HR/WHS & SAAS solution has seen us obtain over 27,000 clients, grow to over 880 employees and 5 offices across ANZ. This, in turn, has created exciting opportunities within our WHS Consultancy team on the North Island!  §Joining a team of over 50 Consultants, you will be conducting WHS compliance checks for our clients, making a significant impact on the successful operation of their businesses. You will be required to quickly develop relationships with clients as well as providing specialist advice around WHS issues in a face to face environment via online video platforms or in person. §A typical day involves developing and producing a tailored WHS system which includes a hazard assessment of our clients' workplace, and the creation of a suite of health and safety documentation and reports. This means you will need to be very confident with the current WHS legislative framework in New Zealand. §  §Key accountabilities§ § §Travel around New Zealand as required to clients (due to COVID-19 implications, you will engage with clients remotely over an online video platform in the interim) § §Spend a full a day with a client to deliver Employsure's service § §Working with businesses to determine their WHS needs and requirements § §Build relationships with clients and act as a subject matter expert for all things WHS§ §Create documents including policies, manuals, procedures, reports and more§ § §The right person will have:§ § §Diploma qualified in Work Health and Safety§ §12 months experience working within a Health & Safety environment§ §Excellent communication skills both verbal and written§ §Full, unrestricted New Zealand driving licence§ §Ability to travel to other areas in NZ at short notice  § § §Why join Employsure?§§Our vision is to Build Better businesses starting with our own. Employsure is committed to nurturing a diverse and inclusive culture of opportunity. We encourage applications from people of culturally diverse backgrounds, people who identify as LGBTQI+, people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander origin, and people with disabilities.§The opportunities are endless, with personal and professional growth being one of our top priorities. In addition, we offer our employees remarkable benefits. If you are looking for a role that can match your ambitions, we want to hear from you.§With a global track record of over 30 years of success, this is your chance to join an industry leader who prides itself on expertise and innovation at an exciting time in the Australian and New Zealand market.§Become a part of our exciting journey. Apply now.  §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50564359.txt	§Health and Safety Administrator - part-time§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Administrator - part-time§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§About our business§ §We are a leading national provider of B2B workplace solutions, we keep our customers happy, safe and productive and we are growing rapidly!   Our team of 200 are genuine, welcoming and professional.  § §The role§ §This is a part-time role for an experienced HSE person to work closely with our GM of Operations to assist in all thing's health and safety.  The hours of work can be organised to suit your availability, but we see this as being 20-25 hours per week. § §Key responsibilities:§ § §Assist with implementation, updating, review and auditing of HSE policies, and procedures.§ §Advise on changes and developments in HSE and ensure HSE policies and procedures are updated accordingly§ §Reporting of HSE management information including incidents and investigations§ §Manage and maintain HSE staff training records and requirements§ §Assist with documentation for transitional facilities standards§ §Attend and participate in HSE meetings§ §Required:§ § §Minimum 2+ years of experience with practical onsite Health and Safety experience.§ §Proven experience in health and safety, audit, inspection and investigation.§ §Demonstrated knowledge in health and safety legislation regulations and codes of practice.§ §Working knowledge of New Zealand health and safety law, The Health and Safety at Work Act 2015 (HSWA)§ §Experience with Transitional Facilities standards and Dangerous Goods would be an advantage.§ §Intermediate to strong computer skills; excel and word.§ §SAP experience desirable.§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills§ § On Offer§ § §Be part of a high-performing and friendly team§ §Enjoy the energy of working for a business that is in growth mode, dynamic and fast paced§ §Highbrook location§ §Part-time hours to suit your lifestyle (Monday to Friday)§ §Lots of perks, fresh fruit, social events and staff discounts§ §Apply with your CV and cover letter using the appropriate links§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50569670.txt	§Advisor People and Culture§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Advisor People and Culture§§Advertiser: §Vitaco Health NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Advisor – People and Culture §§Leading health and wellbeing products§Great team culture§Fast-paced FMCG environment§Part-time  24 hours per week §At Vitaco, §“We Care, We Act, We Succeed”. § Vitaco is the home of an outstanding collection of leading New Zealand and Australian supplements, health food, and sports nutrition brands. Our four core brands, Nutra-Life, Healtheries, Aussie Bodies, and Musashi, have been empowering healthier lives in over 30 countries world-wide for over 100 years. Whether in a grocery store, pharmacy, sports specialty store, or online platform; you are likely to find a high quality Vitaco product everywhere you love to shop.§Your Opportunity§We are looking for an experienced HR Generalist/Advisor to join our very special People and Culture team.§Based in East Tamaki and reporting to the General Manager People and Capability, the People and Culture Advisor will provide generalist human resources and employment relations support to our fast-based business. The role will be varied with no two days the same; you will also be contributing across recruitment, remuneration, talent management, L&D and organisational change. §Key accountabilities include: §General HR and ER advice, in relation to the entire employment life-cycle; including aspects of talent management, professional development and performance review§Coaching and supporting people leaders through some of the more tricky aspects of employment relations, attendance and long-term rehabilitation§Recruiting our very valuable production operators and distribution team members; ensuring a warm, kind and professional experience for all candidates and for hiring managers§Managing and/or contributing to annual remuneration cycles§Supporting organisational change through project management, and people change management.§About You§You bring a relevant tertiary qualification; and a minimum 4-5 years’      in a generalist HR function, with at least 2 years’ experience in      manufacturing/FMCG industries §You have contemporary HR, OD knowledge and strong ER capability,      having worked with diverse work forces, unions and advocates§You are a strong communicator; with excellent writing skills and      you are able to present to reasonably large groups of people§It goes without saying that you are digitally savvy; with advanced computer      literacy, high engagement with social media, have HRIS, ATS and ideally,      survey software experience §You demonstrate commercial acumen; have a track record of      relationship building, of establishing trust and of influencing internal      and external business partners§You work well under pressure; are a strong contributor who helps      their colleagues to also succeed§Experienced in project management, change management and in HBDI      would be an advantage. §Our diversity is an asset that impacts the way we think and the way we work together at Vitaco. We are committed to an inclusive workplace that respects all cultures, different ways of thinking, and that supports our people to perform at their best and develop to their full potential. §We are a fun, caring, supportive environment and team. We offer flexibility so you can choose whether part-time is over three, four or five days per week. We are in a handy location with car parking, have an on-site café and generous staff discounts; and no one will ever expect you to work on your birthday.  More than all that, our P&C team gets to help empower healthier lives at a time when the world needs it. §Perhaps you are returning to your career after a break; seeking better work/life balance through reduced work hours, or wanting to take your career to the next level. Either way, if you are prepared to roll up your sleeves and get busy, this is your opportunity.  We’d love to hear from you. §Applications may be considered before the closing date.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Recruitment Coordinator Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50572361.txt	§Recruitment Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Coordinator§§Advertiser: §VisionWest Community Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§If you love meeting new people, conducting interviews, and are precise with detail, this is the job for you! §VisionWest is seeking a permanent Recruitment Coordinator to work 30 to 40 hours per week to join the Human Resources Team in the Hamilton Office. Our ideal team member is someone with a positive and enthusiastic attitude, who enjoys supporting the team, has a strong work ethic and thrives in a fast-paced work environment. This role will be recruiting for our Support Worker workforce. To be successful in obtaining this role, you will need to have the appropriate experience and the drive to succeed when challenges arise. You will also need to have a good understanding of VisionWest’s mission and values and be a great fit for our Human Resources Team.§Key responsibilities of the role include:§  §Telephone and face to face interviews§  §Liaising with candidates and staff§  §Ensuring recruitment requests are actioned in a timely manner§  §Ensuring documentation is completed correctly§  §Providing administration support when required§Other skills and attributes we are looking for are:§  §Previous recruitment and generalist HR experience preferred§  §Competent in administration and Microsoft Word and Excel§  §Excellent communication skills - spoken, written and a great phone manner§  §Sound understanding of employment related legislation an advantage§  §The ability to manage confidential information appropriately§  §The ability to efficiently coordinate high volume recruitment§  §A warm, welcoming and professional manner with the ability to engage easily with a wide range of people§  §A full, clean driver licence as there will be some travel required between offices.  §A commitment to the mission and values of VisionWest Community Trust is essential for this position, see www.VisionWest.org.nz.§If this role appeals to you, then please apply now!§  §§§§

jobText: TXT/50572895.txt	§Health and Safety Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Advisor§§Advertiser: §SKOPE Refrigeration§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Health and Safety Advisor§ § §SKOPE Industries Ltd designs, manufactures and supplies commercial refrigeration products globally.  We are passionate about our employees and customers and proud of the rich heritage of this family owned company.§ § §“Work safe. Live well. Look after each other”§ § §We are looking for a passionate Health and Safety advocate to join our team.  As a company we have made great strides in engaging our people over the last few years and we want to continue that journey and imbed these traits across the entire business.§ § §Its not about “doing” health and safety, it’s about promoting health and safety and making it “click” for everyone.§ § §If this sounds like the opportunity that you have been dreaming about, read on.§ § §Reporting to the Human Resources Manager, you will be responsible for working in conjunction with all employees to develop, implement and review health and safety practices throughout the company. § § §You will be an experienced health and safety practitioner with sound knowledge of Health and Safety legislation and experience with industry best practice.§ § §Self-motivated with a demonstrated ability to manage deadlines and communication skills that allow you to work throughout the company you will enjoy encouraging others as well as achieving yourself. A networker, you will be keeping up to date with best practices as it develops.§ § §A relevant Health and Safety qualification is desirable.§ § §We’re Riccarton based with a heap of car parking. This role at SKOPE will offer you a challenge and an opportunity.§ § §If this sounds like you then we would love to hear from you.§     § §SKOPE Industries Ltd is committed to a drug and alcohol-free workplace.  The successful applicant will be required to undergo a pre-employment medical which includes a drug test.§   § §Diversity§ §SKOPE is committed to ensuring equal opportunities to all qualified individuals. We believe a diverse workforce will enhance our ability to provide a more comprehensive experience for our customers. All applications are considered based on merit, qualifications, and business need.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50575184.txt	§People & Culture Coordinator §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & Culture Coordinator §§Advertiser: §CHARTERED ACCOUNTANTS  AUSTRALIA AND NEW ZEALAND§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Other§§§§§§§We are a professional membership body supporting 120 000+ diverse, talented and financially astute members. We employ over 350 people in 14 locations across Australia, New Zealand, UK and Asia. When you join us, you have an opportunity to develop great skills & strong networks and do something different and fresh with your career. § § §The People and Culture Trans-Tasman team based in Sydney and Wellington Office. This role reports to the Group Executive People & Culture with dotted line report to the People Experience Coordinator.§This role will assist the People and Culture team and represents the interface between the business and People and Culture team.  It works in partnership with the leaders and people of Chartered Accountants ANZ to implement an integrated P&C plan that supports achieving business priorities and culture goals. § §The Opportunity §Update our internal databases with new employee information, including contact details and employment forms§Gather payroll data like leaves, working hours and bank accounts§Prepare HR-related reports as needed (like training budgets by department)§Address employee queries about benefits (like number of remaining leave days)§Review and distribute company policies in digital formats or hard copies§Participate in organising company events and activities§Assist with Employment contracting generating§Conduct Visa requirement checks§ §Great To have§Currently undertaking bachelor’s degree in HR or related field§Experience with MS Office§Organizational skills§Time management skills§Ability to think outside the square to solve problems§High Attention to details§ §Position description §Visit Chartered Accountants ANZ career website https://www.charteredaccountantsanz.com/about-us/what-we-do/work-for-us § §What’s in it for you §At Chartered Accountants ANZ, we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace reflecting the members we serve. As a value driven organisation, we collaborate for success, through integrity and being accountable for ourselves in the role we play to grow and improve as a team. Our benefits include Scholarship program, flexible workplace, staff benefits, monthly gatherings and internal Career development.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Area Manager - Recruitment Industry Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50575550.txt	§Area Manager - Recruitment Industry§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Area Manager - Recruitment Industry§§Advertiser: §OneStaff Christchurch§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Salary§§$80,000 - $99,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Area Manager - Recruitment Industry §      §        §OneStaff is a 100% NZ owned recruitment company which provides market leading recruitment solutions to industry and has been in business for over 20 years. Our Mission is to make OneStaff the preferred recruitment agency for candidates and clients through delivery of innovative, tailored and exceptional service. OneStaff is about "Working as One"; It's not a throw away catch phrase, it's a philosophy meaning we work collaboratively together to get a mutually beneficial outcome between the candidate and the company. With this, our aim is to ensure that as a key member of the OneStaff team you will have the developmental support to be the best you can be to deliver this ethos.§        § §        §We are currently seeking the services of an Area Manager for our very successful Hawkes Bay branch. Our Hawkes Bay branch has experienced consistent growth since opening over seven years ago and is now a leading force in the region. Our experienced team has been providing outstanding service to our local and multinational clients in the area and are all very passionate and proud of what they have achieved. OneStaff is a nationwide business and has been recognised as the leading large recruitment agency in New Zealand through the annual §SARA§ industry awards, we’ve also been recognised as one of the countries’ overall fastest growing businesses three years running in the §Deloitte Fast 50§. After 20 years of operations the future is looking brighter than ever and we’re searching for a person of exceptional talent to join and run our busy Hawkes Bay team.§        § §        §OneStaff provides a full range of recruitment and labour hire services dealing with customers from a large variety of industries to assist in their personnel search and selection requirements. You may be in an existing management role or perhaps an experienced Recruiter looking to further your career. This is a sales driven industry and the successful applicant will need to show strong personal drive, a growth based mind-set, be commercially savvy, as well as customer service excellence, a strong sales focus and effective team management skills as some of their key personal attributes.§        § §        §The core duties of the role involve:§ §        §          §Recruitment§: Sourcing personnel for a large variety of local businesses. This involves personally running a full recruitment cycle to source and select the best employees for many external vacancies§          §Labour hire§: Managing and growing a large workforce of employees on short-term temporary contracts; being deployed across a variety of Hawkes Bay businesses for varying lengths of time§          §Team Management§: Managing the established Hawkes Bay team members to drive performance and service integrity to the companywide standard§          §Sales§: Undertaking the full sales cycle for bringing on new business through calls, meetings, presentations and follow up§          §Branch Management§:  With support from head office, running all aspects of the local business including financials, marketing, staff training and compliance§        §        § §        §To be considered for this role you will need to show:§ §        §          §Experience managing or leading an established business, or previous experience in the recruitment/labour hire industries with a strong desire to develop your career§          §A successful background with tangible results in a previous sales-based role§          §A broad understanding of the financial drivers of business such as sales, cash flow and expense control to generate sustainable growth § §          §        §        §The remuneration on offer is comprised of:§        §          §An attractive salary to be negotiated in line with your experience§          §An annual bonus structure reaching to 40% of your base salary, measured against pre-set KPI’s including budgeted profit, H & S, and compliance components§        §        § §        §Additional Benefits:§        §          §Full use of a company vehicle with fuel card§          §Full use of a company mobile phone§          §A company tablet/laptop§          §Personal Medical insurance§          §Long service leave§          §Ongoing training and development§          §Career progression opportunities within the wider organisation§          §A career in a fun and progressive 100% New Zealand owned organisation§          §All employees have their birthdays off each year§        §        § §        §This is a Monday to Friday role from 8am – 5pm however due to the nature of the industries we supply in to, some overtime is an expected part of this position as and when client needs dictate. Although based in the Hawkes Bay, some nationwide travel is expected to attend internal training seminars, conferences and industry awards etc.§ §        §To express your interest in this role please submit an updated CV and Cover Letter by applying online below or contact Matt on §0212229089§ for a confidential chat.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§OneStaff is a 100% NZ owned recruitment company which provides market leading recruitment solutions to industry and has been in business for over 20 years. Our Mission is to make OneStaff the preferred recruitment agency for candidates and clients through delivery of innovative, tailored and exceptional service. OneStaff is about "Working as One"; It's not a throw away catch phrase, it's a philosophy meaning we work collaboratively together to get a mutually beneficial outcome between the candidate and the company. With this, our aim is to ensure that as a key member of the OneStaff team you will have the developmental support to be the best you can be to deliver this ethos.§ § § §We are currently seeking the services of an Area Manager for our very successful Hawkes Bay branch. Our Hawkes Bay branch has experienced consistent growth since opening over seven years ago and is now a leading force in the region. Our experienced team has been providing outstanding service to our local and multinational clients in the area and are all very passionate and proud of what they have achieved. OneStaff is a nationwide business and has been recognised as the leading large recruitment agency in New Zealand through the annual §SARA§ industry awards, we’ve also been recognised as one of the countries’ overall fastest growing businesses three years running in the §Deloitte Fast 50§. After 20 years of operations the future is looking brighter than ever and we’re searching for a person of exceptional talent to join and run our busy Hawkes Bay team.§ § § §OneStaff provides a full range of recruitment and labour hire services dealing with customers from a large variety of industries to assist in their personnel search and selection requirements. You may be in an existing management role or perhaps an experienced Recruiter looking to further your career. This is a sales driven industry and the successful applicant will need to show strong personal drive, a growth based mind-set, be commercially savvy, as well as customer service excellence, a strong sales focus and effective team management skills as some of their key personal attributes.§ § § §The core duties of the role involve:§ § § §Recruitment§: Sourcing personnel for a large variety of local businesses. This involves personally running a full recruitment cycle to source and select the best employees for many external vacancies§ §Labour hire§: Managing and growing a large workforce of employees on short-term temporary contracts; being deployed across a variety of Hawkes Bay businesses for varying lengths of time§ §Team Management§: Managing the established Hawkes Bay team members to drive performance and service integrity to the companywide standard§ §Sales§: Undertaking the full sales cycle for bringing on new business through calls, meetings, presentations and follow up§ §Branch Management§:  With support from head office, running all aspects of the local business including financials, marketing, staff training and compliance§ § § §To be considered for this role you will need to show:§ § § §Experience managing or leading an established business, or previous experience in the recruitment/labour hire industries with a strong desire to develop your career§ §A successful background with tangible results in a previous sales-based role§ §A broad understanding of the financial drivers of business such as sales, cash flow and expense control to generate sustainable growth § § § §The remuneration on offer is comprised of:§ § §An attractive salary to be negotiated in line with your experience§ §An annual bonus structure reaching to 40% of your base salary, measured against pre-set KPI’s including budgeted profit, H & S, and compliance components§ § § §Additional Benefits:§ § §Full use of a company vehicle with fuel card§ §Full use of a company mobile phone§ §A company tablet/laptop§ §Personal Medical insurance§ §Long service leave§ §Ongoing training and development§ §Career progression opportunities within the wider organisation§ §A career in a fun and progressive 100% New Zealand owned organisation§ §All employees have their birthdays off each year§ § § §This is a Monday to Friday role from 8am – 5pm however due to the nature of the industries we supply in to, some overtime is an expected part of this position as and when client needs dictate. Although based in the Hawkes Bay, some nationwide travel is expected to attend internal training seminars, conferences and industry awards etc.§ § §To express your interest in this role please submit an updated CV and Cover Letter by applying online below or contact Matt on §0212229089§ for a confidential chat.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
