jobText: TXT/50605220.txt	§People & Culture Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & Culture Advisor§§Advertiser: §PwC NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Line of Service§Internal Firm Services§Industry/Sector§Not Applicable§Specialism§IFS - Human Capital (HC)§Management Level§Senior Associate§Job Description & Summary§§Kia Ora§§Who are we?§We’re a team of trusted business advisors who work alongside our clients and build long lasting relationships that create value. Our people are what make us the leading professional services firm in New Zealand - full of energy, challenge, and opportunities. Our values are at the centre of who we are; it decides the way we think, who we employ and how we work.§§What would you be doing? §We have an exciting permanent opportunity in Wellington for an experienced and motivated HR generalist to join our People and Culture team.  In this role you’ll be a trusted business advisor driving key strategic and operational priorities within your portfolio as well as providing day to day HR advice and support. This is a busy role where you’ll be the key point of contact for an operating unit and responsible for delivering the full life cycle of HR activity. Some key responsibilities include: §Working alongside the P&C Business Partner to successfully deliver all operational HR activity §Assist in planning and managing remuneration reviews including understanding and applying benchmark data and remuneration guidelines§Taking an active role in our Graduate Recruitment programme and supporting stakeholders across the full spectrum of HR issues, policies and procedures§Contribute to, manage and implement People & Culture framework and policies.§Manage and coach on performance management and organisational development frameworks and activities §​§What you’ll need to bring to the role§You’ll be a commercially focused HR Generalist with a minimum of three year’s HR advisory experience. §You will be confident in owning HR projects and have experience managing Employee Relations§A tertiary qualification in HR or an HR related discipline a prerequisite.§To be successful you’ll be a self-starter with a natural talent for establishing effective working relationships in an open and approachable manner. §Previous experience working in a professional services organisation advantageous.§You will have a proven track record in building relationships based on trust, credibility and the delivery of quality work. You’ll have sound judgment to deal with demanding situations, and experience in problem solving - particularly the ability to source and offer a variety of solutions. §Your strong attention to detail will be relied on, coupled with your client-service mind set and organised approach to your work. You are a team player with a high level of energy and passion for what you do.§Open to travel between various PwC office locations.§​§Why is PwC a great place to work?§Today’s constantly changing commercial world requires us to be proactive with our professional and personal development. At PwC, you will have an unrivalled level of access to industry expertise, both locally and through our wider global network of member firms, where you’ll be enabled by cutting-edge technology and a culture of self-disruption. We aim to encourage a culture where people can be themselves and be valued for their strengths. Creating value through diversity is what makes us strong as a business and with an increasingly agile workforce drive flexible working to get the best out of our people. At PwC, we aim to inspire, motivate and reward our people to succeed in all areas of their lives.§ §What next?§If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. To submit your details click ‘apply now’.§Ngā mihi mahana§§§Education §(if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)§Degrees/Field of Study required: Bachelor Degree - Human Resources Management§Degrees/Field of Study preferred:§Certifications §(if blank, certifications not specified)§§Desired Languages §(If blank, desired languages not specified)§English§Travel Requirements§Up to 20%§Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?§No§Government Clearance Required?§No§Job Posting End Date§October 22, 2020§§§§§

jobTitle: Safety and Wellbeing Business Partner Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50605650.txt	§Safety and Wellbeing Business Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Safety and Wellbeing Business Partner§§Advertiser: §Wintec (Waikato Institute of Technology)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Do you have a passion for making a difference and have experience or hold qualifications in Safety and Wellbeing? Join the People and Culture team at Wintec.§We enjoy a good laugh, a lot of character, and promote being our authentic selves at work. That said we work exceptionally hard between the chuckles - but continuously gain positivity and energy from each other to get through even the most gruelling of days. This is your opportunity to join a team that will bring out the best in you, in an organisation that aspires to lead the change in tertiary education and model modern working practices.§About the role§In this role you will support the Safety and Wellbeing Manager and partner with managers and staff across all areas of Wintec. You will use your influence and coaching abilities to achieve the organisational goals through managers and staff to affect safety and wellbeing change. You will work alongside a high performing collaborative team, who works closely together providing supportive guidance and experience to continuously grow each other. You will hit the ground running as you must be able to churn through the day to day operational needs and provide sound leadership advice on Safety and Wellbeing management. You will identify risks and manage investigations, promote safety and wellbeing practices across Wintec while coaching and mentoring others. It's essential that you have experience in building strong relationships and have superior communication skills working with a diverse group of people. §If safety and wellbeing is a passion for you and you have a generalist understanding of Health and Safety and its impact on an organisation both legislatively and practically then this could be the job for you. Your ability to influence leaders to create a proactive safety and wellbeing culture to get the best out of their teams, through coaching and development, to achieve our strategic goals will be your true measure of success. You will be motivated in bringing out the best in people and have the tenacity to work through the challenges that come with taking people on this journey. Your ability to stay calm in a crisis is critical whilst using your highly developed communication skills to build and maintain strong relationships and commitment to safety and wellbeing, this could be your next exciting move. §Working at Wintec§In return for your expertise and energy, we offer a flexible working environment where people respect each other and work together, take responsibility, and focus on quality in everything they do.§Wintec continues to be one of the leading tertiary institutes by fostering an innovative and forward thinking organisation. Our team works to stay abreast of the fast-changing world of technology and industry practice. For an energetic self-starter looking for a fast-paced working environment, Wintec is the place to be.§Closing Date: There will be no closing date for this position and the advert may be removed without notice - applications will be reviewed as received and you are encouraged to submit your application as soon as possible. Applications close when position is filled.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Human Resources and Payroll Administrator Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50605683.txt	§Human Resources and Payroll Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Resources and Payroll Administrator§§Advertiser: §INSIDE Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Human Resources and Payroll Administrator §      §        §          §Agricultural not-for-profit§          §New and exciting HR team§          §Career growth opportunity, make the role your own§        §        § §        §Established in 2013, OSPRI is a not for profit organisation existing in partnership between primary industries and the Government. It is an integrated service provider, providing end to end disease management expertise at a national level, protecting and enhancing the reputation of New Zealand’s primary industries.§        § §        §As OSPRI moves through the implementation phase of a new and improved operating model, driven by a newly appointed Chief Executive and Board, nothing is more important now than the continued development and success of their people. Following the successful recruitment of the HR Business Partner and a Senior Human Resources Advisor, OSPRI are now searching for a Human Resources and Payroll Administrator to deliver operational payroll processing and broad HR coordination and support to the wider team.§        § §        §As the new HR and Payroll Administrator, you will have primary responsibility for the successful management and running of OSPRI’s fortnightly payroll process. You will produce informative dashboard reports and provide meaningful analytics for the business, utilising tools such as PowerBI, relating to all matters HR and payroll. Using this information, you will work with the team to identify and introduce process and efficiency improvement across the function. You will also play a critical role in the preparation and implementation of a new payroll system, as part of the broader HRIS implementation early next year. Beyond Payroll, you will become the ‘engine room’ of the HR team, providing coordination and administrative support towards recruitment, remuneration, performance management, policy development and L&D.§        § §        §OSPRI are looking for a customer focused HR and Payroll administrator to join a growing, fun and enthusiastic HR team. You will bring at least 1-2 years of hands on experience managing payroll processes, allowing you to hit the ground running when you start. You will have clear competency working with Microsoft suite, ideally with experience in PowerBI and/or strong Microsoft Excel skills. As part of a small team you will work with and support all areas of the business, so you will need strong communication and relationship management skills. OSPRI are outcome focussed, however believe in having fun at the same time; as the key support person in the team, you will be someone that can navigate the enjoyable, people facing elements of the role, along with the busy administration components.  §        § §        §As the Human Resources team at OSPRI grows in line with the broader expansion of the organisation, there is now a need for either an up and coming HR professional with experience in payroll management, or an established HR and payroll administrator looking for a new challenge.§ §        §To submit your application, please ‘Apply’ now. For a confidential discussion please call Jeremy McLeod on §(04) 974 8490§.§        §Please note all applications will be acknowledged electronically. Applications for this role close on Monday 12th October at 5pm.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Agricultural not-for-profit§ §New and exciting HR team§ §Career growth opportunity, make the role your own§ § § §Established in 2013, OSPRI is a not for profit organisation existing in partnership between primary industries and the Government. It is an integrated service provider, providing end to end disease management expertise at a national level, protecting and enhancing the reputation of New Zealand’s primary industries.§ § § §As OSPRI moves through the implementation phase of a new and improved operating model, driven by a newly appointed Chief Executive and Board, nothing is more important now than the continued development and success of their people. You will produce informative dashboard reports and provide meaningful analytics for the business, utilising tools such as PowerBI, relating to all matters HR and payroll. Using this information, you will work with the team to identify and introduce process and efficiency improvement across the function. You will also play a critical role in the preparation and implementation of a new payroll system, as part of the broader HRIS implementation early next year. Beyond Payroll, you will become the ‘engine room’ of the HR team, providing coordination and administrative support towards recruitment, remuneration, performance management, policy development and L&D.§ § § §OSPRI are looking for a customer focused HR and Payroll administrator to join a growing, fun and enthusiastic HR team. You will bring at least 1-2 years of hands on experience managing payroll processes, allowing you to hit the ground running when you start. You will have clear competency working with Microsoft suite, ideally with experience in PowerBI and/or strong Microsoft Excel skills. As part of a small team you will work with and support all areas of the business, so you will need strong communication and relationship management skills. OSPRI are outcome focussed, however believe in having fun at the same time; as the key support person in the team, you will be someone that can navigate the enjoyable, people facing elements of the role, along with the busy administration components.  § § § §As the Human Resources team at OSPRI grows in line with the broader expansion of the organisation, there is now a need for either an up and coming HR professional with experience in payroll management, or an established HR and payroll administrator looking for a new challenge.§ § §To submit your application, please ‘Apply’ now. We are a market leader in the home garden and horticulture industry, supplying retail products to independent garden centres and big box DIY retailers.§  §We currently have a great opportunity for a proactive and experienced generalist HR Manager to join our busy Mt Maunganui based team. §  §The role§  §This role provides true business partnership and support across the full range of HR services to our leaders and our staff.  As part of the Senior Leadership Team, reporting to the MD, this sole charge role ensures that all aspects of HR practices and processes are delivered efficiently and effectively to drive employee engagement and business performance. You will have proven experience in developing HR Strategy, but still like to keep your hands busy doing-the-doing.  In charge of your own day you will have autonomy and accountability.§  §The key responsibilities of the role are:§ § §timely and accurate HR advice and support to the business;§ §development of an HR Strategy to support and drive business goals;§ §ensuring compliance with Employment legislation & keeping up to date with Employment law;§ §management of the Performance Evaluation Process;§ §management of Talent & Succession Planning§ §development & review of Policy & Procedure;§ §the management of the end to end recruitment and onboarding process;§ §the management of all HR administration;§ §supporting Health & Safety across the business;§ §The ideal person will:§ § §have 5+ years proven HR generalist experience;§ §an in-depth working knowledge and understanding of NZ employment legislation;§ §proven experience developing and executing HR plans and initiatives;§ §proven experience in providing business partnering with managers in the delivery of HR advice and processes;§ §have excellent communication skills;§ §strong relationship building skills;§ §be a positive and proactive team player; § §be self-motivated and results orientated.§ §This role is a permanent part-time position working 25+ hours per week – there is some flexibility around the hours and when they are worked for the successful person.§  §The successful applicant will be required to undergo a pre-employment drug and alcohol test. Tui is a safety sensitive site operating random drug testing.§  §Applications close Wednesday 7th October 2020.§Applicants for this position should have the legal right to work in New Zealand.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobTitle: Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) Facilitator Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50608554.txt	§Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) Facilitator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) Facilitator§§Advertiser: §Brannigans Consulting Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) Facilitator §      §        §Our Client§        §RX Plastics (RXP) are part of Aliaxis, a global organization employing over 16,000 people worldwide. Aliaxis are proud manufacturers of brands such as Marley, RXP, Dux and Dynex. The RXP main factory is in Tinwald, Ashburton and comprises two areas making plastic pipe and tanks, and running three shifts. They dispatch their orders through dedicated Warehouse teams (one based in Tinwald and the other in Hornby).  For further information please go to §www.rxplastics.co.nz§        §The Role§        §Reporting to the GM RX Plastics with functional reporting through to the NZ HSE Facilitator your key responsibilities will be to bring sound, practical HSE knowledge to the business and implement programs to develop and support the safety leadership capability of line managers and supervisors. The role will influence and engage the team to ensure everyone is safe at work, the HSE system is sound, a positive safety culture is in place and people hold themselves and others to account for HSE. Ensuring the JSEA’s and risk assessments are working well and utilising the application of ISO14001 within the manufacturing environment are key accountabilities. In addition, you will be responsible for ensuring the maintenance of the Global Aliaxis NZ policies regarding health, safety and environment.§        §Skills and Experience§        §To be successful in this role, you will have at least 5 years’ experience in a senior HSE role along with a formal qualification in an occupational health and safety related field and preferably be ICAM trained.  Practical experience of permit to work systems, JSEAs and risk assessments are a must along with the knowledge of how to apply ISO14001 in a busy manufacturing environment. Your outstanding interpersonal skills and the confidence to influence and engage with others will set you apart. You will also be resilient, have excellent attention to detail and be able to hold yourself and others to account.§        §To Apply§        §Opportunities like this don’t often arise.  If you feel you possess the above qualities please click the ‘Apply’ button and upload your cover letter and CV. Initial enquiries are welcome by phoning Carole Peterson on §03 345 8751§ or Amanda Hance on §03 345 8754§.§        §Applications for this role close 5pm Tuesday 13 October 2020§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Our Client§ §RX Plastics (RXP) are part of Aliaxis, a global organization employing over 16,000 people worldwide. Aliaxis are proud manufacturers of brands such as Marley, RXP, Dux and Dynex. The RXP main factory is in Tinwald, Ashburton and comprises two areas making plastic pipe and tanks, and running three shifts. They dispatch their orders through dedicated Warehouse teams (one based in Tinwald and the other in Hornby).  For further information please go to §www.rxplastics.co.nz§ §The Role§ §Reporting to the GM RX Plastics with functional reporting through to the NZ HSE Facilitator your key responsibilities will be to bring sound, practical HSE knowledge to the business and implement programs to develop and support the safety leadership capability of line managers and supervisors. The role will influence and engage the team to ensure everyone is safe at work, the HSE system is sound, a positive safety culture is in place and people hold themselves and others to account for HSE. Ensuring the JSEA’s and risk assessments are working well and utilising the application of ISO14001 within the manufacturing environment are key accountabilities. In addition, you will be responsible for ensuring the maintenance of the Global Aliaxis NZ policies regarding health, safety and environment.§ §Skills and Experience§ §To be successful in this role, you will have at least 5 years’ experience in a senior HSE role along with a formal qualification in an occupational health and safety related field and preferably be ICAM trained.  Practical experience of permit to work systems, JSEAs and risk assessments are a must along with the knowledge of how to apply ISO14001 in a busy manufacturing environment. Your outstanding interpersonal skills and the confidence to influence and engage with others will set you apart. You will also be resilient, have excellent attention to detail and be able to hold yourself and others to account.§ §To Apply§ §Opportunities like this don’t often arise.  If you feel you possess the above qualities please click the ‘Apply’ button and upload your cover letter and CV. Initial enquiries are welcome by phoning Carole Peterson on §03 345 8751§ or Amanda Hance on §03 345 8754§.§ §Applications for this role close 5pm Tuesday 13 October 2020§§§§

jobTitle: Recruitment Advisor Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50609429.txt	§Recruitment Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Advisor§§Advertiser: §Southern District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§§Dunedin Hospital§§Permanent in-house recruitment opportunity§Fun, friendly team environment§Become a trusted advisor managing end to end recruitment§This isn't just another recruitment job, this is a chance to use your skills to find top talent AND make a difference to the health of your community and our wider region!§About us§Here at the Southern DHB, we put our patients, families and whanau at the centre of everything we do. That includes bringing in the right talent to make sure that their needs are met; and that's where you come in.§You will be joining a friendly, hard-working team, dedicated to providing excellent service to managers and candidates alike throughout the recruitment process. Whilst each advisor manages their own portfolio, we work well as a team offering support when needed.§About the opportunity§We are looking for a skilled, motivated and positive team member to bring their passion for recruiting and building relationships into this busy and rewarding role. As a trusted Recruitment Advisor, you will be responsible for managing the end to end recruitment process for the Senior Medical Officer (SMO) portfolio across the Southern DHB.§Whilst this role is largely autonomous, you'll work closely alongside a specialist recruitment coordinator who will help you with the relocation of many of your overseas candidates. Together you will work quickly and efficiently, ironing out issues and making things happen across a number of vacancies and candidates at any one time.§This role has a New Zealand wide network of recruiters across the DHBs where you can at times contribute to projects at a national level. Your role will also involve creating sourcing strategies to achieve the short and long-term hiring goals often within hard to fill areas.§You'll have the ability to offer expert advice across campaign planning, the hiring process and ultimately finding the right person for the job. Being able to organise and prioritise your time effectively; and build strong relationships to work confidently alongside senior candidates and DHB management will be strengths of yours.§About you§If you're experienced in the world of recruitment, and looking to use your skills in a busy and rewarding in-house recruitment role, this could be the role for you!§Our ideal candidate will have the following:§Proven recruitment experience preferably in either an in-house or agency environment - or both!§Experience in pro-actively sourcing candidates to meet business needs§Knowledge and experience of campaign planning and successful advertising initiatives§Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships at all levels of the organisation§A passion for providing exceptional candidate care throughout the recruitment process§The ability to prioritise effectively and self-manage your time§Adaptable style and a positive attitude§Your commitment to customer service will ensure the candidate experience is positive, memorable and consistent.We would prefer you to have significant recruitment expertise, and an interest in health care would be a bonus.§You'll receive full training in our systems and processes and a full handover, so when you start working independently you'll be able to hit the ground running. As this is a district-wide role, you will provide support to managers in Dunedin, Invercargill and Queenstown; travel between these locations will be required at times.§This is a great opportunity to join a friendly, dedicated team. If you think you fit the bill, and would enjoy recruiting in a complex and varied health care environment, we'd love to hear from you!§Why Southern?§Now is a great time to relocate to Southern if you were considering a move! The Southern district offers the benefits of excellent amenities, first class primary through to tertiary education, and outstanding recreational opportunities. Whether it is surfing, kayaking or sailing; skiing, hunting or fishing; theatre, live-music or art - there's literally something for everyone. Check out §https://southernhealthcareers.nz/§ for what the region and we can offer you and your whanau.§Closing date: Wednesday, 14 October 2020.§For further information please contact Sarah Burgess, Recruitment Advisor - Corporate Directorate on §(03) 470 9021§.§Pre-employment occupational health assessment§In the interests of protecting our people and our patients, all appointments will be subject to an Occupational Health Assessment to confirm suitability and fitness to work in the role you are being considered for.§To apply§We only accept online applications. Please apply via our website: §www.southernhealth.nz§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Regional Sales & Relationship Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50609431.txt	§Regional Sales & Relationship Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Sales & Relationship Manager§§Advertiser: §Madison Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Agency§§§§§§This is a truly unique role, sitting across two of New Zealand’s best known recruitment businesses, Madison and AbsoluteIT, who operate as part of the AWF Madison Group. This role will develop key client relationships and drive strategic sales initiatives across the Auckland region. §With an extensive client network and NZ’s largest recruitment business behind you, this is the opportunity for an experienced recruiter or sales leader to take the next step. As a group, we’re committed to transforming the ideals of traditional recruitment and this role will be an integral part of changing the perception of what services we offer.§Key responsibilities include:§§Develop and execute an effective sales plan with a focus on Madison and Absolute IT§Build relationships with relevant organisations to obtain tenders and influence proposals§Coach internal staff on effective client relationships, business development, and account management§Identify growth sectors, and develop a sales strategy to target those sectors§Uncover new opportunities and market gaps outside of traditional recruitment§Engage existing team in overall sales strategy and process§About you:§You will live and breathe the recruitment industry and be driven by fostering long-lasting partnerships. Your strong commercial acumen and ability to hold strategic conversations at all levels paired with your understanding of the recruitment market will excite you about driving innovative changes across multiple businesses. You must be able to work well autonomously and as part of a team, whilst demonstrating leadership capability while contributing to company culture.§While we’re open to previous work history, your background will ideally include:§A proven track record of agency recruitment and sales/business development experience§Responding to RFPs and RFIs§Training and development of staff§Developing sales strategies§Why you should apply:§§Work for a Kiwi-owned NZX listed business§Report directly to the General Manager§Work autonomously as part of the leadership team§Ownership of sales and client relationships across Auckland§If you’re up for a challenging, yet exciting and rewarding opportunity, email your CV and cover letter to §april.lynch@madison.co.nz§ quoting reference #89346§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We are currently looking for an experienced Recruitment Consultant to help expand our service offering.  Ideally we are looking for candidates that have the following attributes§        §          §Proven recruitment experience, preferably in a Property Related field§          §Previous Real Estate or Property Management experience §          §Self-motivated & dedicated to the task §          §Good network or client base§        § This role is suitable for an existing and high achieving Consultant ready to take the "next step" in their career or one who requires more flexibility.  This is not a role for someone just wanting a "pay cheque" §The role on offer includes§        §          §Work from Home - you choose the place, the days & hours§          §Commission Only - No Base Salary - opportunity to earn more §          §No targets or KPI's (we do have minimum expectations)§          §Dedicated Portfolio - with no restrictions on what you can recruit§          §Full support - we have great systems and process in place§          §Proven Success - we'll show you how to be successful§          §No desk or ongoing costs are payable§          §Reasonable outgoings reimbursed §        § If you're currently working in Recruitment, then give me a call to compare your current billings and commission against our offering.  Whilst we don't pay a base salary, we do have a tiered commission structure that rewards your success and designed to put more money in your pocket.  An OTE of $150,000 is very achievable (and would be a minimum expectation) and you'll be paid a greater percentage of the commission earned (based on general industry standards).  § §If you believe you have "what it takes" then feel free to make contact to discuss more. § § If you're interested in finding out more then please apply on-line or give Matt Hunter a call on 021 321115.  I look forward to hearing from you soon§      §      §Matt Hunter§021 321115 §    §    §  §§§REAP Recruitment provides a Recruitment Service to the Real Estate and Property Industry. jobTitle: HR Manager Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50611329.txt	§HR Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Manager§§Advertiser: §Rata Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§The Company§ §A family owned organisation who can be proud of their innovation and transformation over the years.  There are always exciting times within this business as they evolve and progress with the changing landscape.  Longevity is prominent throughout; this speaks volumes for a company who know their people are key to the ongoing success. Reporting through to a knowledgeable, successful and supportive GM who will ensure you have the tools needed to deliver great HR work.  A professional but relaxed culture, there are so many positives for the successful candidate to get excited about.§ § §The Opportunity§ §This sole charge generalist, operational and hands on HR Manager role offers variety plus.  Ultimately your role will be to ensure all aspects of human resources for NZ are delivered to a high standard.   Ensuring the HR strategic plan is prepared, implemented and reviewed, your role will be to ensure it is having the effect needed against business objectives. § §Your position will focus on positive deliverables around:§  § §Management of employment processes§ §Sound knowledge of NZ employment relations § §Advising Managers on operational HR issues§ §Policy & procedure development and review§ §Internal corporate communications§ §Management of performance appraisals§ §Supplier management§ §Adhoc projects§ §   §The Individual§ §Your generalist HR knowledge and experience will be appreciated, and you will also learn and develop your commercial knowledge along the way. § §In charge of your own day, you will have autonomy and responsibility, but always with the guidance if needed of a superb leadership team.  You must possess the drive and motivation to achieve the HR objectives set, be commercially astute but most importantly know how to partner with a business and their Managers to ensure its success – this is absolute key.§ §Your presence makes a huge difference to this business, ensuring you feel valued and appreciated throughout.  §Rata Recruitment§Specialise in providing expert, talented personnel on a contract and permanent basis, to clients throughout New Zealand’s technical industries.§Rata Recruitment will process and manage your personal data confidentially and securely. Our policies and processes ensure we act in accordance with 'The Privacy Act 1993' and in-line with definitions outlined by 'The Office of the Privacy Commissioner'.'§If you would like to find out more about this role, or how we can assist in your next career opportunity, please make contact or visit our website on www.ratarecruitment.co.nz§§§§

be polished in your ability to work as part of a senior team, and have enough business acumen to enable you to navigate the organisation and identify how to create more value through people.  § §You will not be shy of rolling your sleeves up; will be as comfortable in the conceptual as the actual and motivated by finding creative and pragmatic solutions.§ § § §Why us?§ §The College believe great things happen in the every day, every task an opportunity to make a difference. They are a humble bunch that get satisfaction from helping others succeed.§ §The College  believe their strategy has huge opportunity for all involved in their business – whether it’s growth or the opportunity to make an even greater impact for all New Zealanders, or the ability to learn from their experience and celebrate their success.§ §They are a people business – it is their people who make the greatest difference to the people of NZ.  They value their time, talent and insight and are as committed to ensuring the College has as positive an impact on their lives.§ §Ki te hunga e āta whakaaro ana ki te tuku i te pukapuka tono mō te tūranga nei. He Kāreti tēnei e kaingākau ana ki te reo me ngā tikanga Māori. Mehemea e manawanui ana koe ki te āwhina i te Kāreti ki te whakatutuki i te mana hauora taurite, tēnā koa tukua mai to tono.§ §Next steps§ §To express your interest in this opportunity, please click the 'Apply Now' button below and attach your CV and a cover letter.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a human resources manager?§How many years' experience do you have with change management?§Have you completed a qualification in human resources (HR)?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of employment & workplace relations?§§§

jobText: TXT/50612717.txt	§People and Culture Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People and Culture Consultant§§Advertiser: §The People Project§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§The People Project was founded out of an aspiration to do something bigger than ourselves by genuinely helping Kiwi businesses with their people matters. We are a specialist Human Resources Consulting business and partner with organisations across New Zealand to provide them with the support and guidance that is suitable to their unique culture. We pride ourselves on our modern, simple and commercial approach with a long-term commitment to our relationships with our clients.§ §We are stoked that our business is growing because it means our network of contractors we love to partner with is also growing! We are looking for another like minded HR Specialist to join us for 10 hours a week initially as we continue to build an incredible business that we are proud of.§ § § §What we are looking for:§ §This is a 100% flexible position, we are looking for someone that is after minimum 10 hours a week with the potential to increase over time.  § §Due to the nature of our work and our client’s needs we want to see true generalist’s with a minimum of 5 years’ experience working in either a corporate or SME environment dealing with stakeholders at all levels ideally in an HR business Partner level or above.§ §This role will be doing a mix of Employment Relations, Change Management, Leadership Coaching Recruitment, Policy work. We are a full service HR offering and we do everything for our clients from more administrative tasks to strategic work so you need to be comfortable doing it all, that’s why our clients love us and why we are so embedded in their businesses.§ §This is a role that requires someone to be able to manage a lot of moving parts, with shifting deadlines while managing multiple stakeholders. Being organised and backing yourself is critical to be successful in this role.§ §What is most important to us is that you have strong relationship building skills and high levels of Emotional Intelligence, credibility and commercial acumen. We don’t do transactional consulting we pride ourselves on our long-term relationships, high standards and service.§ §Our consultants work across clients in manufacturing, FMCG, Tech, Financial Services, Not for Profit, Public Sector and Services so you will gain exposure to a broad range of stakeholders and people matters.§ §In return you will be offered an opportunity to grow your career, stretch your learning and work in a trusting, fun and open environment where you can be yourself.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§§§

jobTitle: Payroll Project Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50613170.txt	§Payroll Project Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Payroll Project Manager§§Advertiser: §Infinitas Talent§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Other§§§§§§We have a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Payroll Project Manager to lead the implementation of a new payroll system for this large and established New Zealand business in the healthcare sector.§  § We are looking for someone that has experience of implementing payroll systems for multi-site operations as well as someone who has experience of transformation and stakeholder management.  You will be managing the software provider and project managing the whole transition from the old payroll system to the new system. It is vital that you have a strong understanding of New Zealand payroll legislation and can define the project scope, goals and deliverables and well as lead the implementation.§  § Specific responsibilities of the role include:§ § §Lead the planning and management assigned project§ §Define project scope, goals and deliverables§ §Define project tasks and resource requirements§ §Plan and schedule project timelines§ §Provide direction and support to project team§ §Monitor and report on progress of the project to stakeholders§ §Implement and manage project changes and interventions to achieve project outputs§ §Project evaluation and assessment of the results§ § The company has a large and varied workforce with a mix of salaried and waged staff. This role could suit experienced HR Project Managers or project managers with payroll implementation experience.§  § The company is at the beginning stage of a positive transformation project that allows for significant improvements to be made across the business and this role is seen as critical to the continued success of the organisation.§  § Although a contract position, we are looking for someone to make improvements and work with the highly talented and capable business unit leaders across the company to continue driving a high performing culture.§  § This is a fast-paced business that will need someone to be forward thinking and be able to handle high workloads during this crucial period for the business. It is an exciting opportunity that will be challenging but highly rewarding and will see you work closely with a high performing senior leadership team and working across the business.  §  § You will be reporting into the commercial and programme manager who wants to give you the autonomy to deliver on projects and lead the business on the journey to make them more efficient.  §  § This role is initially a six-month contract but could be extended.§  § Please apply to the role online, or if you have any questions please call Jason on §09 218 6127§§§§

The role works alongside senior leaders and the EPA Board to set the direction for Health, Safety and Wellbeing to deliver a comprehensive suite of initiatives, hazard and risk management, governance reporting and audits.§  §Under the currently COVID-19 situation, this role is pivotal in providing advice to Senior Management and leading the response to keep staff safe and well during the pandemic.§  §The role also manages our Business Continuity and Emergency Management Programme along with the physical security requirements for the EPA, ensuring we have robust systems, processes and protocols in place, in case we need them.§  §This role also looks after our people in the field ensuing their safety while working in a regulatory setting with Hazardous Substances and New Organisms, and public engagement activities.§  §About you§  §We’re after someone who has a flexible and agile working style, fantastic organisational skills, and is excellent at managing relationships.§  §Other skills include:§ § §Senior level experience in the Health, Safety and Wellbeing field§ §Business Continuity and Emergency Management experience, specifically in; jobText: TXT/50614921.txt	§Senior Learning & Development Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Learning & Development Advisor§§Advertiser: §Te Aho o Te Kura Pounamu –The Correspondence School§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Senior Learning & Development Advisor §      §        §        §        §        §      §    §    §      §        §Senior Learning & Development Advisor§        §Permanent§        §Full Time (1.0 FTE) (40 hours)§        §Based in Wellington §        §Tackle a role with variety and challenge.§        §          §Join a passionate, fun team of HR professionals§          §A chance to bring your creativity, passion, ideas & juggling skills and experience§          §An opportunity to grow and develop, this role is suited to a "self-starter"§        §        §Te Aho o Te Kura Pounamu (Te Kura) is New Zealand's largest school. With over 12,000 students (from early childhood to young adults) at any point in time and over 23,000 over a school year, most of whom live in New Zealand. As a Big Picture school we provide personalised and authentic learning programmes through distance education from early childhood level to NCEA Level 3, including to young adult and adult learners.§        §Our vision is to enable our students to achieve their educational and personal goals, empowering them to become engaged and contributing members of their communities.§        §With nearly 600 kaimahi (staff) located throughout New Zealand, most are Kaiako (teachers) and approximately 130 are specialist and support kaimahi including managers and an additional 120 learning support kaimahi. §        §The HR team supports our kaimahi and leaders by walking alongside them, providing advice and support. Working on a range of issues and challenges, your advice will span all aspects of Learning and Development. While there are some opportunities to develop your  instructional design (Captivate) skills, the main focus of the role is to collaborate with our leaders and subject matter specialists to identify, then source and implement learning products and programmes, while always looking at learning investment. You will ensure the Learning and Development is user friendly, clear, concise, logical and be a superb influencer. §        §We promise you variety, growth opportunities, great team members who have your back and above all, be in a team that loves cake!§        § §Who are you?§        §          §You value people and kindness, and are passionate about learning and delivering excellent results§          §You believe in the value of strong, positive, trusting teams who work together as one§          §You have proven experience in people development with a track record of designing and delivering learning and education solutions for adult learners§          §You are organised, plan ahead, set priorities, meet deadlines and attend to the details§          §You have an open and fresh approach, inclusive and collaborative style and the desire to provide innovative learning solutions and are willing to give new tools and technology a try§          §You practice "win win" and have superb influence and negotiation skills§          §You build strong relationships and networks with people at all levels to ensure the best outcomes§          §As a resilient person you will keep going, even when there may be bumps along the way and will show composure under pressure§          §Comfortable with developing and delivering training in virtual or face to face sessions, either yourself or by collaborating with internal or external providers§          §Demonstratable ability in using development tools e.g. Adobe Captivate, Desire2Learn (LMS), Salesforce Knowledgebase§          §You have a love of learning and seek out opportunities to learn new skills, new technologies and keep up-to-date with the latest Learning Developments§          §You have a qualification and/or experience in teaching adult learners§          §Knowledge/familiarity or a commitment to learn/understand Te Ao Maori§        §        §If this sounds like you, and you are looking to join a forward thinking, innovative organisation, apply now!§        §Listen to Mike Hollings [link removed] our Chief Executive, talk about the school and check out our 360 Virtual Tours [link removed].§        §To apply, click the Apply button. All applications must be submitted via our online process and the role is open only to candidates eligible to work in New Zealand. §        §Please note that we will be shortlisting candidates as we receive applications and may close the vacancy if suitable candidates are identified prior to the closing date.§        §For more information click on the position description below, or contact Lynn McKenzie, Manager, Human Resources on 027 2256237§        §Applications close 5.00pm, Monday 12 October 2020§        § §        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Senior Learning & Development Advisor§§Permanent§§Full Time (1.0 FTE) (40 hours)§§Based in Wellington §Tackle a role with variety and challenge.§§Join a passionate, fun team of HR professionals§A chance to bring your creativity, passion, ideas & juggling skills and experience§An opportunity to grow and develop, this role is suited to a "self-starter"§§Te Aho o Te Kura Pounamu (Te Kura) is New Zealand's largest school. With over 12,000 students (from early childhood to young adults) at any point in time and over 23,000 over a school year, most of whom live in New Zealand. As a Big Picture school we provide personalised and authentic learning programmes through distance education from early childhood level to NCEA Level 3, including to young adult and adult learners.§Our vision is to enable our students to achieve their educational and personal goals, empowering them to become engaged and contributing members of their communities.§With nearly 600 kaimahi (staff) located throughout New Zealand, most are Kaiako (teachers) and approximately 130 are specialist and support kaimahi including managers and an additional 120 learning support kaimahi. §The HR team supports our kaimahi and leaders by walking alongside them, providing advice and support. Working on a range of issues and challenges, your advice will span all aspects of Learning and Development. While there are some opportunities to develop your  instructional design (Captivate) skills, the main focus of the role is to collaborate with our leaders and subject matter specialists to identify, then source and implement learning products and programmes, while always looking at learning investment. You will ensure the Learning and Development is user friendly, clear, concise, logical and be a superb influencer. §We promise you variety, growth opportunities, great team members who have your back and above all, be in a team that loves cake!§ §Who are you?§§You value people and kindness, and are passionate about learning and delivering excellent results§You believe in the value of strong, positive, trusting teams who work together as one§You have proven experience in people development with a track record of designing and delivering learning and education solutions for adult learners§You are organised, plan ahead, set priorities, meet deadlines and attend to the details§You have an open and fresh approach, inclusive and collaborative style and the desire to provide innovative learning solutions and are willing to give new tools and technology a try§You practice "win win" and have superb influence and negotiation skills§You build strong relationships and networks with people at all levels to ensure the best outcomes§As a resilient person you will keep going, even when there may be bumps along the way and will show composure under pressure§Comfortable with developing and delivering training in virtual or face to face sessions, either yourself or by collaborating with internal or external providers§Demonstratable ability in using development tools e.g. Adobe Captivate, Desire2Learn (LMS), Salesforce Knowledgebase§You have a love of learning and seek out opportunities to learn new skills, new technologies and keep up-to-date with the latest Learning Developments§You have a qualification and/or experience in teaching adult learners§Knowledge/familiarity or a commitment to learn/understand Te Ao Maori§§If this sounds like you, and you are looking to join a forward thinking, innovative organisation, apply now!§Listen to Mike Hollings [link removed] our Chief Executive, talk about the school and check out our 360 Virtual Tours [link removed].§To apply, click the Apply button. If applying from an external site you will be taken through to our Careers Website, where you can view a detailed position description, as well as complete an online application form and attach your CV and cover letter. All applications must be submitted via our online process and the role is open only to candidates eligible to work in New Zealand. §Please note that we will be shortlisting candidates as we receive applications and may close the vacancy if suitable candidates are identified prior to the closing date.§For more information click on the position description below, or contact Lynn McKenzie, Manager, Human Resources on 027 2256237§Applications close 5.00pm, Monday 12 October 2020§ § § §§§§

jobTitle: Systems & Technology Trainer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50614966.txt	§Systems & Technology Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Systems & Technology Trainer§§Advertiser: §EnviroWaste Services Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§Our employees tell us that they enjoy our 'family-like' team environment and value the company's commitment to growing our teams, technology infrastructure and customer base which all combined make us one of NZ’s leading waste service providers. §As the Company grows, and we’re quickly reaching 1000 employees & our teams progress, we have a need for a §Systems and Technology§ §Trainer§ to join our Corporate Technology team. §This is a true support role, working with all stakeholders where you will be an expert in our systems, processes and technology used nationwide. Success will be§Taking full ownership of the training right from writing & creation of training resources, roll out and delivering it.§Understanding different needs, catering for different learning styles and able to implement training via various platforms i.e. webinar, classroom training, manuals or one-on-one’s §Following up after training and assessing further needs§Ensuring training material is easily accessible and able to be interpreted by all employees§In a multifaceted organisation, some of the systems we use are Microsoft 365 suite, D365 F&S and CRM, Power BI, and a custom created Weighbridge software. §Your experience will show you are§A skilled trainer who can easily break down complex systems and deliver training in a way that users can easily understand §Confident and able to deliver training via various platforms, and capture feedback and cater to differing personalities (whether it is a Manager, Driver or Customer Service Representative) §Competent with learning new systems, but already have working knowledge of Windows 10, Office 365 Suite, SharePoint and some knowledge of D365 is preferred but not essential§Able to create new training material, or develop on existing for best outcomes §Able to utilise Power BI dashboards to report on training carried out, and further needs of the business§If you wish to apply for this position, please click apply now and complete the online application form and submit an updated copy of your CV.  We look forward to receiving your application!§Safety and well-being are paramount to us, so our recruitment process involves a Ministry of Justice criminal background check, and a pre-employment medical including drug test. You must also be eligible to work in NZ (either as a New Zealand Citizen or Resident or have a valid working visa) to apply for this role.§§§§

jobTitle: Safety, Security and Wellbeing Manager Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50621030.txt	§Safety, Security and Wellbeing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Safety, Security and Wellbeing Manager§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Reporting to the Chief People and Culture Officer, you will lead proactive safety and security strategies through visible leadership and partnership across the Council, including working closely with our Executive Leadership Team and Elected Members. Alongside your team of dedicated Safety, Security and Wellbeing Team, you will be accountable for the development and delivery of strategies and initiatives that build and maintain a strong and capable Safety, Security and Wellbeing culture across Council. You will be responsible for driving the organisational maturity to support the Council's safety journey through coaching, enabling and assisting people leaders champion health and safety throughout the organisation. Collaborating with the People and Culture Group, you will operationalise the wellbeing strategy which your team and you will co-design with the Culture and Capability Team.§This role requires a forward thinking, delivery-focussed person who is comfortable working in a very complex and high-risk organisation. You will be focussed on uplifting the capability and ownership of our operational leadership teams in ensuring good practice of health, safety, security and wellbeing so that the Council meets and where practicable exceeds its obligations under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015 and other related Regulations.§As a senior leader in the People and Culture Group you will drive and support the People and Culture's Group mission of "Working in partnership across the Council to create a high performing, secure, safe, happy and healthy workplace for all, enabling out people to deliver great services to our communities". Because you will be a team player and someone who is known for their collaborative way of working, you will also help drive the forward momentum of the Catalyst model that the Group has adopted to deliver exceptional customer service and high performing professionals.§What are we looking for?§A relevant tertiary qualification or equivalent skills and experience§Proof of understanding of health and safety and related employment legislation§Demonstrated experience in the management and provision of safety security and wellbeing services and systems to a diverse and complex organisation§A proven track record of achievement in collaboration and integration in a political, or similar environment§Significant experience in developing and fostering stakeholder relationships both internal and external.§Knowledge and experience with the ACC Partnership Programme§Proven ability to conduct investigations, using ICAM methodology.§Development of performance reporting, measurement and research programmes.§Exceptional written, visual and oral communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to present well- crafted detailed analysis and arguments.§Proven ability to manage and deliver in a changing and pressured environment§To enable you to deliver, you will need to demonstrate your commitment to the Council's values in everything you do including:§He Tangata, he tangata, he tangata - We put people at the heart of what we do§Whakapai ake - We're always improving§Mahi Ngātahi - We collaborate§Mana tiaki - We care for our places.§Please see attached job description for more information. All applications must be submitted online.§If you have any questions please contact Aleena Antony, Talent Acquisition Partner at §aleena.antony@wcc.govt.nz§. Applications close §11 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We're down to earth. We're smart and curious. We are people obsessed. We understand.§ §Classic Group is the umbrella company to a number of businesses, including one of New Zealand's largest residential builders, Classic Builders.§ §With the overarching purpose being to shape opportunities into a better everyday life for people, each business within the Group is geared towards taking smart ideas and creating innovative, sustainable businesses that have a positive impact.§ §Our success is through the tenacity of our people – the heart of our business. It all starts with you.§ §Reporting to the People and Culture Manager, our new Coordinator's main gig is to contribute to the smooth operation of the P&C team by:§ § §Coordinating recruitment and onboarding activities across the Group§ §Preparing documents like employment agreements and variations§ §Maintaining accurate files and spreadsheets§ §Looking after P&C team communications, and managing enquiries through the inbox§ §Coordinating wellbeing and benefits§ §Providing back up to payroll§ §Contributing to team projects and initiatives§ §This is a full-on role with plenty of experience and growth on offer for those who pick things up quickly and are hungry to learn.§ §We're a small team and things can get really busy, so you'll need to be a huge team player and a bit of a Jackie Chan with your reflexes! As well as being really organised, you'll need to have strong communication skills and an ability to build relationships and rapport quickly.§ §You'll need some HR experience behind you already, and preferably some knowledge of payroll/payroll related legislation. You'll also need to be tech savvy and comfortable learning new programmes as we are in the early stages of implementing an HRIS.§ §If you are ready to be part of a ground-breaking and supportive environment, this is the role for you.§ §Core to what we do at Classics is our values, so if these resonate well with you and the way you like to work, you'll fit in fine:§ § §We care§ §We work as one team§ §We are daring§ §We deliver excellence§ §Hit that 'apply' link today! We're excited to meet you.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a human resources coordinator?§How many years of recruitment experience do you have?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Remuneration Analyst - 12 months maternity cover Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50621586.txt	§Remuneration Analyst - 12 months maternity cover§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Remuneration Analyst - 12 months maternity cover§§Advertiser: §The Warehouse Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Remuneration & Benefits§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Remuneration Analyst - 12 months maternity cover §      §        §When it comes to retail, competition, technology and shifting economies have changed the way Kiwis shop.§        §For TWG to thrive in this ever-changing environment, we’re going Agile to ensure our customers always come first.  One of the first steps to becoming an agile organisation is rethinking our structure. We’re saying goodbye to silos and traditional business structures to allow room for faster decision-making, improved communication and empowered, cross-functional teams to thrive. By doing this we unlock collaboration, productivity and speed to market so we can adapt quickly to ever-changing customer needs.§        §The Role§        §HR is not an area you might typically associate with advanced analytics, but here at The Warehouse Group we're out to break that mould. Our vision is to build world class advanced analytics around People that will drive actionable insights for our business leaders around recruitment, health & safety, performance management and workforce planning.§        §Your key responsibilities will be:§        §          §To provide expert remuneration consultation & service to the business§          §Managing the remuneration analysis and reporting §          §Helping the HR team with our annual performance and remuneration reviews and incentive scheme management §          §Complete any remuneration projects as required for the business§        §        §About You§        §You are passionate about data. You're the type person who gets excited about different and unique data sets and all the ways that they could be used to provide business insight that is relevant and digestible.§        §You're a story teller, the data is your subject, and you can adjust your story to suit any audience from advanced data geeks like yourself right through to the most analytically challenged. §        §Our new structure and ways of working will see you extensively work cross functionally hence your collaboration skills will be top notch, coupled with the customer centric lense and approach you bring to work everyday. You are someone responsive, adaptable and has a continuous improvement approach towards what you do. You will have a test and learn mindset and hold an openness to new ideas and a desire to develop them together with others.§        §You're also great at the following:§        §          §A sound understanding of HR legislation in regards to remuneration.§          §Strong SQL & Excel skills§          §Your ability at operating effectively within a large, fast-paced organisation – having a background in retail is beneficial but not essential.§          §Clear, effective written and verbal communication skills.§          §Resilience, and strong stakeholder management skills.§          §A real drive and passion for people and doing the right thing.§          §Have sound judgement and strong values§        §        §What's in it for you? §        §We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story.  By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work! §      §    §    §twg.co.nz§  §§§When it comes to retail, competition, technology and shifting economies have changed the way Kiwis shop.§  §For TWG to thrive in this ever-changing environment, we’re going Agile to ensure our customers always come first.  One of the first steps to becoming an agile organisation is rethinking our structure. We’re saying goodbye to silos and traditional business structures to allow room for faster decision-making, improved communication and empowered, cross-functional teams to thrive. By doing this we unlock collaboration, productivity and speed to market so we can adapt quickly to ever-changing customer needs.§  §The Role§  §HR is not an area you might typically associate with advanced analytics, but here at The Warehouse Group we're out to break that mould. Our vision is to build world class advanced analytics around People that will drive actionable insights for our business leaders around recruitment, health & safety, performance management and workforce planning.§  §Your key responsibilities will be:§ § §To provide expert remuneration consultation & service to the business§ §Managing the remuneration analysis and reporting § §Helping the HR team with our annual performance and remuneration reviews and incentive scheme management § §Complete any remuneration projects as required for the business§ §About You§  §You are passionate about data. You're the type person who gets excited about different and unique data sets and all the ways that they could be used to provide business insight that is relevant and digestible.§  §You're a story teller, the data is your subject, and you can adjust your story to suit any audience from advanced data geeks like yourself right through to the most analytically challenged. §  §Our new structure and ways of working will see you extensively work cross functionally hence your collaboration skills will be top notch, coupled with the customer centric lense and approach you bring to work everyday. You are someone responsive, adaptable and has a continuous improvement approach towards what you do. You will have a test and learn mindset and hold an openness to new ideas and a desire to develop them together with others.§  §You're also great at the following:§ § §A sound understanding of HR legislation in regards to remuneration.§ §Strong SQL & Excel skills§ §Your ability at operating effectively within a large, fast-paced organisation – having a background in retail is beneficial but not essential.§ §Clear, effective written and verbal communication skills.§ §Resilience, and strong stakeholder management skills.§ §A real drive and passion for people and doing the right thing.§ §Have sound judgement and strong values§ §What's in it for you? §  §We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story.  By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work! §§§§

jobText: TXT/50622171.txt	§Senior Recruitment Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Recruitment Advisor§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Recruitment Advisor §      §        §Downer New Zealand is a leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment to building long term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions; the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart. §        §We have a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Senior Recruiter to join our team! §        §Our Infrastructure Projects division is a project led business, which operates across a number of sectors including road and rail, water, power, education, and defence infrastructure. As the focus for infrastructure development changes, portability of skills becomes more important and the challenge is to match our capability with the needs of our customers.§        §Talent attraction using bespoke, fit-for-purpose sourcing strategies and talent pipelining including proactively approaching candidates will be the main focus in this newly created role. You will be able to design and implement a comprehensive candidate engagement strategy which enhances the end-to-end lifecycle of talent mobility, and create a vision that engages our internal stakeholders. The role will also provide an end-to-end recruitment service to the business. Our team works hard for our clients by developing effective and meaningful people and culture strategies which actually work.§We are on the hunt for an energetic, experienced and proactive §People and Culture Professional.§ We are looking for someone to fit into our dynamic, and vibrant workplace here at Strategy Collective.§Located in the historic White Hart building in New Plymouth, Strategy Collective is an environment where exceptional people with common aspirations and a commitment to excellence can thrive. Our business takes a collaborative approach to help engage, empower and excite our clients. With capabilities across People and Culture (HR), Brand and Marketing, and Accounting, we integrate client strategies and vision across all business functions.§  §THE ROLE:§  §The People and Culture Consultant will be accountable for providing clients with high-level Human Resource and Organisational Development consultancy services. The role will be responsible for maintaining existing relationships and developing new business contacts which align with the strategic objectives of Strategy Collective.§ § §Provide clients with advice, coaching, and support on all general People and Culture matters.§ §Identify and implement initiatives aimed at improving People and Culture services within our client groups.§ §Collaborate with other People and Culture Consultants to implement projects and initiatives.§ §Develop and provide relevant workshops on topical People and Culture practices to a market of clients.§ §Identify opportunities for business transformation/improvement and creating high-performance business value for the client, and then implement initiatives for organisational change.§ §THE PERSON:§ § §Minimum tertiary qualification in the relevant field of Human Resources, Psychology, Business Management, or Industrial / Organisational Psychology.§ §A minimum of 7 years’ experience in providing generalist advisory on a wide range of complex People and Culture services.§ §Accreditation in leadership development or team diagnostic tools would be beneficial.§ §You will be highly analytical and strategic in your approach.§ §Demonstrated ability to build and develop outstanding relationships with clients, stakeholders, and colleagues.§ §Advanced knowledge of NZ Employment legislation.§ §A proactive approach to People and Culture.§ §Accredited in psychometric assessment (desirable)§ §Strong attention to detail and a confident communicator.§ §Collaborative in style and bursting with enthusiasm.§ jobTitle: Remuneration and Benefits Lead Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50624281.txt	§Remuneration and Benefits Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Remuneration and Benefits Lead§§Advertiser: §Hamilton City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Remuneration & Benefits§§§§§§At Hamilton City Council we are re-shaping the way we work.  Our great river city is buzzing: we are growing fast with our biggest ever capital spend planned, and embracing new initiatives that make a difference to our community. §  §The People, Safety and Wellness team plays an important role in this journey and as a result, we are seeking an experienced Remuneration and Benefits Lead to join our team on fixed-term 12-month contract covering maternity leave.§  §The Role:§  §Reporting to the People, Safety and Wellness Manager and leading a team of three, this role is responsible for the design and implementation of our remuneration, rewards and reporting programs to support key organisational strategies aligned to the Council’s high- performance framework. Other key accountabilities include:§ § §Develop and deliver the remuneration strategy and employee benefits programme.§ §Be a key member on the project team to design and implement a new HRIS system.§ §Lead the reward and recognition programme.§ §Lead and rollout the annual performance review cycle through the HR Business Partners.§ §Oversee position management ensuring data is correct and of high quality, and the integrity of the establishment schedule is maintained.§ §Monitor remuneration trends and review market data to benchmark the Council’s practices and programmes.§ §Manage the job evaluation processes ensuring the integrity of the system.§ §Reporting and metrics which are meaningful to managers, creating dashboards, data integrity and audit reports while providing analysis and commentary§ §Lead the payroll function, reviewing processes and aligning to best-practice methodologies.§ §About you:§  §We are looking for an individual with a high level of professional knowledge and experience in contemporary remuneration and benefit practices, payroll systems, legislation and market practice and be equipped with the skills to re-define the way we work in this space. In addition, proven leadership skills, excellent analytical and data analysis skills along with a positive mindset to drive transformation are key attributes we are looking for.§  §To be successful in this role, you will have five to 10 years’ experience in a similar role in medium to large organisations.§  §About us:§  §Hamilton City Council is committed to being an organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together. This is your chance to be part of the team that is committed to building a more vibrant, attractive and prosperous city.§  §The recruiting range for this role starts at $100,000 per annum and can be negotiated for the right candidate in accordance with skills, knowledge and experience.§  §For a copy of the position description, please click § HERE§.§  §If this role sounds like it’s for you, we would love to hear from you. Make it happen and apply online today!§  §Applications close 11 October 2020.§  §All candidates will be notified of the outcome on their application via email. Short-listed candidates may be required to complete an interview process (including testing), reference checks, pre-employment medical, drug and alcohol assessments, credit check and a Ministry of Justice or Police vetting check.§  §Please note this role is being sourced directly and we are not accepting applications via external recruitment agencies. §Only people who are eligible to work in New Zealand should apply. Evidence will be required.§§§§§
