jobText: TXT/50624792.txt	§L&D Project Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§L&D Project Manager§§Advertiser: §Alexander James Construct§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §L&D Project Manager §    §    §      §What we're looking for:§It’s an exciting time to be joining this market leading company; with a number of significant projects forecasted to be delivered by 2022 and as a result many of these new initiatives will be supported by an innovative framework of Learning & Development requirements. As such we are looking for a L&D Project Manager to join the team on a 2 yr. fixed-term project.§ This is a unique opportunity to Scope, plan, and deliver projects, including the selection and implementation of an E-Learning system that can deliver a suite of business needs, within agreed parameters of cost, timescales, and quality.§ §The Role:§        §          §Be the subject matter expert for selection and build of the Learning Management System.§          §Risk identification, assessment and management.§          §Design, facilitate and evaluate programmes, workshops and team building events, drawing on knowledge of adult learning theories, various training design methods and using IT technologies to provide commercial L&D solutions§          §Provide learning support to Departments/ Groups/ Teams that will help implement the firm's strategy.§          §Carry out training needs analysis as required and develop and implement training programmes using appropriate resources, including e-resources, to match identified needs.§          §Research and design innovative learning interventions to meet the company’s needs including learning and webinar technology e.g. multi-channel and blended learning.§          §Work closely with other teams to support company-wide projects and initiatives that fall within the L&D arena.§          §Apply inclusion and diversity principles to the delivery L & D solutions, activities, and decisions to build and nurture a diverse workplace.§          §Effectively communicate relevant project information to management§        § §Skills and Experience:§ You’ll have substantial experience delivering both technical and non-technical programmes and projects. You’ll possess strong interpersonal and communication skills, ensuring end user outcomes form a considered part of decision making.§ You will be a skilled project manager who is passionate about delivering a great product. With previous experience working on a wide range of strategic projects, with both a technology and business focus.§        §          §Designed and developed programmes from idea to successful delivery§          §Managed learning projects§          §Worked with e-resources and used technology to achieve L&D objectives§          §Understanding of Learning Management Systems including reporting§          §Experienced facilitator both face to face and in a virtual world§          §Strong stakeholder management skills and experience§        § The right candidate will need to be comfortable working independently, collaborating with teams in various locations and managing a portfolio of concurrent projects. The role is ready to be appointed, please submit your cv and cover letter in Word Format. Contact: Toni Lea, §toni@alexanderjames.co.nz§.§      §      §Toni Morice §    §    §  §§§What we're looking for:§It’s an exciting time to be joining this market leading company; with a number of significant projects forecasted to be delivered by 2022 and as a result many of these new initiatives will be supported by an innovative framework of Learning & Development requirements. As such we are looking for a L&D Project Manager to join the team on a 2 yr. fixed-term project.§ This is a unique opportunity to Scope, plan, and deliver projects, including the selection and implementation of an E-Learning system that can deliver a suite of business needs, within agreed parameters of cost, timescales, and quality.§ §The Role:§ § §Be the subject matter expert for selection and build of the Learning Management System.§ §Risk identification, assessment and management.§ §Design, facilitate and evaluate programmes, workshops and team building events, drawing on knowledge of adult learning theories, various training design methods and using IT technologies to provide commercial L&D solutions§ §Provide learning support to Departments/ Groups/ Teams that will help implement the firm's strategy.§ §Carry out training needs analysis as required and develop and implement training programmes using appropriate resources, including e-resources, to match identified needs.§ §Research and design innovative learning interventions to meet the company’s needs including learning and webinar technology e.g. multi-channel and blended learning.§ §Work closely with other teams to support company-wide projects and initiatives that fall within the L&D arena.§ §Apply inclusion and diversity principles to the delivery L & D solutions, activities, and decisions to build and nurture a diverse workplace.§ §Effectively communicate relevant project information to management§ § §Skills and Experience:§ You’ll have substantial experience delivering both technical and non-technical programmes and projects. With previous experience working on a wide range of strategic projects, with both a technology and business focus.§ § §Designed and developed programmes from idea to successful delivery§ §Managed learning projects§ §Worked with e-resources and used technology to achieve L&D objectives§ §Understanding of Learning Management Systems including reporting§ §Experienced facilitator both face to face and in a virtual world§ §Strong stakeholder management skills and experience§ § The right candidate will need to be comfortable working independently, collaborating with teams in various locations and managing a portfolio of concurrent projects. jobText: TXT/50625797.txt	§IT Recruitment Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§IT Recruitment Consultant§§Advertiser: §Comspek International Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §IT Recruitment Consultant §      §        §Comspek International is a Kiwi-owned and operated specialist Telco and IT recruitment consultancy with offices in Auckland and Wellington. Due to our continued success, we are looking to welcome a couple new Recruitment Consultants to our Wellington team. You might have one or two years of experience in specialist ICT recruitment, or have been in B2B Sales or Consulting and are looking to kick off your career in a new industry. Whichever you are, you will be hard working, personable, and resilient and interested in not just building long-term relationships, but also in utilising your excellent influencing, advising, and sales skills.§        § §        §What you will do day to day:§        §You will be working on sourcing for roles from our wide range of clients and finding the best candidates to fill them. Utilising a number of different strategies, you will be calling applicants who mail in, using social media such as LinkedIn and other search techniques to find and engage with top-notch candidates, scouring our very large internal database and cold-calling referrals, and utilising your growing professional network to find appropriate candidates. You will then be expected to meet, submit and coach any successful candidates through the interview and placement process, in a genuine consultative manner. §        § §        §As a Recruiter with Comspek, you will be expected to meet and ideally exceed monthly targets by building relationships from scratch and delivering for our clients to enable mutually beneficial outcomes. §        § §        §What makes us different:§        §Our flexibility§        §Many recruitment agencies bind their resourcers under tight guidelines on which client or job type they can work on, limit them to either contract or permanent roles only, and stop them from working on positions outside of their geographical jurisdiction.§        §Working as a Recruiter for Comspek you will have access to recruit on all jobs, under all Account Managers and clients, both contract and permanent and across any location. This enables you to maximise your network and your potential earnings.§        § §        §Culture of Teamwork§        §We have a stable management team that are still hands-on recruiters and mentors who love to see the team deliver for our amazing clients. We are looking for individuals with Passion, Drive, Discipline, Resilience, Positivity, and Enthusiasm to succeed in a fun and supportive environment. Our culture is one of open communication and full team effort. This opportunity is what you make it, and we give back what you put in.§        § §        §Our commission structure§        §We make it very attractive to work for Comspek. When you fill a position with Comspek you will enjoy a percentage of the billable for a permanent role or an ongoing percentage of the margin for a contract role, on every placement.§        § §        §If you are looking for your next recruitment opportunity or you're a sales professional with a genuine interest in People and Technology, please get in touch!§      §      §      §      §    §  §§§Comspek International is a Kiwi-owned and operated specialist Telco and IT recruitment consultancy with offices in Auckland and Wellington. Due to our continued success, we are looking to welcome a couple new Recruitment Consultants to our Wellington team. You might have one or two years of experience in specialist ICT recruitment, or have been in B2B Sales or Consulting and are looking to kick off your career in a new industry. Whichever you are, you will be hard working, personable, and resilient and interested in not just building long-term relationships, but also in utilising your excellent influencing, advising, and sales skills.§  § §  §What you will do day to day:§  §You will be working on sourcing for roles from our wide range of clients and finding the best candidates to fill them. Utilising a number of different strategies, you will be calling applicants who mail in, using social media such as LinkedIn and other search techniques to find and engage with top-notch candidates, scouring our very large internal database and cold-calling referrals, and utilising your growing professional network to find appropriate candidates. You will then be expected to meet, submit and coach any successful candidates through the interview and placement process, in a genuine consultative manner. §  § §  §As a Recruiter with Comspek, you will be expected to meet and ideally exceed monthly targets by building relationships from scratch and delivering for our clients to enable mutually beneficial outcomes. §  § §  §What makes us different:§  §Our flexibility§  §Many recruitment agencies bind their resourcers under tight guidelines on which client or job type they can work on, limit them to either contract or permanent roles only, and stop them from working on positions outside of their geographical jurisdiction.§  §Working as a Recruiter for Comspek you will have access to recruit on all jobs, under all Account Managers and clients, both contract and permanent and across any location. This enables you to maximise your network and your potential earnings.§  § §  §Culture of Teamwork§  §We have a stable management team that are still hands-on recruiters and mentors who love to see the team deliver for our amazing clients. We are looking for individuals with Passion, Drive, Discipline, Resilience, Positivity, and Enthusiasm to succeed in a fun and supportive environment. Our culture is one of open communication and full team effort. This opportunity is what you make it, and we give back what you put in.§  § §  §Our commission structure§  §We make it very attractive to work for Comspek. When you fill a position with Comspek you will enjoy a percentage of the billable for a permanent role or an ongoing percentage of the margin for a contract role, on every placement.§  § §  §If you are looking for your next recruitment opportunity or you're a sales professional with a genuine interest in People and Technology, please get in touch!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

Power BI is also available§ §Ability to manage broad stakeholder groups across HR, Finance, and Payroll.§ §   § Data is provided from the Finance and Payroll team and your role will be to turn this into a suite of meaningful reports to provide insights for the management team.  You will be an experienced analyst with an understanding of HR metrics, keen attention to detail, and the ability to work at pace with a broad stakeholder group.§   §   § For more information, please contact Nick Logan or Hattie MacLennan at Emergent & Co Ltd on §09 359 9033§ during office hours.  § It is a requirement that you must already hold an NZ Passport or valid working visa to apply for this role.  §For more information on Emergent & Co Ltd please visit www.emergent.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Senior HR Advisor Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50628156.txt	§Senior HR Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior HR Advisor§§Advertiser: §Need Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Industrial & Employee Relations§§§§§§Publicly listed company; care at the forefront of what they do! §Varied role with heavy reliance on ER skill set and experience within unionised environments   §Convenient CBD/fringe location; some off street parking; easy access to public transport   §§ §§This vacancy has now been placed.  Should you need any support with a resume review/LinkedIn profile tips, please do make contact.  Thank you for your interest in this opportunity.   §§ §This is a fabulous contract opportunity to showcase your generalist HR skill set.  As the interim senior in the HR team your experience and know-how will be called upon.  Strengths working within a high volume environment, the intricacies of ER/HR regulations and exposure working within a unionised environment will be essential.  My client is in need of an intelligent and assertive professional.  A self-managing self-starter with the ability to work independently will be important as will be your ability to nurture a small team.  We do need a warm consultative style; a passionate HR professional with patience and care.  Highly organised, excellent time management skills with meticulous attention to detail – this is a great role and one you will take a great deal of satisfaction from.  We do need high efficiency, ability to juggle and superior communication skills to all stakeholder relationships.      §  §An organisation whose primary focus and commitment is to support our community in the healthcare sector, your compassion and support will see you become one of the team in no time.  We need your expertise! § §You may be looking to add value and shine on a new platform over short term contract.  You may well be between roles with this contract “playing” to your strengths.  Do not delay and apply today (almost an immediate start).  §   §Call Tara Fisher on 021 940 298 for a confidential chat or click “apply”. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50629273.txt	§Regional Human Resource Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Human Resource Manager§§Advertiser: §OCS Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$75,000 - $84,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Internal§§§§§§OCS Wellington is currently recruiting for a Human Resource Manager to join our team! Located in Ngauranga and over 300 staff in Wellington – OCS is a leading company in the service industry, that prides itself on providing quality services and account management within the Commercial Cleaning Sector.§ §Our services include commercial cleaning, special services, confidential document disposal, facilities services management § §The Opportunity§ §Reporting to the General Manager – Central Region, we are looking to appoint an experienced HR Manager to provide the first line of general Human Resources support for the region. You will be responsible for implementing and maintaining best practice in OCS HR and Health & Safety Policies and Objectives while maintaining a flexible approach to problem-solving, to meet the needs of your internal client base. HR experience particularly in an Operations environment would be advantageous. § §Key Responsibilities§ § §Recruitment and Retention§ §Administration & Documentation§ §Employment Relations§ §Transfer of Undertaking§ §Induction & Training§ §Labour Management§ §Health & Safety§ §Injury Management§ §Participate in special projects required to improve HR/Recruitment Information and strategy from time to time.§ §To carry out any other reasonable and related duties required by the department to ensure the recruitment and customer objectives are met.§ §To undertake any other tasks as may be reasonably required to assist the company in achieving its business objectives§ §About you - Skills and Experience§ § §3 years of HR experience particularly in an operations environment§ §A strong recruitment background with at least 3 years' minimum experience in a similar role§ §Good interpersonal skills & ability to communicate with people of all levels§ §You will have exceptional attention to detail and strong written and verbal communication skills and be able to build strong relationships at all levels of the business.§ §A team player and the ability to be adaptable and resilient in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment is a necessity. This is a great opportunity for you to play a significant role in providing excellent recruitment solutions and HR support § §You’ll have energy and enthusiasm and be ready to use your initiative and step up.§ §To be considered for the position, candidates will be required to undergo a Ministry of Justice & Police clearance check to verify a clear criminal record, must prove their eligibility to work in New Zealand.§ §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§ §Apply Now§ §If this sounds like you then we want to hear from you!§ §Apply by emailing your CV to  Regional HR Manager §Natalia.Whangapirita@ocs.co.nz§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§How many years of recruitment experience do you have?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Chief Advisor: Culture and Development Job in Gisborne - SEEK
email: If you are interested in this position please submit your application via the Seek website, or if you would like further information or a full job description please contact Gillian Gibson at gillian@gilliangibson.co.nz
jobText: TXT/50630434.txt	§Chief Advisor: Culture and Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Chief Advisor: Culture and Development§§Advertiser: §Gillian Gibson Consulting Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gisborne§, §Gisborne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Organisational Development§§§§§§Chief Advisor Culture and Development§ § §Exciting new senior organisational leadership role§ §Values –based organisation ‘People are at the heart of everything we do'§ §Make a positive impact supporting the people of the Tairāwhiti region thrive§ §Mō te tūnga | About the role§  §This is an exciting time for us and to support our strategic plans and the huge programme of work we have to deliver, we are lifting our organisation development capability and creating a new role to lead and implement initiatives that will make a difference to our culture and employee experience.         §  §You will drive thought leadership and build leadership and organisational capability, aligned with our organisational vision and values of Piritahi Tairāwhiti.§  §Your key focus will be to design, develop, and embed cultural initiatives and engagement strategies that shape Council’s culture to ensure we can deliver on business strategy and our cultural aspirations.    You will coach and support others and design and facilitate learning and development activities to strengthen our culture and capability.   §  §Your leadership will help us as a region on our journey of growing and promoting the wellbeing of our community and people. §  §Mōu | About you § § §You will understand culture and behaviour and know how best to develop people and organisational culture to deliver strategic outcomes for the organisation by: transforming the organisation to become more customer focused and efficient; and building a high performance organisation which supports the achievement of organisational strategies.§ §You will be:  § §Highly skilled at relationship building, influencing and coaching people and able to assist an organisation to bring vision to life through practical implementation§ §A pragmatic advisor that our Leaders can trust§ §A strong, direct, open, and honest communicator, someone who builds effective working relationships and credibility with a wide range of people and cultures§ §Innovative, learning oriented, demonstrating passion and energy to take on the challenges of the role and be results and outcome focused.§ § § §You will bring knowledge and experience working with Iwi and/or the ability to converse in Te Reo Maori would be desirable in this role. As a minimum, applicants must have a basic knowledge of working with tangata whenua and have a willingness to learn. § §Mō mātou | About us§  §Gisborne District Council are the proud winners of the 2019 LGNZ Excellence Awards, recognising our work in growing and promoting the well-being of our community and people. §  §As an organisation, our vision is Piritahi Tairāwhiti (making our people proud).  And, as a region, Tairāwhiti has plenty to be proud of with beaches, bush, surf, and lakes on our doorstep, creating the perfect setting for lifestyle, wellbeing, and outdoor adventure. With a variety of cafés, sports clubs, vineyards, entertainment, shops and well-equipped parks, there’s something here for everyone.  What’s more, with all you need at your fingertips, long daily commutes are a thing of the past and the drive to work will barely leave you time to drink your morning coffee.   In addition to a great place to live and work, we offer a flexible approach to work, a supportive and diverse work culture, and relocation support. §  §If you are interested in this position please submit your application via the Seek website, or if you would like further information or a full job description please contact Gillian Gibson at gillian@gilliangibson.co.nz§§§§

jobTitle: Health & Fitness for Work Partner Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50630474.txt	§Health & Fitness for Work Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health & Fitness for Work Partner§§Advertiser: §C3 Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Health & Fitness for Work Partner §      §        §C3 Limited is a market leader in New Zealand’s port related product handling, adding value to its clients’ business by providing solutions to their logistics needs.  C3 Limited employ over 1200 staff in 13 locations across New Zealand and is part of the Linx Cargo Care Group.§        §Reporting to the GM Health, Safety, Environment and Risk, this position will work on a daily basis with our operational and HSER teams to improve the workforce’s resilience and overall wellbeing. The role will manage, support, develop and transform C3's health and injury management with proactive return to work practices, including the delivery of accurate and efficient claims management. Ideally this position would be based in one of our larger branches in Tauranga, Auckland or Wellington, however flexibility may apply for the right candidate. The successful applicant will be required to develop and maintain health management processes, systems and strategies to improve individual outcomes for workers injured at work and away from work.§        §This role will contribute to the development and implementation of Health and Wellbeing initiatives across the business and manage Fitness for Work requirements including drug & alcohol management, fatigue management and occupational health exposures. There will also be the opportunity for involvement in broader HSER activities and initiatives, expanding the scope of the role as capacity allows.§        §To succeed in this position you will have sound computer skills and administrative abilities for case management, reporting and data analysis as well as being highly organised and able to work autonomously.§        §To be considered for this position you will require:§        §          §Experience in injury management and/or ACC - ideally working with industry to achieve sustainable return to work outcomes for workers §          §Sound knowledge of and commitment to medical evidence and leading practice in injury management§          §A relevant tertiary qualification preferably in Allied Health is desirable §          §Experience in managing fitness for work components such as drug & alcohol management   §          §Experience and/or skills in implementing scalable systems and processes for a geographically diverse workforce is desirable. §          §Strong written and verbal communication skills§          §Experience and/or skills in interacting with medical and allied health professionals is desirable§          §A collaborative approach to building relationships with our operations and support services§          §Knowledge of relevant legal requirements for case management of ACC/ medically managed injuries§          §Experience/exposure to the ports/logistics/forestry industry would be preferable§        §        §If you want to build your career with a progressive company that offers opportunities to develop and grow then we would like to hear from you. Please submit a recent CV that clearly demonstrates how your skills and experience meet the requirements of this position.§        §Applications close 08 October 2020.§      §      §      §    §    §Apply online at §www.c3.co.nz/careers§ §  §§§C3 Limited is a market leader in New Zealand’s port related product handling, adding value to its clients’ business by providing solutions to their logistics needs.  C3 Limited employ over 1200 staff in 13 locations across New Zealand and is part of the Linx Cargo Care Group.§Reporting to the GM Health, Safety, Environment and Risk, this position will work on a daily basis with our operational and HSER teams to improve the workforce’s resilience and overall wellbeing. The role will manage, support, develop and transform C3's health and injury management with proactive return to work practices, including the delivery of accurate and efficient claims management. Ideally this position would be based in one of our larger branches in Tauranga, Auckland or Wellington, however flexibility may apply for the right candidate. The successful applicant will be required to develop and maintain health management processes, systems and strategies to improve individual outcomes for workers injured at work and away from work.§This role will contribute to the development and implementation of Health and Wellbeing initiatives across the business and manage Fitness for Work requirements including drug & alcohol management, fatigue management and occupational health exposures. There will also be the opportunity for involvement in broader HSER activities and initiatives, expanding the scope of the role as capacity allows.§To succeed in this position you will have sound computer skills and administrative abilities for case management, reporting and data analysis as well as being highly organised and able to work autonomously.§To be considered for this position you will require:§Experience in injury management and/or ACC - ideally working with industry to achieve sustainable return to work outcomes for workers §Sound knowledge of and commitment to medical evidence and leading practice in injury management§A relevant tertiary qualification preferably in Allied Health is desirable §Experience in managing fitness for work components such as drug & alcohol management   §Experience and/or skills in implementing scalable systems and processes for a geographically diverse workforce is desirable. §Strong written and verbal communication skills§Experience and/or skills in interacting with medical and allied health professionals is desirable§A collaborative approach to building relationships with our operations and support services§Knowledge of relevant legal requirements for case management of ACC/ medically managed injuries§Experience/exposure to the ports/logistics/forestry industry would be preferable§If you want to build your career with a progressive company that offers opportunities to develop and grow then we would like to hear from you. Please submit a recent CV that clearly demonstrates how your skills and experience meet the requirements of this position.§Applications close 08 October 2020.§§§§

jobTitle: Senior Medical Officer Locum Recruiter Job in Northland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50630693.txt	§Senior Medical Officer Locum Recruiter§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Medical Officer Locum Recruiter§§Advertiser: §Northland District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §Northland District Health Board staff have big hearts and a strong commitment to provide high quality health care to our diverse community. Through our work we get to make a real difference, enhance our skills and further our professional development. Working in a friendly, supportive environment and living in the sub-tropical north is an added bonus.§    §      §Senior Medical Officer Locum Recruiter §      §        §Northland DHB is committed to a system that is Tiriti (Treaty) based and one that actively and purposefully invests in equitable outcomes for its Māori population. §        §Northland DHB recognises Māori as tāngata Whenua (first peoples) of New Zealand and have prioritised Māori health. We understand our Te Tiriti o Waitangi obligations in relation to: §        §          §Stewardship §          §Iwi/Māori health development §          §Equity §          §Mātauranga Māori (Māori knowledge and expertise) §        §        §This role offers the opportunity for someone with a wide range of proven administrative skills to work and support all aspects of our in-house Locum recruitment function within a challenging and stimulating Health Board environment. §Volume recruitment demands two things from a recruitment process: efficiency and consistency. This is a fast paced role requiring exceptional multi-tasking and the ability to meet strict deadlines. The role works closely with Service Managers and Recruitment agencies to successfully secure Locum coverage to meet District Health Board demands. Working within recruitment, you will follow well established systems and methods to generate a smooth recruitment process for both the organisation and candidates. §Applicants need to be extremely process driven, with a keen eye for detail and the ability to apply themselves consistently and methodically to their work. Previous experience in recruitment would be advantageous. §As the successful applicant you will have the following attributes: §        §          §Excellent computer literacy skills. §          §Strong organisational skills, ability to work autonomously as well as a team player.§          §Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written enabling good working relationships. §        §        §If you have the above attributes, this role could be for you. Ideally this position would be based in one of our larger branches in Tauranga, Auckland or Wellington, however flexibility may apply for the right candidate. The successful applicant will be required to develop and maintain health management processes, systems and strategies to improve individual outcomes for workers injured at work and away from work.§        §This role will contribute to the development and implementation of Health and Wellbeing initiatives across the business and manage Fitness for Work requirements including drug & alcohol management, fatigue management and occupational health exposures. jobText: TXT/50632277.txt	§Senior Human Resources Consultant - Findex§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Human Resources Consultant - Findex§§Advertiser: §Findex§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Southland§, §Invercargill§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§About us §Findex is one of Australia and New Zealand’s leading providers of integrated financial advisory and accounting services.  We have a network of more than 2500 employees located in over 110 offices, over 250,000 clients and approximately $17 billion funds under advice.§Our Findex Human Resources and Health & Safety Consulting team provides a range of HR related services to our external clients including; recruitment services, HR and H&S advisory and specialist employment investigations. §About the Role§An exciting opportunity now exists to join our Invercargill team in the role of Senior HR Consultant. We require an expert in senior level recruitment, who will provide guidance to our diverse range of clients.  §We partner with our clients across the recruitment process from start to finish including:§  §Creating professional job descriptions that include key competencies and skills required§  §Conducting remuneration reviews §  §Advising on relevant advertising platforms§  §Managing all candidate response§  §Providing regular professional reports on recruitment campaign success§  §Headhunting services §  §Creating competency based behavioural interview guides §  §Conducting formal interviews and providing insight to Managers and / or Boards§  §Conducting expert reference and psychometric testing and providing feedback to clients and candidates §  §Advising and creating employment offers and agreements§In addition to providing expert recruitment services the successful applicant will be interested in developing or expanding their generalist HR knowledge and able to advise clients on a range of topics, which may include; employment law, leadership development, performance development and HR policy and procedure. §About you §This role would suit an individual with external consultancy experience who wants to develop their technical HR knowledge. It may also suit an internal HR specialist who would like to move into a business advisory role. §The successful applicant must be proficient and confident at business development and relationship building, however our whole team approach and focus on growing existing client relationships will be a refreshing change of pace for those familiar with competitive sales environments.  §The successful applicant will possess:§  §A proven track record in recruitment – particularly with senior leadership roles.§  §Specialist and/or generalist knowledge in any other HR fields. §  §Previous experience in external consultancy services and/or a desire to drive new business opportunities. §  §A focus on personal professional development, with a willingness to develop your HR expertise. §  §A team-player attitude§What’s in it for you? §At Findex we are committed to our employees. We offer development programs and exciting career progression opportunities, in addition to a thriving social culture that includes monthly activities and events.§We also offer a flexible working model, with state of the art office facilities and meeting rooms, or work from home options for those that prefer flexibility. §The Findex HR and H&S Consultancy team is small and close-knit, with a focus on using our diverse skillsets to complete projects together. We have the added benefit of operating under Findex, a stable and well-resourced global operator. §Applications §Please apply online by uploading your resume and cover letter, alternatively for more information please contact Zachary Pentecost on 027 564 7144.§For a copy of the Job Description visit §HRaHS---Senior-HR-Consultant-PD-Invercargill---August-20.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50633180.txt	§Organisational Development Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Organisational Development Specialist§§Advertiser: §Southern District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Organisational Development§§§§§§HR Generalist§Dunedin or Invercargill§§Are you ready to specialise?§Use your generalist HR experience to benefit wider organisational strategy and objectives §District-wide focus based in Dunedin or Invercargill §§About us§The Southern DHB continues to invest in our people and this position is an opportunity for an experienced HR generalist with a focus and passion for organisational development. Under the Executive Director of People, Culture and Technology's care, guidance and sponsorship, the General Manager HR is working towards an integrated, fully functioning Human Resources team including increasing capacity and capability in Organisational Development. Our team purpose: §Enabling our People - to foster a valued, healthy and high performing workforce empowering our people to succeed§, clearly articulates our commitment to developing our organisation.§About the opportunity§You will be an integral part of achieving this, so we are looking for applicants who can demonstrate experience shaping, driving and implementing impactful people-centric organisational development initiatives within complex working environments§As a key contributor you have a wonderful opportunity to make a difference to our approach to Employee Engagement and Experience. You will be working side by side with our newly promoted Organisational Development Manager, our GM HR and wider team using your knowledge and experience across the full spectrum of organisational development practices and processes. This role will play an important part in helping us plan and implement a focussed OD strategy for Southern DHB and there will be many opportunities to explore this growing and rewarding field of HR. There is lots to do and we plan to have fun doing it!§We see the role being involved in implementing processes, programmes and practices that align with talent needs for the DHB, including, but not limited to:§Talent Assessment and Management§Leadership effectiveness and Coaching§Career Development and Succession planning§Training§Organisational Culture and Change§Reporting, Governance and Analytics.§About you§We would love to see experienced HR generalists who can demonstrate their resilience, aptitude and delivery, but ideally our successful candidate will have experience in the following:§Talent management processes§Change management support and facilitation§Track record of successful HR/OD delivery§Experience coaching, mentoring and facilitating individuals or groups§You should hold a relevant tertiary qualification (Social/Human Sciences, Human Resources Management, or Industrial Psychology or similar)§We work hard with minimal supervision and encourage fresh thinking and you will too. Above all, we live by and role model our organisational values of §Kind, Open, Positive§ and §Community§. This role has a district wide focus so the ability to travel is important.§If you think you might complement our team and want to make an impact, apply now!§Why Southern?§Now is a great time to relocate to Southern if you were considering a move! The Southern district offers the benefits of excellent amenities, first class primary through to tertiary education, and outstanding recreational opportunities. Whether it is surfing, kayaking or sailing; skiing, hunting or fishing; theatre, live-music or art - there's literally something for everyone. Check out §https://southernhealthcareers.nz/§ for what the region and we can offer you and your whanau.§Closing date: Sunday, 11 October 2020.§For further information please contact Sarah Burgess, Recruitment Advisor - Corporate Directorate on §(03) 470 9021§Pre-Employment Occupational Health Assessment§In the interests of protecting our people and our patients, all appointments will be subject to an Occupational Health Assessment to confirm suitability and fitness to work in the role you are being considered for.§To apply§We only accept online applications. Please apply via our website: §www.southernhealth.nz§Click here to view the role description§§§§

jobTitle: Business Partner Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50633796.txt	§Business Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Partner§§Advertiser: §ACC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§Opportunity to join a team passionate about supporting the business to drive organisational performance, while continuing to improve the employee experience§Diverse portfolio with the ability to work in the business and across the Talent Group§Flexible work environment, including the ability to WFH where it meets team and customer needs§ACC has been improving the lives of New Zealanders since 1974. With ACC, you'll be supporting people in Aotearoa to stay safe by minimising the incidence and impact of injury, as well as helping them recover from injury if an accident does happen. Join us - an organisation that grew out of bold thinking and has an enduring commitment to care for others at work, home and play.§As a Business Partner, you will partner with Enterprise Leaders to embed ACC's Talent strategy, enable organisational performance and drive strategic priorities. You will work directly with the business and across the Talent Group to drive initiatives that will improve the employee experience, increase leadership capability, improve our cultural competence and enable strong organisational performance.§To support one of our key organisational strategies, Whāia Te Tika, we are in the early stages of developing a programme of work for our people to build our Māori Cultural Competence. In the role of Business Partner, one of the areas you will work alongside the business on is implementing and embedding this programme of work, enabling the business to deliver Whāia Te Tika through our people. This is a great opportunity to apply your passion for Te Ao Māori in a role where you can support ACC to improve outcomes for Maōri through our people.§What we are looking for from you to be successful in this role is:§experience providing strategic HR advice at enterprise level within a large and complex organisation§a proven ability to communicate, influence and effectively engage with senior leaders to achieve business outcomes§experience driving change to enable the business to achieve strategic objectives.§As we look to improve our cultural competence as a function, we're looking for people who have a good knowledge of Te Reo and tikanga (or are passionate and keen to learn) to join our team, so we can support ACC to improve outcomes for Māori.§Working at ACC§To support an inclusive workplace, we have:§Employee networks: Pride@AC; Ability@ACC; Women's Network; Cross-Cultural Network; MIND Network§ACC's Māori Strategy, Whāia te Tika§Development opportunities in Te Reo Māori me ngā tikanga§Support Māori by partnering with iwi and other Māori entities.§Diversity and Inclusion Strategy and Approach§Advocates within the disability sector§Applications will run through to Friday, 9 October but please note that if an ideal candidate is found during this time we will move forward with screening and interviewing sooner.§Applications can only be accepted when submitted through our ACC Career Website or through Seek. We know diverse teams are stronger teams and we believe in fairness and opportunity for all.§Helping Aotearoa shape a better food world - Join us today!§Job Ref# 43587§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50635703.txt	§Employment Relations Adviser§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Employment Relations Adviser§§Advertiser: §Employsure§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Industrial & Employee Relations§§§§§§The opportunity§  §Employsure is ANZ's leading provider in Workplace Relations Advice. With over 27,000 small business clients, we are changing the way businesses look at their workplace relations and seek advice. §  §Now, more than ever, New Zealand business owners are in need of support to manage their obligations in a complex and ever-changing environment. Our Advice team is as the core of our service, guiding our clients through this challenging time by providing timely and expert advice.§Your role will be to respond to inbound advice queries via email and telephone, providing accurate and expert advice on disciplinary and performance management matters, dismissals, wage rates, discrimination in the workplace, bullying and harassment, work health and safety queries and many more workplace matters. Your ability to manage clients' expectations through difficult times will be paramount and your organisation and prioritisation skills are a must in the successful delivery of the world-class service that we offer.§  §What are we looking for?§As an Employment Relations Adviser, you’ll be capable of:§ § §Providing workplace relations advice by phone and email§ §Guiding our SME clients to manage their ER matters from strategy to execution§ §Communicating complex information or concepts to clients without using technical jargon§ §Providing timely and practical advice to clients from all industry types§ §Delivering industry-defining service by partnering with clients as a trusted Adviser§ § §The right person will have:§ § §Detailed and up to date knowledge of the national employment relations framework, together with relevant practical experience in providing professional quality advice across all workplace relations matters§ §Experience managing employee matters such as disciplinary action, redundancies and performance management from inception to completion§ §Proven capability in providing timely commercial advice to clients, together with excellent verbal and written communication skills being essential§ §Experience working in an advisory role in an employer association or trade union will be highly regarded§ §Qualifications in law, industrial relations or human resources are preferred§ § §We do we offer in return?§ § §Gain valuable ER knowledge and experience across a multitude of industries§ §Clearly defined career paths. Your career path starts with the Adviser role where you refine the fundamentals of ER, and the ability to provide timely advice to busy business owners.§ §Professional development opportunities to cross skill or specialise in WHS, Wages or our Product team or to work more closely with clients on highly complex and challenging ER issues.§ §Flexible working arrangements, including part-time, working from home, afternoon and evening shifts and even the flexibility to work around personal errands in full-time roles§ §Build your career within a supportive culture with leaders focused on supporting your ongoing professional development and success§ §Exciting, fast paced work environment with a motivated and driven workforce§ §Attractive remuneration to highly experienced ER professionals, immediately available and interested in joining us on a short term contract§ § §Why join Employsure?§  §Our vision is to Build Better businesses starting with our own. Employsure is committed to nurturing a diverse and inclusive culture of opportunity. We encourage applications from people of culturally diverse backgrounds, people who identify as LGBTQI+, people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait islander origin, and people with disabilities.§The opportunities are endless, with personal and professional growth being one of our top priorities. In addition, we offer our employees remarkable benefits. If you are looking for a role that can match your ambitions, we want to hear from you.§With a global track record of over 30 years of success, this is your chance to join an industry leader who prides itself on expertise and innovation at an exciting time in the Australian and New Zealand market.§Become a part of our exciting journey. Apply now.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in employee relations?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§§§

jobTitle: Recruitment Administrator | Fixed Term Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50639048.txt	§Recruitment Administrator | Fixed Term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Administrator | Fixed Term§§Advertiser: §Datacom§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§Our purpose§Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.§Our team§The Talent Acquisition team work together to fill and pipeline Talent across Datacom offices across New Zealand and Australia. Working as a remote team, we have team members across the board with specialisations across different technologies and skill sets. There's never a dull moment in the TA team as we're dedicated to proactively sourcing and seeking out the best talent to deliver our services. §About the Role§With a constant high number of vacancies to fill, we are looking for an enthusiastic administrator to support us on a fixed term basis, initially. You'll be tasked with everything from managing contracts for new employee's - as well as extending current ones, through to being the SME for our various recruitment systems and tools (Workable, X-Ref, Flare, Docu-Sign, HireVue). A document ninja, you'll use your initiative to hunt down the info you need, and make the lives of the TA team as easy as possible. We've embraced the hybrid working future, so this role will give you the option of working from home several days a week and we will even consider someone who would like to work part-time (afternoon's ideally). §This will be a 4 month, fixed-term contract initially.§What you'll do§Take responsibility for ensuring accuracy of all onboarding paperwork.§Manage new contracts and contract extensions§Implement processes to ensure nothing is missed and all relevant parties receive the right info at the right time§Run reports to show status and track Recruitment progress across the board.§Work with our systems/tool providers to manage issues, upgrades and new ways of doing things§Liaise with the wider business and other teams, such as payroll, when necessary. §What you'll bring§We are looking for an upbeat, positive individual who is keen to get stuck into any task. You'll be an excellent communicator, a sharp problem solver and the type of person who takes pride in your work and enjoys going above and beyond to find that perfect solution. §You're detail focused and you enjoy working with people - you've probably got the patience of a saint as you explain processes and train on systems. We use a number of different tools and technologies so it goes without saying you'll be tech savvy with a "learn on the go" attitude.§You don't necessarily need a recruitment background - perhaps you come from the HR side, or even a busy office administrator type of role. Whatever it may be, so long as you're a quick learner and have an interest in how recruitment for a large organisation can be done efficiently, we want to hear from you. §The Nitty Gritty§We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50640518.txt	§Recruitment Consultant §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Consultant §§Advertiser: §Alpha Recruitment - NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §      § §      §        §Recruitment Consultant §        §          §Alpha Recruitment is New Zealand owned and operated and has been established for more than 30 years. We now have 8 recruitment brands under the Alpha Group umbrella across Auckland and Wellington, and have exciting plans to expand further. Despite our growth Alpha still maintains a family business feel and the team is tight knit. We are proud winners of multiple Seek awards and last year were awarded Employer of the Year and the Supreme Winner Award at the prestigious Newmarket Business Awards. §          §Due to the growth at our Source HR & Recruitment site based in Onehunga we are  looking for our next superstar to join the team! This is a varied role and you will be recruiting for Scientific and Laboratory roles along with White and Blue Collar temps.§          §You will need to have previous Recruitment and Business Development experience ; what’s more important to us is a positive, can do attitude and open to learning, the ability to problem solve and act with urgency, previous experience in a sales environment is beneficial, a team player mentality and the ability to build solid relationships.§          §As a Recruitment Consultant at Source HR your typical day to day duties will include:§          §            §End to end recruitment activities – from gathering the client brief, advertising, shortlisting and presenting candidates, through to negotiating placements and follow up §            §Account management (nurturing your existing client relationships) and new business development (growing your client base)§            §Working collaboratively in a team environment, and always striving to do the ‘right thing’§          §          §If you are looking for your next role in recruitment this could be the ideal opportunity for you to join a supportive environment with a friendly and inclusive culture. Your team mates will help you through your bad days and celebrate your successes. KPIs are realistic and earning potential is high. Or, perhaps you have previous recruitment experience and you’re looking to avoid the treadmill of the big corporate model whilst still having access to the opportunities that come with a growing business. Either way, if the you have the attributes listed above and this sounds like it could be a fit for you we would love to talk to you. Apply today!§        §        §PO Box 99256 Newmarket, Auckland NZ§ Ph: §09 524 2336§ • Fax: §09 524 2794§ Email: Please click the 'Apply Now' button below. §      §      §    §  §§§Alpha Recruitment is New Zealand owned and operated and has been established for more than 30 years. We now have 8 recruitment brands under the Alpha Group umbrella across Auckland and Wellington, and have exciting plans to expand further. Despite our growth Alpha still maintains a family business feel and the team is tight knit. We are proud winners of multiple Seek awards and last year were awarded Employer of the Year and the Supreme Winner Award at the prestigious Newmarket Business Awards. §Due to the growth at our Source HR & Recruitment site based in Onehunga we are  looking for our next superstar to join the team! This is a varied role and you will be recruiting for Scientific and Laboratory roles along with White and Blue Collar temps.§You will need to have previous Recruitment and Business Development experience ; what’s more important to us is a positive, can do attitude and open to learning, the ability to problem solve and act with urgency, previous experience in a sales environment is beneficial, a team player mentality and the ability to build solid relationships.§As a Recruitment Consultant at Source HR your typical day to day duties will include:§End to end recruitment activities – from gathering the client brief, advertising, shortlisting and presenting candidates, through to negotiating placements and follow up §Account management (nurturing your existing client relationships) and new business development (growing your client base)§Working collaboratively in a team environment, and always striving to do the ‘right thing’§If you are looking for your next role in recruitment this could be the ideal opportunity for you to join a supportive environment with a friendly and inclusive culture. Your team mates will help you through your bad days and celebrate your successes. KPIs are realistic and earning potential is high. Or, perhaps you have previous recruitment experience and you’re looking to avoid the treadmill of the big corporate model whilst still having access to the opportunities that come with a growing business. Either way, if the you have the attributes listed above and this sounds like it could be a fit for you we would love to talk to you. Apply today!§§§§

Safety§§§§§§It is hard to show and say what is great about a business in a job advert but here goes ...§  §Concretec is a leader in the precast industry.  We take on challenging projects that others may not and pride ourselves on the high quality of our work.  Because of this we see many clients return and partner with us time and time again.§  §We also have great people, strong teams and promote mental and physical health & well-being.§  §We are now on the hunt for a§ Health & Safety Advisor§ to join our team here in Pokeno, Waikato.§  §This role will be working primarily ‘on the ground’ in the H&S space, however the successful applicant must be interested in learning about HR & Recruitment as the two roles work closely together.§  §To be considered for this role you will;§ § §Be a committed H&S professional, who will thrive on spending time ‘on the ground’ with our people§ §Have strong knowledge of the HSWA and other applicable legislation and best practice documents and methods§ §Preferably have experience within the construction manufacturing industry§ §Be able to confidently assess various site areas and tasks completed, identifying risks, and working with staff to prevent injuries§ §Actively work with and manage contractor compliance and H&S on-site§ §Manage staff, contractor, and visitor inductions, keeping up to date records and ensuring documentation is up-to-date and compliant with current legislation§ §Have the ability to engage and influence all levels of the business, from our working Directors, to our production staff§ §Complete a whole range of other adhoc duties as required§ §You will be sitting in an open plan office, with a ‘pod’ of people who are able to knuckle down and focus, whilst enjoying a laugh and a bit of banter.§  §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, please send through a current CV by clicking the ‘Apply’ button below.  Please note that successful applicants must have the current right to work in NZ, and due to Immigration NZ’s hold on allowing people on temporary visas back in to the country, you must also currently reside in New Zealand.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50641018.txt	§Health and Safety Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Fegan & Co§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Claymark Group (under new ownership as of 1 October 2020) is New Zealand’s largest manufacturer and exporter of premium pine products. Operating across five sawmilling and remanufacturing sites in the Bay of Plenty region, the Claymark Brand is recognised at the highest levels on the domestic and global markets for it quality and precision focus.§  §With new ownership comes a desire to continue to grow and develop the Claymark brand and reputation with this to be supported through an enhancement of quality people management processes.§  §Primary to this focus is a total dedication to the health, safety and wellbeing of all 450+ employees within the Group. To support this focus Claymark are therefore seeking to strengthen their internal Health and Safety capabilities through the establishment of a new Health and Safety Coordinator role.§  §Reporting directly to the Group Health and Safety Manager, we are seeking expressions of interest for suitably qualified and experienced individuals for the full-time role of §Health and Safety Coordinator – Katikati §  §This role will work closely with the respective Site Managers to ensure full compliance with all legislative and regulatory provisions through planning and managing training, conducting audits, monitoring processes, reviewing and reporting on data, undertaking investigations and actively facilitating site Health and Safety meetings.§  §To be successful in being appointed to this role, the successful candidate will need to demonstrate extensive knowledge and experience in a production / manufacturing industry, a sound knowledge of New Zealand Health and Safety Legislation and Regulations, a dedication to detail oriented solutions and the ability to work effectively within a multicultural work environment. As this role is site based, the appointee will need to be highly organised, self-managing and be able to display high levels of initiative and decision making.§  §Formal qualifications and training in health and safety are desirable.§  §As we are seeking to have the appointee in place as soon as possible, applicants must have a current entitlement to work in New Zealand.§  §If you believe that you have the required skills, experience and abilities to be successful this role please forward a comprehensive CV to: §jobs@fegan.co.nz§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Payroll & HRIS Manager Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50641103.txt	§Payroll & HRIS Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Payroll & HRIS Manager§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Other§§§§§§Are you looking for a new opportunity that offers much more than the average Payroll Manager role?§Wellington City Council (WCC) have an opportunity for an experienced Payroll, Remuneration and HRIS Manager to join the team reporting to the Manager HR Services. As a leader in the People and Culture Group you will drive and support the People and Culture's Group mission of "Working in partnership across the Council to create a high performing, secure, safe, happy and healthy workplace for all, enabling out people to deliver great services to our communities".§The Payroll and HRIS team contribute to this vision by providing accurate and timely payroll services for WCC, Wellington Water and some Council Controlled Organisations including the Zoo, Zealandia and part time staff for Wellington Venues. In addition the team deliver HRIS system development to improve our customer's experience, implement a fit for purpose remuneration and benefits strategy and framework that supports our employee value proposition and develop robust and HR analytics and reporting systems that enable our leaders to make informed people related decisions.§This role requires a customer centric, delivery focussed person who is comfortable working and providing services in a complex and diverse organisation. You will be innovative in your thinking, champion continuous improvement and be flexible in your approach to meet customer needs.§Because you will be a team player and someone who is known for their collaborative way of working, you will also help drive the forward momentum of the Catalyst model that the Group has adopted to deliver exceptional customer service and high performing professionals.§What are we looking for§?§A broad range of experience with HRIS systems, preferably with TechnologyOne§Experience managing and improving HRIS systems and tools to meet both customer needs and legislative requirements.§Experience developing and implementing remuneration and reward strategies, systems and process across multiple employment contract types.§The ability to build robust HR metrics, trend data and analysis for the business to support better decision making.§A high level of Payroll expertise (technical, functional and operational) and experience in managing and improving Payroll processes.§A good working knowledge of the relevant employment legislation that relates to the payroll particularly the Holidays Act.§Significant experience in developing and fostering stakeholder relationships both internal and external.§Proven ability to manage and deliver in a changing and pressured environment.§To enable you to deliver, you will need to demonstrate your commitment to the Council's values in everything you do including: He Tangata, he tangata, he tangata - We put people at the heart of what we do Whakapai ake - We're always improving Mahi Ngātahi - We collaborate Mana tiaki - We care for our places.§For further information please checkout the position description or contact §Sarah.Kirkland@wcc.govt.nz§Applications close Sunday 11 October 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Operating across five sawmilling and remanufacturing sites in the Bay of Plenty region, the Claymark Brand is recognised at the highest levels on the domestic and global markets for it quality and precision focus.§  §With new ownership comes a desire to continue to grow and develop the Claymark brand and reputation with this to be supported through an enhancement of quality people management processes.§  §We are therefore seeking applications from suitability qualified individuals for the new role of §Group Human Resource Manager§. This role will be an integral function within the Executive Leadership Team and will have oversite of all people management functions for the Group’s 450+ employee workforce.§  §The successful applicant for this role will need to be able to balance a strategic perspective with the ability to be practical and innovative in the implementation and management of the human resource function. This will require the appointee to have broad knowledge and experience across of range of HR disciplines including: KPI setting and Performance / Discipline management, training and development, remuneration systems, collective bargaining, recruitment and onboarding and the engagement of staff.§  §Based within the Company’s Rotorua Head Office the appointee will need to be flexible to work across any of the company’s sawmilling and remanufacturing sites (3 x Rotorua, Thames and Katikati). Experience within a production / manufacturing environment would be essential to enable the appointee to quickly integrate within all aspects of the business.§  §The successful applicant will have formal qualifications in an HR related discipline and a current entitlement to work in New Zealand. As an extremely important function within the Claymark Group structure this will be a very rewarding and well remunerated role.§  §If you believe that you have the required skills, experience and abilities to be successful in this key Senior Management role please forward a comprehensive CV to: §jobs@fegan.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50641638.txt	§Human Resources Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Resources Administrator§§Advertiser: §Higher Ground Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Permanent Part Time Position:§ 3 days a week (24 flexible hours)§  §Location:§ Te Atatu Peninsula, Auckland§  §Reports to:§ Operations Manager§  § §  §Higher Ground§  §Higher Ground Drug Rehabilitation Trust is a not-for-profit organisation that provides quality abstinence-based treatment within a therapeutic community for clients who are severely dependent on alcohol and other drugs.  Our primary focus is an 18-week residential programme that is based on the 12 Step recovery principles.  We aim to support recovery for individuals and whānau and reduce the harm that alcohol and other drug addiction causes in communities and society as a whole. §  § §  §About the role§  §Are you looking for change and wanting to extend your HR knowledge and experience? Are you wanting to apply your proven HR practice, work with a small but supportive team, and have autonomy over your own work? Then look no further.§  §We are seeking an exceptional HR Administrator experienced in all things HR who can assist with the day-to-day operations of the organisation.  This is a varied role that supports all departments of the Trust therefore strong communication and relationship management skills are a must.  Your main duties and responsibilities include: recruitment, induction, employment contracts, variations and offer letters, remuneration calculation, management of all HR related documentation, database management, maintenance and development of policies and procedures, payroll administration, management of performance appraisals and staff training, health and safety administration, and assisting senior management with any staffing issues when they arise.§  § §  §Benefits and perks§  §For your knowledge, skill set and experience, you will be rewarded:§ § §A competitive annual salary & Training Allowance§ §6 days sick leave & 5 weeks annual leave after 5 years of service§ §Supportive environment with own office§ § §  §Skills and experience§  §To be suitable for this role ideally you will be degree qualified, preferably in HR, with at least 2 years HR experience.  Your ability to juggle various administrative tasks effortlessly and work independently will come naturally. §  §You will have a great understanding of NZ employment legislation, exhibit a high level of confidentiality and have clear competency skills (intermediate/advanced) working with Microsoft Word and Excel.  Ideally you will have previous experience working with iPayroll or a similar payroll programme and possess excellent communication skills both written and verbally.  You will have an eye for detail, enjoy the people facing elements of the role and be someone who isn't fazed by the busy administrative components of the role.§  § §  §To Apply§  §For a more detailed description about this role, you can download the HR Administrator Position Description on our website: www.higherground.org.nz under the tab §About Us.§  §An opportunity like this doesn't come along every day.  If you have experience working in a similar role then click on §Apply For This Job §and make sure to include a cover letter and CV with your application.  If you have any questions regarding the role or for more information, you can email Alaina Healey: §alaina@higherground.org.nz§ or 834 0017 ext.137.§  §Applications close 4.00pm on Friday, 16th October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a human resources administrator?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§How many years of recruitment experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§
