jobTitle: Health and Safety Officer Job in Northland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50643006.txt	§Health and Safety Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Officer§§Advertiser: §Affco NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Rest of Northland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§We are currently seeking a passionate Health and Safety Officer to join our site leadership team based in Moerewa. As the Health and Safety Officer, your role is to support, inform and engage people leaders so their teams remain healthy and go home safe every day. This role champions the reporting of near-misses, incidents and accidents onsite; coaching and assisting people leaders to investigate, review and design new controls as necessary.§Key responsibilities include:§Partner with site leadership to effectively identify, eliminate, minimise or control risks to an acceptable level§Ensure site compliance with health and safety standards, procedures and systems§Manage the incident and injury investigation and reporting process onsite§Track, analyse and report on health and safety patterns and trends§Drive employee engagement and participation in the management of occupational health and safety§Provide guidance and coaching to individuals on site to foster collective ownership of a safety culture§Champion a continuous improvement culture and instil best practice across all aspects of the health and safety function§The ideal candidate will have the following experience, qualifications and skills:§Prior experience working in a high-risk environment§A formal qualification in occupational health and safety, related field, or commensurate experience§Sound knowledge of the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015 and its application in the workplace§Proven experience in the areas of incident management, training, hazard management, audit programmes, occupational hygiene and health and safety procedures§Strong relationship building, influencing and problem resolution skills§Ability to prioritise tasks through good time management and organisation skills§Professional, proactive attitude with excellent interpersonal skills§The successful candidate will be rewarded with:§A supportive, well-established site leadership team§The ability to make the role their own and autonomously manage a wide variety of day to day activities§Opportunities for career development and advancement§Competitive remuneration package§If you are a driven and motivated individual who is passionate about promoting and driving a zero harm culture then please apply.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: People & Culture Advisor | 12 month Fixed-Term Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50643218.txt	§People & Culture Advisor | 12 month Fixed-Term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & Culture Advisor | 12 month Fixed-Term§§Advertiser: §Datacom§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Our purpose§Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in§The Nitty Gritty§We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.§About the Role§Reporting to the People & Culture Business Partner, the People & Culture Advisor (PA) will work with the business to provide support and consultation primarily to the broader market / Executive Group team. The PA is also responsible for overseeing/assisting in the day-to-day delivery of People projects, programs, and strategies (communication, on-boarding, integration, talent management etc.).§This is a 12m Fixed-Term role.§What you'll bring§2+ years general HR experience§Experience with rapid and complex changing work environment§Exposure to ER would be highly beneficial§Experience or a good understanding of change management principles§Enthusiastic team player with a strong drive to create a positive work environment§Flexible with fantastic communication skills and huge amounts of drive§The ability to be comfortable with high volume workload and not be afraid to "roll up your sleeves"§Solutions focus and comfortable working in an environment which demands strong deliverables§Ability to identify problems and drive appropriate solutions§Strong internal and external customer service focus§Responsibilities§As a People & Culture Advisor you will build trusted advisor relationships across your assigned client groups. You work closely with client business units to apply HR management principles and knowledge to establish rapport, trust, confidence and credibility with management and employees. You will ideally have some experience in change management principles.  The successful candidate will also have a "hands on," "roll up your sleeves" mentality and a strong internal and external customer service focus. There will always be a bias for action, strong work ethic, and a desire to achieve excellent results. You will need the ability to connect and positively interface at all organisational levels, a passion for inventing solutions and process improvement. §Why you want to join us§At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We've maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise' and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

You will help shape the People and Human Resources strategic roadmap and execute the agenda for the New Zealand arm of Aon.§ § § §Key responsibilities will include:§ § § §People / Human Resources§ Team Leadership & Business Partnership§ §As a member of the leadership team and a trusted business partner, you will provide support and assistance to the CEO and senior leaders. § §Drive organizational change management initiatives aimed to support the delivery of Aon’s vision and growth ambitions.§ §Partner with business leaders to implement performance management, development and retention programs ensuring the best talent and capability to deliver on strategy. § §Partnering with Talent Acquisition and the business to assess workforce planning strategies.§ § § §HR Functional Delivery & Governance § §Responsible for execution of core people and talent management processes & initiatives including workforce planning, annual performance and pay review cycle, talent review process, engagement survey analysis and review, learning & development curriculum. § §Ensure that appropriate governance arrangements are in place for remuneration and benefits. Ensure rigor and consistency in the application of People/ Human Resources policy, talent acquisition processes and talent assessment methodology in partnership with Aon’s Talent Acquisition and HR Operations teams in the region. § § §About you:§ § § §This position will suit someone who thrives on driving strategy and operational execution in an environment undergoing major transformation.  You will also possess the following;§ § §Demonstrated ability to operate effectively in a fast-paced, diverse & growth focused organization at an operational and management level. § §Demonstrated ability to build strong, enduring and trusting relationships with senior leaders across the business for effective decision making, driving change and performing the role of a trusted HR partner/ advisor. § §Demonstrated people management experience, with sound financial management skills, including experience setting and monitoring HR budgets.§ §Proven expertise in developing and implementing people strategies and plans, particularly in organizational development, talent management, aligning performance and reward, leadership development and employee engagement.§ §Experience in using data and analytics to enable evidenced based decision making.§ §Sound knowledge of contemporary best practice in remuneration and incentive design, talent acquisition, learning and culture change. § § §About Us:§ § § §We’re a team of authentic and smart individuals focused on providing exceptional value to our clients and our local communities. Meaningful and genuine relationships are at the heart of our business success and we’re proud of our positive impact.§ § § §Here at Aon, you’re always more than just a job title. We encourage and support you to expand your knowledge and grow alongside some of the best people in the business – in New Zealand and throughout our connected global networks.§ §              § § §How to apply:§ § § §Please submit your up to date resume and cover letter with relevant experiences.§ § §Aon is committed to creating a winning and inclusive culture with growth and development opportunities for everyone. Diversity is the foundation on which we have built our world-class organization, unparalleled in delivering distinctive value through the work we do.§ § § §We embrace an inclusive culture where our people trust each other, respect diversity and share ideas freely.§§§§§

careers.§        §To learn more about this career opportunity or to apply online, please click Apply Online and you will be taken to our careers page.§        §Interested in other opportunities?  To complete analysis, insights, and prioritisation of capability gaps, opportunities, recommendation of interventions, and work with leaders on the execution of this plan as appropriate§Drive a culture of performance and accountability by partnering with the leadership teams on the Performance and Development planning cycle§Work with lead teams to identify talent and assist in creating targeted development plans§Ensure HR initiatives are pragmatic, commercial, and linked to business performance§Work with the Talent Acquisition Team to ensure recruitment is aligned to business strategy, capability required, budget, and headcount§Complete investigations as required for senior / high risk grievances (complex ER)§§To be successful in this role you will need:§§A growth mindset§Optimism, curiosity, energy and resilience§Strong internal and external stakeholder management (essential)§Experience in delivering organisational development and projects to build capability§Track record in influencing and driving a high performance culture§Strong interpersonal, communication, analytical, and organisational skills§Able to display excellent judgement, drive, and initiative§Bachelor's degree in Human resources, Business, or related field (preferred)§5+ years in an HRBP role or similar§Experience in FMCG or related industry (advantageous)§Ideally experience in working with a Sales leadership team§§ What can we offer you?§In return for your passion and commitment, we will reward you with a competitive remuneration package and help you to achieve personal and professional growth and development during your time with us. §With sites spanning across the Australasian region our employees have the opportunity to fashion their own home grown career across functions, locations and brands.  Our aim is to be a destination employer in the food industry where we don't just offer jobs - jobTitle: Health and Safety Manager Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50646065.txt	§Health and Safety Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Manager§§Advertiser: §Watties§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Job Description:§  §This senior role reports directly to the Site Manager and is responsible for leading implementation and management of Operational Risk Management (ORM) work streams including Environmental, Health & Safety, Business Continuity, Asset Conservation, Facility Security and Sustainability. As a key member of the site leadership team the incumbent will ensure compliance with corporate and regulatory requirements and drive continuous improvement in all ORM work streams.§  §About the role:§ § §Lead the development and implementation of annual Improvement plans in relation to Environmental Health and Safety, Asset Conservation, Facility Security and Sustainability.§ §Develop site risk management processes and strategic plans.§ §Lead delivery of continuous improvement in risk management performance and manage associated site steering meetings.§ §Lead processes that improve management competence and raise commitment to cultivate a proactive safety culture that encourages ownership, continuous improvement and manufacturing excellence.§ §Proactively ensure that site employees are competent to manage all safety critical activities.§ §Lead dealings with regulatory authorities and insurance companies in all matters relating to EHS.§ §Direct the activities of the site security team and deliver compliance to company standards for facility security.§ §Develop and maintain systems that facilitate the reporting of all EHS KPI’s and relevant score cards.§ §Benchmark the sites performance against other Kraft Heinz sites, identifying areas for improvement and sharing best practices.§ §Attainment and thereafter annual maintenance of certification to ISO 14001 Environmental Standard.§ §Ensure the site is always fully compliant with all regulatory requirements.§ §Support the prevention and management of sickness and injury related absence.§ § §  §About you:§ § §A proven track record of results and continuous improvement in EHS or related roles.§ §Experience in leading significant changes and delivery of strategic objectives within a complex manufacturing environment.§ §Strong people influencing skills including communication, relationship building, motivational and staff development.§ §Think and act like an owner with a “can do” approach accompanied by positive and urgent behaviour.§ §Deliver on what you say you’ll do, always maintaining a high level of integrity.§ §An understanding of New Zealand legal systems, regulatory processes and relevant legislation.§ §Understanding and experience with Safety Management Systems such as ACC Partnership Program.§ §Sound technical knowledge, excellent understanding of EHS metrics and high level of computer literacy.§ §Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.§ §Minimum of 2 years’ experience in a similar role, preferably in a manufacturing environment.§ §If you are passionate about Health and Safety, then this role is an ideal opportunity to demonstrate your abilities within a large manufacturing organization. You will gain fantastic exposure within a business that has a strong global footprint and roadmap for success.§  §Benefits program§  §We empower our people to own their work, and it’s true our employees are our competitive advantage – so we take care of our employees with our ‘Live Well’ benefits program:§ § §Gatherings - End of Year Celebration§ §Wellbeing – annual health checks & flu shots, wellbeing sessions & webinars§ §Parental Leave - 12 weeks paid parental leave for primary caregivers§ §We are an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces, promotes and values diversity and inclusion.§  §Bring your appetite for more!§  §As part of the Wattie’s brand, you’ll be working for one of New Zealand’s most loved food and beverage companies, boasting 35 brands and working across 37 categories.  Our offering is unique because Wattie’s is proudly part of the Kraft Heinz Company, so you get to enjoy the perks of a global organisation while working on a local iconic brand.§  §Only people who are eligible to work in New Zealand or who are certain they can gain eligibility through immigration processes should apply. Evidence will be required.§§§§§

You represent clients by marketing their skills to employers with focus on sustainability. You’ll work alongside employers to identify solutions to their current and future labour needs. You’ll work alongside service centre staff to provide quality labour market information and promote employment and training opportunities.§        §About you§        §This role will appeal to a sales-oriented person as you will become the voice of your clients by selling their skills to employers. Your natural flair for seeking out labour market trends and insights ensures you proactively anticipate impacts and opportunities. clients and employers from diverse backgrounds.§          §Be flexible, solutions focused and client-centric.§          §Have excellent written and verbal communication skills.§          §Be tenacious, professional and driven to overcome road blocks.§          §Enjoy building relationships and making new connections.§          §Have a full clean and valid New Zealand driver’s licence.§ line with skills and performance expectations).§        §        §How to apply§        §Apply online with your CV and cover letter that outlines your experience and motivation for the role.  Also, you need to answer the following questions in your application:§        §          §Why do you want to be a Work Broker?§          §How would you source employment opportunities for our clients?§        §        §Applications close: Tuesday, 13 October 2020.§        §Please note: If you currently work for MSD please apply through your MyHR careers portal at work.§        §For any further information about the role, please contact Zoli Boros §Zoli.Boros001@msd.govt.nz§        §Position Description§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/service-delivery/regional-service-delivery/work-broker-november-2019.docx§        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. As the face of the organisation, you use influence and networks to seek out current and future employment opportunities from employers across a range of industry sectors. You represent clients by marketing their skills to employers with focus on sustainability. You’ll work alongside employers to identify solutions to their current and future labour needs. You’ll work alongside service centre staff to provide quality labour market information and promote employment and training opportunities.§  §About you§  §This role will appeal to a sales-oriented person as you will become the voice of your clients by selling their skills to employers. You enjoy business development and engaging with diverse groups of people and communities. Your natural flair for seeking out labour market trends and insights ensures you proactively anticipate impacts and opportunities. You thrive under pressure and enjoy using your tenacity and initiative to find solutions and achieve goals.§  §To succeed in this role, you will need to:§ § §Understand what makes a great job match for both employers and employees.§ §Have excellent facilitation skills with the ability to engage an audience to influence positive change.§ §Work alongside clients and employers from diverse backgrounds.§ §Be flexible, solutions focused and client-centric.§ §Have excellent written and verbal communication skills.§ §Be tenacious, professional and driven to overcome road blocks.§ §Enjoy building relationships and making new connections.§ §Have a full clean and valid New Zealand driver’s licence.§ §We offer you§ § §Regular coaching and career development opportunities.§ §Supportive work environment.§ §Salary range $47,622 to $65,480 per annum (in line with skills and performance expectations).§ §How to apply§  §Apply online with your CV and cover letter that outlines your experience and motivation for the role.  Also, you need to answer the following questions in your application:§ § §Why do you want to be a Work Broker?§ §How would you source employment opportunities for our clients?§ §Applications close: Tuesday, 13 October 2020.§  §Please note: If you currently work for MSD please apply through your MyHR careers portal at work.§  §For any further information about the role, please contact Zoli Boros §Zoli.Boros001@msd.govt.nz§  §Position Description§  §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/service-delivery/regional-service-delivery/work-broker-november-2019.docx§  §Joining us§  §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. A sense of humour and excellent communications skills coupled with the ability to work with a diverse range of stakeholders is essential§If you enjoy working within a team-based environment, have a positive outlook and are willing to contribute to the AWHI culture that’s growing from strength to strength then we want to hear from you. §Atihau offers a competitive remuneration and benefits package reflective of skills and experience. Ongoing training and personal development is also provided to support personal goals and aspirations. §Atihau has health and safety management systems in place to provide a safe and drug free workplace, The successful applicant will be required to undergo a pre-employment drug test before commencement.  §For more information about this role please contact Andrew Beijeman on 027 218 8172.  Applications for this position will remain open until filled §For a copy of the Job Description visit Health-Safety-and-Wellbeing-Advisor-JD.pdf§§§§

jobTitle: Human Resource Advisor Job in Taranaki - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50647069.txt	§Human Resource Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Resource Advisor§§Advertiser: §Baker Tilly Staples Rodway HR§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Taranakipine are leaders in the design and manufacture of value-added wood products. They pride themselves in understanding customers’ needs, manufacturing to industry best practice and servicing customers with quality products. Established over 60 years ago, Taranakipine holds a significant position in both NZ and overseas timber products markets and is committed to growth and development in new opportunities such as their new venture Woodspan PLT Panels. Their culture is open, approachable and supportive with a focus on team, continuous improvement and excellent customer service.§The Opportunity§A re-alignment of roles has created an exciting opportunity for an experienced HR Advisor to support Taranakipine managers to deliver HR and people practices and processes. Reporting through to the Senior Operations Manager, you will spend half your time onsite, working with the teams and actively contributing to a positive and productive culture. Your skills across all key HR operational areas will be critical to this role, as well as your ability to build strong business partnership relationships, have a high level of emotional intelligence and feel comfortable wearing steel cap boots and a high-vis jacket.§This is a permanent full-time position, but there is some flexibility with hours depending on the skills and experience of the successful candidate. §You will be responsible for;§Providing advice on best-practice solutions related to all HR areas including employment relations, performance management and recruitment§Leading, developing and delivering the HR strategy across the business§Working alongside managers to deliver HR programmes and initiatives§Implementing best practice principles for recruitment, on-boarding and induction§Helping identify development opportunities and training across the business§Facilitating the annual performance and remuneration review processes§Responding to employee enquiries on a broad range of HR related matters§Maintaining accurate record keeping, document management and providing reporting of all HR related data§Our Ideal Candidate§You will be proactive, have a positive attitude and won’t hesitate to get things done. You will be personable, supportive and a team player. You must also bring to the role the following;§Relevant tertiary qualification and 5+ years in a similar role, ideally within a manufacturing environment§In-depth knowledge and experience in employment relations, performance management and change management§Demonstrated commercial acumen, a history of strong internal business relationships and a supportive and collaborative style§Exceptional organisational skills with the ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines and deliver quality§Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§Proven analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detail§A high level of resilience and initiative§If you are someone that is passionate about developing and supporting managers to enhance the culture, team capabilities and staff engagement in a future focused business, then this role is for you.§To obtain a copy of the position description, please email the recruitment team at Baker Tilly Staples Rodway on §hr@bakertillysr.nz§. To discuss this role in confidence, contact Recruitment Specialist, Melissa Henwood on §06 757 3155§.§Applications close Friday 16th October 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: LMS Specialist Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50647304.txt	§LMS Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§LMS Specialist§§Advertiser: §Blue Sky Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §LMS Specialist §      §This is a Learning Management System role with a mandate to lead and transform.  Working with a passionate L&D Manager, you will be responsible for taking the LMS from good to great and ensuring the LMS is a fully integrated system that is at the backbone of developing capability within the organisation.§The system is not broken, it is a modern, recently implemented and upgraded LMS that is functioning well.  The challenge for you will to be design and implement a LMS strategy and roadmap to increase the use of the LMS and help drive capability and training and development activities across the business.§To achieve this goal, you will need to be an experienced and skilled LMS professional with the strategic ability to see the opportunities and the communication skills to "sell" your vision.  You will need to be nimble, the day to day responsibilities for managing and maintaining the LMS will not go away and you will be required to maintain the system and resolve problems as they arise. Once completed, you can then move back into planning and organising for the future.§To be considered you will need to be an experienced Learning Management System professional with exceptional stakeholder management skills, excellent plannng skills and a forward thinker with the ability to prioritise.  If you believe you have the skills, passion and drive to transform how this organisation uses their LMS, please apply online or call Michael Beaton on §021570380§ for a confidential conversation. §      §      §    §    §www.blueskyrecruitment.nz §  §§§This is a Learning Management System role with a mandate to lead and transform.  Working with a passionate L&D Manager, you will be responsible for taking the LMS from good to great and ensuring the LMS is a fully integrated system that is at the backbone of developing capability within the organisation.§The system is not broken, it is a modern, recently implemented and upgraded LMS that is functioning well.  The challenge for you will to be design and implement a LMS strategy and roadmap to increase the use of the LMS and help drive capability and training and development activities across the business.§To achieve this goal, you will need to be an experienced and skilled LMS professional with the strategic ability to see the opportunities and the communication skills to "sell" your vision.  You will need to be nimble, the day to day responsibilities for managing and maintaining the LMS will not go away and you will be required to maintain the system and resolve problems as they arise. Once completed, you can then move back into planning and organising for the future.§To be considered you will need to be an experienced Learning Management System professional with exceptional stakeholder management skills, excellent plannng skills and a forward thinker with the ability to prioritise.  If you believe you have the skills, passion and drive to transform how this organisation uses their LMS, please apply online or call Michael Beaton on §021570380§ for a confidential conversation.§§§§

jobTitle: Recruitment Consultant Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50647863.txt	§Recruitment Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Consultant§§Advertiser: §AWF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§About the company:§ AWF is part of AWF Madison Group - New Zealand’s only staffing provider listed on the NZX. Today, we are NZ’s largest staffing provider with a geographic spread almost double our nearest competitor. From Kaitaia to Invercargill, there are up to 3,500 people working through AWF every day. From providing chippies to the country's largest constructors, roller drivers to civil contractors; devanning services, picking and packing for many iconic brands; driving trucks in some of the largest fleets; to processing many of the food items we all eat every day, AWF supply them all.§ § §The Role:§ As a Recruitment Consultant you must be able to understand our clients and candidates needs and requirements in Waihi, surrounding areas including Coromandel, Whangamata, Whitianga and as far North as Maramarua. Your clients’ base will consist of the mining sector and well known national large construction companies. Multi-tasking and switching priorities are a key element of the role along with maintaining and managing our commitment to the H&S of our staff. This is an end to end recruitment role on a desk with established clients that have the potential to offer more to someone that goes the extra mile for them. To cover the large geographical area, extensive travel is an essential component in this role therefore a full NZ drivers licence is pivotal.§ § Day to day you will be:§Build exceptional relationships with both clients and workforce§Provide regular communication with customers and temp employees§Manage daily dispatch procedures and ensure effective service delivery§Ensure temporary employees skills and experience match job requirements§Day to day management of H&S including on site auditing§Ensure daily compliance within proven operating systems§Required to be successful in the role:§At least 2-3 years of proven experience in the customer service industry§Background in the recruitment industry preferred§Account management experience§Strong written and verbal communication skills§Proven administration skills in a fast paced environment§Experience working with the Microsoft suite§The benefits:§ The people in our business are passionate about what they do every day, helping people get into to work and thrive. For your passion and hard work you are rewarded with a competitive remuneration package and bonus along with all the perks of work for a large NZ organisation.§ § §If you are up for the challenge please apply now!§ §§§§

jobTitle: HR Manager Job in Waikato - SEEK
advertiser: Oji Fibre Solutions Pulp and Paper
jobText: TXT/50648224.txt	§HR Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Manager§§Advertiser: §Oji Fibre Solutions Pulp and Paper§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§Exciting opportunity to put your sound HR Generalist experience to work§Showcase your ER/IR skills in a complex manufacturing environment§Kinleith Mill, part of the Tokoroa community for more than 60 years§Oji Fibre Solutions (NZ) Limited is New Zealand's largest pulp & paper manufacturer. Backed by the strength of the Oji Holdings Group, we are a company with heritage, and are committed to delivering quality, innovative products that enhance the competitiveness of our customers. We have an extensive team of people, who work together to produce quality kraft pulp, paper and fibre packaging products from renewable, sustainably harvested forestry and recycled wood fibre. We are proud of our circular economy 'solutions by nature', creating value from natural, renewable and recyclable resources, is key to our ongoing operations, customers, communities and sustainability success.§We have an exciting opportunity for an accomplished §HR Manager §to join the Pulp and Paper HR team. The role is based at our Kinleith Mill, located 8kms South of Tokoroa. If you're looking for a varied role where you will partner and work alongside key Business Units to provide sound, pragmatic and timely HR advice on a wide range of topics, from IR/ER matters to performance and change leadership, work force planning, recruitment and talent management, remuneration and rewards and employee wellbeing, just to name a few - then this is the role for you!§This unique opportunity is your chance to shine by demonstrating and putting into practise your extensive and well-developed HR generalist skill set. To hit the ground running and own this role, you will preferably have a tertiary qualification in Human Resources or similar, supported with demonstrated success in delivering HR leadership in a large complex manufacturing or heavy industry environment, and must be familiar with operating within a unionised environment. You will also have real flexibility about how you deliver HR services.§To be successful, you must demonstrate the following personal attributes:§Highly customer focused with the ability to connect at all levels of the business§Team player who can work both independently and collaboratively§Proven problem solving, influencing, leadership, coaching, training and team building skills§Be held in high regard by your internal and external customers as a trusted advisor§Highly organised, able to manage multiple conflicting demands;§Accomplished written and presentation skills§Driven to deliver results§Strong attention to detail with robust analytical skills§In return for your commitment, the Company offers a competitive remuneration and benefits package, including enhanced superannuation, subsidised medial, life, disability and income protection insurance.§In accordance with company policy, the successful candidate will be required to undergo a pre-employment medical examination, drug test and police check. Oji Fibre Solutions will meet these expenses.§Apply online today with your current CV and a cover letter.§https://ojifs.careercentre.net.nz/Job/HR-Manager/Waikato/3989§Applications close on Thursday, 29 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Backed by the strength of the Oji Holdings Group, we are a company with heritage, and are committed to delivering quality, innovative products that enhance the competitiveness of our customers. For over 60 years our mills, with the support from local communities and our extensive team of people, continue to work together to produce quality kraft pulp, paper and fibre packaging products from renewable, sustainably harvested forestry and recycled wood fibre. We are committed to delivering our values of being a trusted partner, built on strength, future focused and innovative.§Opportunity§We are seeking to appoint an accomplished Human Resources Analyst in our Pulp & Paper HR team, located in Mount Maunganui. Reporting to the Head of HR for Pulp & Paper, you will be responsible for providing specialist HR metrics, reports and recommendations to the HR Team and Business Stakeholders to support better business outcomes relating to recruitment, retention and legal compliance.§Key responsibilities:§Develop, maintain and provide standard and ad-hoc HR reports on key metrics including headcount, payroll, redundancy costs turnover, absenteeism and other areas as required§Undertake job evaluations for new and changed roles within Pulp & Paper ensuring market relativity and internal alignment§Maintain data within the HR Systems to ensure accuracy of reporting§Work with the HR Team and Stakeholders to develop and implement HR initiatives to meet business needs§Providing reports, advice and support to Stakeholders in the organisation regarding HR policies, processes, and best practice§Analysing and presenting data and reports to the appropriate area of expertise, identifying errors and advising on solutions §About you§A tertiary qualification in Human Resources, Business Administration or relevant equivalent§Ideally three plus year's experience in HR operations within a medium to large size organisation§Strong data sense, eye for details and good multi-tasking ability§Good problem solver with great communication and critical thinking skills§Ability to work independently and/or collaborate well with various stakeholders§Thorough understanding of current HR best practice and legislation§Experience working with HRIS, CHRIS, KRONOS, or similar related software an advantage§Excellent Microsoft Office Excel skills§Ability to ensure deadlines and objectives are met§Team contributor and player§In return for your skills and commitment:§Permanent, full-time, Monday to Friday role§Competitive salary§Enhanced superannuation§Subsidised health insurance, life, disability and income protection insurance§Opportunity for further development and growth in the business§Be part of a dedicated and close-knit team§Employee purchasing benefits programme§In accordance with company policy, the successful candidate will be required to undergo a pre-employment medical examination, drug test, criminal history and credit history check. Oji Fibre Solutions will meet these expenses.§So, if this sounds like your next move, apply now with your covering letter and CV. Please follow the link attached to apply on line now:§https://ojifs.careercentre.net.nz/Job/Human-Resources-Analyst/Bay-of-Plenty/3953§Applications close Thursday, 29 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50649116.txt	§Health and Safety Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Advisor§§Advertiser: §First Gas & Rock Gas§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Firstgas Group own and operate the pipes, storage, tanks, cylinders and trucks that deliver natural gas or LPG to about 165,000 customers across the country. We’re also about the future – exploring alternative energy sources that are sustainable, environmentally friendly and deliver New Zealand’s energy needs in a changing world.  We’re exploring all sorts of exciting possibilities that will support NZ’s low carbon energy future.§ §Is health and safety your passion?  Looking for a part-time gig?§ §We're looking for a part-time (20 hours/week) H&S Advisor to join our HSEQ team, based in Bell Block, New Plymouth.  In this newly created role, you'll be part of a team delivering H&S best practice to Firstgas Group's operations and activities.§ §You’ll be joining an experienced team of talented people who work within an atmosphere where autonomy, teamwork and flexibility complements the challenging and interesting work environment. § §You'll be responsible for:§ § §Provide H&S technical advice and support to First Gas Group personnel, franchisees, contractors and other stakeholders§ §Assist with delivery of the First Gas HSEQ Plan, working with the broader HSEQ team. § §Promote the use and continuous development of safety management systems, standards and tools throughout the business. § §Together with the assurance and improvement team, develop and update procedures, policies and guidelines.  § §Develop and embed internal H&S training refreshers. § §Lead Incident Investigations (Taproot or ICAM) and learning teams and provide support on other investigations and associated actions. § §Hazard and Risk Management. § §H&S data monitoring and analysis and reporting. § §Support the development, implementation and management of wellness programmes. § §Arrange and facilitate H&S meetings and associated actions as required. § §Advice and support for Hazardous Substances Management.§ §Do you have?§ § §2+ years' experience with high risk activities § §Comprehension of H&S legislation and associated relevant regulations. § §High level of IT competency§ §Superior communication skills§ §Ability to juggle and prioritise a large workload§ §A focus on results§ §Influencing and leadership skills§ §What we offer:§ §Firstgas Group offers a culture that embraces productivity and integrity, encourages proactive thinking and rewards achievement. On offer is an exciting role within a dynamic company. Grow your career in an environment that places high emphasis on staff development and well being. There is simply so much potential here - for our business and for your career.  So, make great things happen now by applying here today!§§§§

jobTitle: HR Advisor (0.5) - 12 month fixed term Job in Tasman - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50649286.txt	§HR Advisor (0.5) - 12 month fixed term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Advisor (0.5) - 12 month fixed term§§Advertiser: §Kono NZ LP§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §HR Advisor (0.5) - 12 month fixed term §    §      §        §Based in Nelson, Wakatū Incorporation is a Māori-family owned organisation with approximately 4,000 shareholders who descend from the traditional Māori land owners of the Nelson, Tasman and Golden Bay regions.§        §A business of land and sea, Wakatū has four parts: Manaaki, people and culture; Whenua, land and water space; Kono, an award-winning food and drinks producer and exporter, and Auora a consumer-focused, health-solutions business.§        §Guided by Te Pae Tawhiti, our long-term intergenerational vision, and deeply held values of rangatiratanga, manaakitanga, whanaungatanga, kaitiakitanga, hihiritanga and pono, Wakatū manages its assets in a way that will build on its legacy for the generations to come. Development, innovation, identity and integrity underpin everything we do. We are passionate about employing our whānau and encourage our Owners to consider if this role could be a good fit for them.§        §We are looking for an HR Advisor to join our team. This is a part time (0.5) role on a 12-month fixed term as maternity cover. This role is responsible for providing high quality advice and assistance to managers and staff in the areas of recruitment, remuneration, performance development and management, training and development, employment relations and industrial relations.§        §It's a varied role, and responsibilities include:§        §          §Workforce planning and recruitment: partnering with key stakeholders to plan and effect recruitment activities for the current and future needs of the business including owner employment initiatives and end to end best practice recruitment and selection including advertising, psychometric and personality testing, reference checking, remuneration advice and related administration.§          §Performance development: responsible for annual performance and development activities across the group, otherwise known as Kōrero Tupu including training of new staff and ensuring all staff have individual development plans.§          §Training and development: providing analysis of skill gaps in the provision of any Group wide initiatives and programmes. This includes identifying issues and making recommendations for programmes such as management and leadership development, health and safety, formal HR processes, recruitment and communication skills§          §Employment Relations: contribute to the development and implementation of employment relations strategy and advise and assists leaders through formal HR processes including, performance improvement, dispute resolution and change management policies and procedures§          §RSE Programme: Provide back up support to the RSE program including; Coordinate Employer recognition and registration with MBIE for RSE status, overseeing Agreement to Recruit (ATR) application, screen workers and conduct selection process and manage visa progressions and applications.§        §        §Our ideal candidate will enjoy interacting with a wide range of people, have fantastic communication skills and be a great team player, along with a commitment to providing excellent customer experience, including proven experience in a generalist or similar relevant human resource role. You will need to be well organised, with sound knowledge of employment legislation. A degree in HR is desirable, but not essential.§        §This is a great opportunity to join a fantastic team. If you are a people person with a passion for HR, then this is the ideal role for you.§        §All successful applicants will be required to undergo a pre-employment drug and alcohol test.§        §To apply for this job go to: kononz.recruitmenthub.co.nz/Vacancies and enter ref code: 5228342.§        §Applications close: 11 October 2020§      §    §    §    §    §    §  §§§Based in Nelson, Wakatū Incorporation is a Māori-family owned organisation with approximately 4,000 shareholders who descend from the traditional Māori land owners of the Nelson, Tasman and Golden Bay regions.§ §A business of land and sea, Wakatū has four parts: Manaaki, people and culture; Whenua, land and water space; Kono, an award-winning food and drinks producer and exporter, and Auora a consumer-focused, health-solutions business.§ §Guided by Te Pae Tawhiti, our long-term intergenerational vision, and deeply held values of rangatiratanga, manaakitanga, whanaungatanga, kaitiakitanga, hihiritanga and pono, Wakatū manages its assets in a way that will build on its legacy for the generations to come. Development, innovation, identity and integrity underpin everything we do. We are passionate about employing our whānau and encourage our Owners to consider if this role could be a good fit for them.§ §We are looking for an HR Advisor to join our team. This is a part time (0.5) role on a 12-month fixed term as maternity cover. This role is responsible for providing high quality advice and assistance to managers and staff in the areas of recruitment, remuneration, performance development and management, training and development, employment relations and industrial relations.§ §It's a varied role, and responsibilities include:§ § §Workforce planning and recruitment: partnering with key stakeholders to plan and effect recruitment activities for the current and future needs of the business including owner employment initiatives and end to end best practice recruitment and selection including advertising, psychometric and personality testing, reference checking, remuneration advice and related administration.§ §Performance development: responsible for annual performance and development activities across the group, otherwise known as Kōrero Tupu including training of new staff and ensuring all staff have individual development plans.§ §Training and development: providing analysis of skill gaps in the provision of any Group wide initiatives and programmes. This includes identifying issues and making recommendations for programmes such as management and leadership development, health and safety, formal HR processes, recruitment and communication skills§ §Employment Relations: contribute to the development and implementation of employment relations strategy and advise and assists leaders through formal HR processes including, performance improvement, dispute resolution and change management policies and procedures§ §RSE Programme: Provide back up support to the RSE program including; Coordinate Employer recognition and registration with MBIE for RSE status, overseeing Agreement to Recruit (ATR) application, screen workers and conduct selection process and manage visa progressions and applications.§ §Our ideal candidate will enjoy interacting with a wide range of people, have fantastic communication skills and be a great team player, along with a commitment to providing excellent customer experience, including proven experience in a generalist or similar relevant human resource role. You will need to be well organised, with sound knowledge of employment legislation. A degree in HR is desirable, but not essential.§ §This is a great opportunity to join a fantastic team. jobTitle: HR Change Management Adviser Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50649844.txt	§HR Change Management Adviser§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Change Management Adviser§§Advertiser: §Volunteer Service Abroad (VSA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §HR Change Management Adviser §      §The Organisation§Since its inception in 2003, Tonga's Public Service Commission has implemented a number of reform initiatives in Human Resources, Policy, and other priority needs across the country. The Office of the Public Service Commission (OPSC) has also held responsibility for all HR management functions and is now in a position delegate this to each Government Ministry.  The Human Resources Delegation Framework is the means by which OPSC will carry out its delegation programme. §The Opportunity§ In this assignment you will work alongside the CEO and Deputy Secretary for Human Resources, as well as Ministry HR managers to ensure a successful transition.  You will assist with the final development of the Delegation Framework, and also provide advice on delegation piloting as well as a review of the pilot programme.§ On a day-to-day basis you will be mentoring and supporting staff with new processes within the Framework, leading training sessions and providing assistance to ministries engaged in the pilot programme. §Why You'll Love it§This is an impelling opportunity to utilise your senior HR skills to transform the entire Tongan public service. In addition to strengthening your existing professional credentials, you will enjoy everything Tonga has to offer- lush, natural landscapes, thriving marine life, and friendly, welcoming locals. § §We are looking for a volunteer with:§        §          §Strong HR Advisory change management experience§          §Experience reviewing, developing and implementing HR frameworks, processes and procedures§          §Experience in staff development including mentoring and delivering training sessions§          §Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation processes§        § https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-§2019-2020§/TON-41254-HR-Change-Management-Adviser.pdf §  § §VSA volunteers receive a living allowance and accommodation, insurance, and medical costs are provided. Travel arrangements are organised and funded by VSA along with other costs.§§ §VSA’s response to COVID-19§ §§ Although we have temporarily put our deployment of volunteers on hold due to COVID-19 restrictions and uncertainties both within New Zealand and across the wider Pacific, we’re continuing to recruit and build our talent pool of prospective volunteers so we can return to supporting our partner organisations and communities in the wider Pacific as soon as we can.§   § The Volunteer Recruitment team is continuing to work through all our current applications and keep in touch with applicants.§ § Recruitment will continue although our usual processes will be amended where necessary to ensure social distancing requirements are maintained, such as a greater emphasis on carrying out interviews remotely.§   § Meanwhile, Programme Managers are working with partner organisations and on updating assignment descriptions. This work will help us determine which skills and experience our volunteers will need once we begin to redeploy people in the Pacific.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Organisation§Since its inception in 2003, Tonga's Public Service Commission has implemented a number of reform initiatives in Human Resources, Policy, and other priority needs across the country. The Office of the Public Service Commission (OPSC) has also held responsibility for all HR management functions and is now in a position delegate this to each Government Ministry.  The Human Resources Delegation Framework is the means by which OPSC will carry out its delegation programme. §The Opportunity§ In this assignment you will work alongside the CEO and Deputy Secretary for Human Resources, as well as Ministry HR managers to ensure a successful transition.  You will assist with the final development of the Delegation Framework, and also provide advice on delegation piloting as well as a review of the pilot programme.§ On a day-to-day basis you will be mentoring and supporting staff with new processes within the Framework, leading training sessions and providing assistance to ministries engaged in the pilot programme. §Why You'll Love it§This is an impelling opportunity to utilise your senior HR skills to transform the entire Tongan public service. In addition to strengthening your existing professional credentials, you will enjoy everything Tonga has to offer- lush, natural landscapes, thriving marine life, and friendly, welcoming locals. § §We are looking for a volunteer with:§ § §Strong HR Advisory change management experience§ §Experience reviewing, developing and implementing HR frameworks, processes and procedures§ §Experience in staff development including mentoring and delivering training sessions§ §Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation processes§ § https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-§2019-2020§/TON-41254-HR-Change-Management-Adviser.pdf §  § §VSA volunteers receive a living allowance and accommodation, insurance, and medical costs are provided. Travel arrangements are organised and funded by VSA along with other costs.§§ §VSA’s response to COVID-19§ §§ Although we have temporarily put our deployment of volunteers on hold due to COVID-19 restrictions and uncertainties both within New Zealand and across the wider Pacific, we’re continuing to recruit and build our talent pool of prospective volunteers so we can return to supporting our partner organisations and communities in the wider Pacific as soon as we can.§   § The Volunteer Recruitment team is continuing to work through all our current applications and keep in touch with applicants.§ § Recruitment will continue although our usual processes will be amended where necessary to ensure social distancing requirements are maintained, such as a greater emphasis on carrying out interviews remotely.§   § Meanwhile, Programme Managers are working with partner organisations and on updating assignment descriptions. jobText: TXT/50653541.txt	§People & Performance Business Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & Performance Business Partner§§Advertiser: §Fletcher Building Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §People & Performance Business Partner §      §        §          §About Fletcher Construction§          §The Fletcher Construction Company is a strong family of connected businesses partnering with our customers to create places, spaces and networks that work for people. §          §          §Since 1909 our people have planned, built, maintained and managed critical infrastructure and buildings to strengthen and serve our communities in New Zealand and the South Pacific. Our people enjoy career development programmes, cross-business advancement opportunities and a range of staff benefits which makes Fletcher an employer of choice §          §          §The opportunities§          §We have two fixed term (12 and 15 month) opportunities available for People and Performance superstars to join our Team.  As a People and Performance professional you will understand the importance of partnering with the business, you will understand business challenges and support your business unit by providing long lasting solutions.§          §          §Our varied workforce means that one day you might be out on site with our Teams getting dirt on your boots, while another will be spent alongside our Senior Leadership team advising and guiding on best practice P&P solutions, with that in mind you will understand how important the delivery of concise and pragmatic advice to all levels within our organisation is critical.  You can expect to be at the forefront of taking ownership of new initiatives and as a culturally a diverse organisation you will enjoy working in this space. §          §          §As a strong P&P generalist, you won’t be afraid of ambiguity, you will be resilient and comfortable with change and it’s a given that you will come in and hit the ground running. Your strengths will lie in ER, change management, capability and performance, reporting and insights and of course, everyday business as usual challenges. §          §          §You’ll bring a highly self-motivated approach to your role (no micro-managing here!) -  with the proven ability of using your experience and judgement to apply sensible and well-thought out solutions.§          §§          §To be successful in these roles you will need to bring the following:§          §§          §• Strong, confident communication style§          §• Excellent stakeholder engagement§          §• Ability to act as a generalist with experience across the range of P&P functions§          §• Demonstrated working knowledge of HR legislation and processes in particular ER§          §• Experience within construction, transport, logistics, Infrastructure would be an advantage along with experience aligning                yourself to projects within these industries§          §          §Interested?§          §Ready for the challenge and want to align your goals with ours? If so, we would love to hear from you! Please apply directly online or for further information please contact Tracy O’Neill, Talent Acquisition Manager:  §tracyo@fcc.co.nz§        §        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About Fletcher Construction§The Fletcher Construction Company is a strong family of connected businesses partnering with our customers to create places, spaces and networks that work for people. §§Since 1909 our people have planned, built, maintained and managed critical infrastructure and buildings to strengthen and serve our communities in New Zealand and the South Pacific. Our people enjoy career development programmes, cross-business advancement opportunities and a range of staff benefits which makes Fletcher an employer of choice §§The opportunities§We have two fixed term (12 and 15 month) opportunities available for People and Performance superstars to join our Team.  As a People and Performance professional you will understand the importance of partnering with the business, you will understand business challenges and support your business unit by providing long lasting solutions.§§Our varied workforce means that one day you might be out on site with our Teams getting dirt on your boots, while another will be spent alongside our Senior Leadership team advising and guiding on best practice P&P solutions, with that in mind you will understand how important the delivery of concise and pragmatic advice to all levels within our organisation is critical.  You can expect to be at the forefront of taking ownership of new initiatives and as a culturally a diverse organisation you will enjoy working in this space. §§As a strong P&P generalist, you won’t be afraid of ambiguity, you will be resilient and comfortable with change and it’s a given that you will come in and hit the ground running. jobText: TXT/50653557.txt	§HR Advisor/Kaitohutohu Taha Kaimahi§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Advisor/Kaitohutohu Taha Kaimahi§§Advertiser: §Capital and Coast District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §HR Advisor/Kaitohutohu Taha Kaimahi §      §        §Nau mai, haere mai ki Ūpoko ki te uru hauora§        §Location: Wellington Regional Hospital§        §Contract: Permanent Full Time§        §About the role§        §Are you looking for an HR role with a difference? Have you thought about working in the Health Sector? If so read further....§        §CCDHB is looking for an HR Advisor to join the People, Culture and Capability Team. It is a demanding, busy, bouncing ball, but a fun & supportive environment.§        §You will be involved with:§        §          §Preparing for MECA / SECA negotiations, and subsequently being the subject matter expert on the implementation of the collective agreements.  This will involve working closely with our payroll team and the unions§          §Interesting IR issues including giving advice on the interpretation of MECA’s / SECA’s / employment legislation§          §HR policy work§          §Working with the Capability Development Team to identify opportunities and ways to share information / experience across the HR teams§          §Some generalist HR work§          §Regular formal and informal meetings with the various health sector unions.  CCDHB values the relationship with our union partners, and these meetings are a key part of that§          §Some aspects of this role may require working with the HR Team at Hutt Valley DHB §          §We have some flexibility to vary the scope of the role depending on the skills which the appointee brings to the job.§        §        §This is very much a role which somebody can make their own, and make their mark on the organisation. You will be well supported by the Managers, as well as having a great HR team around you to help you settle in and get up to speed. §        §This would be a good opportunity for someone who is ready to stretch into an organisation with unique complexities. We are the largest employer in the Wellington region with approximately 6,000 full time, part time, fixed term and casual so for the right person, this role will provide an opportunity for significant growth and experience in a really interesting sector. §        §About our organisation§        §Capital and Coast DHB (CCDHB) is located centrally in Wellington and has over 6,000 full-time equivalent staff, making us one of the major employers in the Wellington region. CCDHB operates two hospitals – Wellington Regional Hospital in Newtown and Kenepuru Hospital in Porirua – as well as the Kapiti Health Centre at Paraparaumu. §        §The Mental Health, Addiction and Intellectual Disability Service (MHAIDS) spans three DHBs - Wairarapa, Hutt Valley and Capital and Coast DHB’s and includes local, regional, and national services. The local MHAIDS services are provided from multiple sites within the 3DHB sub-region – greater Wellington, Hutt Valley and Wairarapa. §        §Here at CCDHB we embrace diversity and welcome applications from people of all gender identities, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, disability and religions. A workforce that is diverse and inclusive means that we are better positioned to understand and serve our community.§        §CCDHB is a pro-equity Health Organisation, with a particular focus on Māori and Pacific Peoples and the Disability Community.§        §CCDHB provides a range of specialist services including neurosurgery, oncology, neonatal intensive care and community-based services including district nursing, rehabilitation services, social work, alcohol and drug services, and home support services to a population of around 900,000 people.§        §How to apply§        §Applications close 14th October 2020 and can only be accepted when submitted through our CCDHB Careers Website. For further information on this role, email §recruitment@ccdhb.org.nz§ and indicate the job title and vacancy number vacancy number in the subject line.§        §Please note that applications will be considered as they are received. This means that the role may be filled before the closing date, so don’t delay if you wish to apply.§        §Ma tini, ma mano, ka rapa te whai§        §By joining together we will succeed§      §      §      §    §    §capitalhealth.careercentre.net.nz§  §§§Nau mai, haere mai ki Ūpoko ki te uru hauora§ §Location: Wellington Regional Hospital§ §Contract: Permanent Full Time§ §About the role§ §Are you looking for an HR role with a difference? Have you thought about working in the Health Sector? If so read further....§ §CCDHB is looking for an HR Advisor to join the People, Culture and Capability Team. It is a demanding, busy, bouncing ball, but a fun & supportive environment.§ §You will be involved with:§ § §Preparing for MECA / SECA negotiations, and subsequently being the subject matter expert on the implementation of the collective agreements.  This will involve working closely with our payroll team and the unions§ §Interesting IR issues including giving advice on the interpretation of MECA’s / SECA’s / employment legislation§ §HR policy work§ §Working with the Capability Development Team to identify opportunities and ways to share information / experience across the HR teams§ §Some generalist HR work§ §Regular formal and informal meetings with the various health sector unions.  CCDHB values the relationship with our union partners, and these meetings are a key part of that§ §Some aspects of this role may require working with the HR Team at Hutt Valley DHB § §We have some flexibility to vary the scope of the role depending on the skills which the appointee brings to the job.§ §This is very much a role which somebody can make their own, and make their mark on the organisation. You will be well supported by the Managers, as well as having a great HR team around you to help you settle in and get up to speed. § §This would be a good opportunity for someone who is ready to stretch into an organisation with unique complexities. We are the largest employer in the Wellington region with approximately 6,000 full time, part time, fixed term and casual so for the right person, this role will provide an opportunity for significant growth and experience in a really interesting sector. § §About our organisation§ §Capital and Coast DHB (CCDHB) is located centrally in Wellington and has over 6,000 full-time equivalent staff, making us one of the major employers in the Wellington region. CCDHB operates two hospitals – Wellington Regional Hospital in Newtown and Kenepuru Hospital in Porirua – as well as the Kapiti Health Centre at Paraparaumu. § §The Mental Health, Addiction and Intellectual Disability Service (MHAIDS) spans three DHBs - Wairarapa, Hutt Valley and Capital and Coast DHB’s and includes local, regional, and national services. The local MHAIDS services are provided from multiple sites within the 3DHB sub-region – greater Wellington, Hutt Valley and Wairarapa. § §Here at CCDHB we embrace diversity and welcome applications from people of all gender identities, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, disability and religions. A workforce that is diverse and inclusive means that we are better positioned to understand and serve our community.§ §CCDHB is a pro-equity Health Organisation, with a particular focus on Māori and Pacific Peoples and the Disability Community.§ §CCDHB provides a range of specialist services including neurosurgery, oncology, neonatal intensive care and community-based services including district nursing, rehabilitation services, social work, alcohol and drug services, and home support services to a population of around 900,000 people.§ §How to apply§ §Applications close 14th October 2020 and can only be accepted when submitted through our CCDHB Careers Website. For further information on this role, email §recruitment@ccdhb.org.nz§ and indicate the job title and vacancy number vacancy number in the subject line.§ §Please note that applications will be considered as they are received. This means that the role may be filled before the closing date, so don’t delay if you wish to apply.§ §Ma tini, ma mano, ka rapa te whai§ §By joining together we will succeed§§§§

We work with our clients and candidates to build great relationships so we can match the right person for the right role.  § §Here's our latest opportunity!§ §The Company§ Caroline Eve is a successful New Zealand privately owned and operated retail chain of womenswear stores, based in Tamahere, Hamilton.  The business has been trading for over 30 years and has 40 stores nationwide.  With progressive change in the retail industry and trading fluctuations, this highly reputable company is now looking to appoint a full time Human Resource Manager.§  § §The Role§ In this integral position the Human Resource Manager will drive change, influence and work on critical business and HR Projects. As the HR Manager you will provide expert advice and guidance in all HR areas, while working closely with the Managing Director to drive high performance and encourage employee engagement.§  § §The Person§ To be successful, you will need to demonstrate the following skills and experience:§        §          §Proven experience as a Senior HR Advisor or Manager§          §Sound experience managing employment processes§          §Strong knowledge and experience of NZ employment legislation. As a professional, you will keep up to date with relevant employment law precedent decisions to ensure that the company uses best practice in procedures and processes in dealing with employees.§          §Ability to resolve conflict and work efficiently under pressure and effective problem solving and analytical and project management skills.§          §High attention to detail, with strong communication skills, both written and verbal.§          §A high level of professionalism, with a down to earth approach and sense of humour.§          §Ability to build positive relationships and be flexible in your work style and ready to “muck in” if needed.§          §Commercial acumen and ability to think strategically.§          §A pro-active and independent attitude that will allow you to take responsibility.§          §A willingness to travel to our national locations and support management on HR issues.§        §  § By joining Caroline Eve, you will be instrumental in making a positive contribution to the company's success. In return you will receive a competitive remuneration package including specialist health insurance and you will work in a lovely rural environment on the edge of Hamilton city.§  § Applications close 13 October 2020.§  § For confidential enquiries please contact Senga Allen on 027 210 4212.§      §      §      §    §    §everestpeople.co.nz§  §§§At Everest, we are all about people. We work with our clients and candidates to build great relationships so we can match the right person for the right role.  § §Here's our latest opportunity!§ §The Company§ Caroline Eve is a successful New Zealand privately owned and operated retail chain of womenswear stores, based in Tamahere, Hamilton.  The business has been trading for over 30 years and has 40 stores nationwide.  With progressive change in the retail industry and trading fluctuations, this highly reputable company is now looking to appoint a full time Human Resource Manager.§  § §The Role§ In this integral position the Human Resource Manager will drive change, influence and work on critical business and HR Projects. As the HR Manager you will provide expert advice and guidance in all HR areas, while working closely with the Managing Director to drive high performance and encourage employee engagement.§  § §The Person§ To be successful, you will need to demonstrate the following skills and experience:§ § §Proven experience as a Senior HR Advisor or Manager§ §Sound experience managing employment processes§ §Strong knowledge and experience of NZ employment legislation. As a professional, you will keep up to date with relevant employment law precedent decisions to ensure that the company uses best practice in procedures and processes in dealing with employees.§ §Ability to resolve conflict and work efficiently under pressure and effective problem solving and analytical and project management skills.§ §High attention to detail, with strong communication skills, both written and verbal.§ §A high level of professionalism, with a down to earth approach and sense of humour.§ §Ability to build positive relationships and be flexible in your work style and ready to “muck in” if needed.§ §Commercial acumen and ability to think strategically.§ §A pro-active and independent attitude that will allow you to take responsibility.§ §A willingness to travel to our national locations and support management on HR issues.§ §  § By joining Caroline Eve, you will be instrumental in making a positive contribution to the company's success. In return you will receive a competitive remuneration package including specialist health insurance and you will work in a lovely rural environment on the edge of Hamilton city.§  § Applications close 13 October 2020.§  § For confidential enquiries please contact Senga Allen on 027 210 4212.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in industrial relations & employment law?§How many years' experience do you have as a human resources manager?§§§

jobText: TXT/50653788.txt	§Manawatu/Wanganui Branch & BD Manager  §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manawatu/Wanganui Branch & BD Manager  §§Advertiser: §AWF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Agency§§§§§§We have a great opportunity for an experienced hands on client relationship developer to lead and grow our Palmerston North and Wanganui branches.§ § Our regional branches represent a key part of AWF’s strategy to maintain its position as NZ’s leading provider of labour hire and permanent placement services to key provincial centres throughout the country§ § This Palmerston North based position revolves around growing business in a competitive environment through development and execution of a sound sales plan, delivering first class service to clients and candidates alike, leading and driving a team and operating within the risk management parameters of the company as a whole.§ § Ideally we’d like you to have a good understanding of the local economy, the people and the down to earth patriotic nature we have in this part of the world. And some sound exposure to multiple business sectors including manufacturing, logistics, roading/infrastructure and engineering.§ § The focus is on sales and people - both our clients and candidates and your team§ § You will:§ §  Lead by example, supporting and motivating your small team§ §  Seek out, win and maximise sales within existing customers, but also through growth of our client base§ §  Exceed financial targets§ §  Promote company driven key initiatives with a local flavour§ §  Ensure Health & Safety compliance is maintained - to both company and client standards§ § In this role you will be a critical part of driving the success of the Palmerston North and Wanganui branches. We require a self-motivator with focus and drive, who can juggle conflicting priorities, work smart to meet the demand, keep cool under pressure and provide solutions. We are people finding people for people, and everything that can go wrong sometimes does. You’ll therefore need to be someone with resilience and a ‘never say die’ approach, providing exceptional service to both clients and candidates whilst also working within financial guidelines.§ § Experience running a successful small B2B business or a branch of a national entity will be highly regarded.§ § Interested in learning more?
