You will regularly consult with these managers and will be required to provide direction, support, and advice for handling all people-related situations.§About you§To succeed in the role, you will need to be an engaged people person who can take big picture strategy and turn that into effective day-to-day processes; you must also follow through on those processes. You will need to be comfortable holding difficult conversations and maintain a pragmatic approach, finding solutions to issues that are in the best interest of the business and our people. §About PAK’nSAVE Papamoa §PAK’nSAVE Papamoa has a major influence in our wider community and contributes significantly to local causes such as surf lifesaving clubs, teaching kids to swim programs, coast guard, resilience coaching in the local high school for young girls, and the Big Buddy program for boys, as well as the tech rescue helicopter. It will change the way healthcare is delivered, and make a positive impact on millions of people’s lives. And our engineers are at the forefront of this mission.§        §About the role§        §This is a 3-5 month clean up job, working within the People team at Orion Health. But we are only getting started...§ §We’re building the world’s most advanced health technology platform. It will change the way healthcare is delivered, and make a positive impact on millions of people’s lives. And our engineers are at the forefront of this mission.§ §About the role§ §This is a 3-5 month clean up job, working within the People team at Orion Health. This role is crucial as it related to the correction of leave records and calculations.§ §You will be willing to roll up your sleeves and jump in the get the job done. This role supports the team by ensuring you resolve internal discrepancies, communicate with the effected employees and resolve any issues within a quick turnaround time.§ §You will also be responsible for the following:§ § §Read and interpret annual leave reports§ §Understand the corrections that need to be made (with employees and in the HRIS)§ §Communicate 1:1 with relevant employees to explain the correction that needs to be made§ §Communicate with payroll and IAT teams about the corrections that need to be made§ §Maintain a tracking database of all corrections and see the corrections through to a complete resolve§ §Maintain records (in appropriate systems) of any corrections§ §Woking closely with IAT and payroll and assist them with the discrepancies regarding annual leave§ §About you§ § §1-2 years’ experience within a HR Administration function§ §Be confident working with different HR and finance systems§ §Have an open and collaborative communication style§ §Be an excellent multi tasker, juggling multiple records and actions at the same time§ §A whiz with record keeping and maintaining personnel files§ §Have high levels of discretion and privacy, especially as you will be handling sensitive personnel files§ §Be available immediately, for 40 hours a week, for 3-5 months§ §A mix of remote and office work required§ §If this sounds like the role for you, we'd love to hear from you.§§§§

jobTitle: COVID-19 L&D Consultant - (Fixed-Term Contract) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50656724.txt	§COVID-19 L&D Consultant - (Fixed-Term Contract)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§COVID-19 L&D Consultant - (Fixed-Term Contract)§§Advertiser: §Homecare Medical§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §      §COVID-19 L&D Consultant - (Fixed-Term Contract) §      §      §      §        §Work in Homecare Medical's COVID Response Programme and join an agile working environment to provide L&D specialist capability!§        §          §Dynamic environment helping NZers fight COVID§          §Work in Homecare Medical's COVID Response Programme in our Grafton Office§          §Join an agile working environment§          §Fixed-term contract starting immediately until 25 June 2021§        §        §About the role§        §As a COVID-19 L&D Consultant, you will support the COVID-19 programme by designing and delivering company training and development activities in accordance with the COVID-19 Programme, MOH specifications and HCM practices and standards.§        §Duties include the following:§        §          §Providing L&D specialist capability working in one of three cross-disciplinary squads that make up the programme: Systems and Change; COVID Management Systems; Onboarding§          §Bring your design and build skills in customer experience, graphic and multimedia, and learning, to help our people provide crucial support to NZers across the country§        §        §This is a fixed-term contract starting immediately until 25 June 2021.§        §Qualifications and experience:§        §          §Tertiary qualification in adult learning - desirable§          §Strong customer service and/or patient care focus§          §Experience in the use of Information Technology systems§          §Experience in agile working environments and agile ways of working§          §Graphic design and experience design highly regarded§        §        §Skills and competence:§        §          §L&D consulting to a senior level i.e. comfortable engaging with a broad range of people including senior leaders§          §Design and build of learning solutions across a range of channels: video, live, virtual, digital§          §Note: We do not use eLearning software for our solutions. Specialist eLearning designers are not required unless they bring broader digital and consulting skills§          §Multimedia and / or graphic design skills are highly regarded§          §Experience in LMS administration (e.g. enrolments, reporting, basic course design and construction) are highly regarded (Homecare uses a Totara platform)§          §Customer experience design, design thinking and/or human centred design experience highly regarded§        §        §About us§        §We are privileged to provide the people of Aotearoa New Zealand with professional, quality advice, support and information across a range of health and mental health services. We do this 24 hours a day, seven days a week across seven digital channels. We bring together a range of national helplines, including - Healthline and COVID-19 Healthline, Need to Talk 1737, Quitline, Alcohol and Drug Helpline, Gambling Helpline and a range of Health and Mental Health after-hours services. Homecare Medical also manages the National Cervical Screening Register and the National Bowel Screening Register.§        §If the idea of a role where you can positively impact the lives and well-being of your fellow New Zealanders appeals, we'd love to hear from you! Apply online today!§      §      §      §    §  §§§Work in Homecare Medical's COVID Response Programme and join an agile working environment to provide L&D specialist capability!§Dynamic environment helping NZers fight COVID§Work in Homecare Medical's COVID Response Programme in our Grafton Office§Join an agile working environment§Fixed-term contract starting immediately until 25 June 2021§About the role§As a COVID-19 L&D Consultant, you will support the COVID-19 programme by designing and delivering company training and development activities in accordance with the COVID-19 Programme, MOH specifications and HCM practices and standards.§Duties include the following:§Providing L&D specialist capability working in one of three cross-disciplinary squads that make up the programme: Systems and Change; COVID Management Systems; Onboarding§Bring your design and build skills in customer experience, graphic and multimedia, and learning, to help our people provide crucial support to NZers across the country§This is a fixed-term contract starting immediately until 25 June 2021.§Qualifications and experience:§Tertiary qualification in adult learning - desirable§Strong customer service and/or patient care focus§Experience in the use of Information Technology systems§Experience in agile working environments and agile ways of working§Graphic design and experience design highly regarded§Skills and competence:§L&D consulting to a senior level i.e. comfortable engaging with a broad range of people including senior leaders§Design and build of learning solutions across a range of channels: video, live, virtual, digital§Note: We do not use eLearning software for our solutions. jobTitle: Human Resources Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50657117.txt	§Human Resources Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Resources Manager§§Advertiser: §Hydraulink Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§About the role§Would you like to be part of a dynamic company whose purpose is “To Keep the Industry, it’s Equipment and our Valued Customers Working”. Hydraulink’s people are its most valuable asset and this role is central to the company achieving the strategic direction and organisational development required to ensure the business can deliver on its purpose.§Would you like a role where you can contribute proactively to the business as part of the Senior Leadership Team and provide specialist direction and guidance as the HR and H&S expert?§This is a great opportunity to enhance our already great culture by contributing new and innovative ideas which will continue to drive the people focused improvements demanded of a high-performance business. Exciting stuff!§Reporting directly to the CEO, the role is designed to provide a high-quality HR and H&S resource for Hydraulink New Zealand. You get to drive and deliver everything from recruitment, onboarding and retention, HS&E, performance management, learning and development, ER & IR, organisational change and more. Working closely with your Australian equivalent, you will also have the opportunity to develop and implement cohesive ANZ HR and H&S policies, processes and systems that support the achievement of Group-wide strategic goals.§A 0.5FTE Technical Trainer reports directly to this role plus you have shared access for support from our Executive Assistant.§About the person§You might be an HR Advisor or Business Partner on an upward trajectory in your HR career looking for that next step into a full generalist HR Manager’s function. Alternatively, you could be an experienced HR professional looking for a fresh challenge or someone returning to work following a break.§Your industry background is less important than your ability to balance commercial imperatives with a genuine “We Care” approach to the people within the business and have fun doing it.§This is a busy role supporting a 24/7 breakdown business so you will need to be able to manage a fluctuating workload, with regularly changing priorities, yet still be able to deliver effective operational HR and H&S services to the business.§You will need to have at least three years frontline operational experience, ideally as a HR generalist, and preferably in an industrial or related sector. Key competencies are:§Strategic thinking skills§Influencing and negotiating skills§Strong interpersonal skills go with the territory§Proven leadership and communication skills§Ability to drive projects to completion§The ability to interact across a very wide range of stakeholders.§Experience with the rollout and imbedding of HRIS products such Cornerstone or similar would be a huge advantage.§Last but by no means least, Hydraulink operate in a safety sensitive sector and utilise an external consultancy to support it at a strategic level. You don’t have to be a certified H&S specialist, although it wouldn’t hurt, but you do need to know your way around this business-critical area at an operational level. If not, you will need to be a quick study.§About the company§At Hydraulink we like to keep things moving, it's in our DNA. After all we are a leading multinational hose and fittings brand with a huge network in Australia, New Zealand and Asia Pacific.§And unlike some of our competitors, Hydraulink has also come through the COVID-19 crisis in pretty good shape.§A company which has successfully survived tough economic times before, we are one of the biggest players in our sector. We have a strong brand, a great product and service offering, a diverse customer base and an awesome team.§We are building on almost 75 years of success, and constantly looking at what's next to drive the future for us, and to deliver for our customers. Why not come and be part of that!§Applicants §MUST HAVE §Citizenship or Residency as well as a current NZ driver's license. A pre-­employment medical (including drug & alcohol screen) & criminal record check may form part of our recruitment process.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Recruitment Consultant - Planning & Surveying Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50657456.txt	§Recruitment Consultant - Planning & Surveying§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Consultant - Planning & Surveying§§Advertiser: §Rice Consulting Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$60,000 - $80,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Recruitment Consultant - Planning & Surveying §      §      §        §Having come out of the worst of the downturn this well known specialist construction agency is looking to add to their team. Impressively, they managed to keep everyone on board and are now looking to add to their lively and collaborative office with a greenfields opportunity for the right consultant. Planning and Surveying is a busy market and one that is not over saturated by consultants in that space. For consultants who have heard their clients say "they are the 6th recruiter to call today!" this would be a welcome change. With a plethora of work but only two agencies really working in the space it's a highlighted area for growth. The role requires a relationship focused and highly self motivated recruiter to knock on doors and pick up phones in order to get in front of the client base and establish themselves as the number 1 recruiter in the space. Having picked up a number of roles through their own client base the need and demand is immediate but the successful consultant will be expected to then source their own business going forward. §        §        §The benefits are certainly there for the right consultant with a comm structure that will see the successful applicant taking almost HALF of the fee. Most comm structures this lucrative will require a buy in from the consult for marketing or a minor investment, this option provides all the infrastructure, culture and security of a well run agency. Consultants often bounce ideas of one another and splitting deals has become the norm in this collaborative and enjoyable work place. At under 10 consultants and 1 office dog the team have fun at work but have priorities outside of work, they celebrate success away from the usual p*ss up. The ideal candidate will be experienced in agency recruitment, have experience in establishing and growing professional relationships, have a history of proven billings and comfortable with business development. As mentioned, only a few consultants have specific industry experience recruiting in this sector, the client will look at recruitment consultants from within the construction vertical, engineering (civil or structural) or even more outside the box provided they posses the aforementioned attributes. Recruitment agency experience is crucial. Threshold is calculated on base salary so a consultant who has an appreciation for the bigger picture will seize on this opportunity and carve themselves a path in a market that is unhindered by other consultants. §      §      §Scott Burnett§+64 21 293 4913§scott@rice.co.nz§ §    §    §  §§§Having come out of the worst of the downturn this well known specialist construction agency is looking to add to their team. Impressively, they managed to keep everyone on board and are now looking to add to their lively and collaborative office with a greenfields opportunity for the right consultant. Planning and Surveying is a busy market and one that is not over saturated by consultants in that space. For consultants who have heard their clients say "they are the 6th recruiter to call today!" this would be a welcome change. With a plethora of work but only two agencies really working in the space it's a highlighted area for growth. The role requires a relationship focused and highly self motivated recruiter to knock on doors and pick up phones in order to get in front of the client base and establish themselves as the number 1 recruiter in the space. Having picked up a number of roles through their own client base the need and demand is immediate but the successful consultant will be expected to then source their own business going forward. §§The benefits are certainly there for the right consultant with a comm structure that will see the successful applicant taking almost HALF of the fee. Most comm structures this lucrative will require a buy in from the consult for marketing or a minor investment, this option provides all the infrastructure, culture and security of a well run agency. Consultants often bounce ideas of one another and splitting deals has become the norm in this collaborative and enjoyable work place. At under 10 consultants and 1 office dog the team have fun at work but have priorities outside of work, they celebrate success away from the usual p*ss up. The ideal candidate will be experienced in agency recruitment, have experience in establishing and growing professional relationships, have a history of proven billings and comfortable with business development. As mentioned, only a few consultants have specific industry experience recruiting in this sector, the client will look at recruitment consultants from within the construction vertical, engineering (civil or structural) or even more outside the box provided they posses the aforementioned attributes. Recruitment agency experience is crucial. Threshold is calculated on base salary so a consultant who has an appreciation for the bigger picture will seize on this opportunity and carve themselves a path in a market that is unhindered by other consultants. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50659625.txt	§Recruitment Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Manager§§Advertiser: §Ruby Recruit Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§Warren and Mahoney is an iconic New Zealand architectural and design practice, renowned for its striking contemporary buildings created by a team focused on design excellence and innovation.  The organisation has evolved into an insight led, multidisciplinary practice which has grown rapidly in recent years and now operates across Asia Pacific with studios in seven Australasian cities, employing around 280 people. §Warren and Mahoney is looking to recruit an experienced, high performing Recruitment Manager to lead its recruitment activities across Australia and NZ, ensuring it continues to hire the most talented people, with diverse skills and experience to achieve its ambitious vision and goals. §Key responsibilities include the development and implementation of an overall sourcing strategy through gaining a sound understanding of the current and future recruitment needs, and industry trends. You will oversee the day to day recruitment activities, be focused on delivering high quality candidate care, develop talent pools for key roles, and manage agency relationships. §To be a success in this role, you will bring demonstrable experience and understanding of best practice recruitment, be a strategic thinker and influencer, have worked on employment branding activities and, most importantly, demonstrate excellent communication skills.  Ideally you will have a minimum of 10 years of relevant recruitment experience, including working in an in-house recruitment function. If you are seeking a vibrant, collaborative and inclusive culture, and a role that truly partners with its stakeholders then this could be the challenge you are looking for.§To apply, please submit your CV and covering letter using the link. (please use link rather than direct applications so we are able to respond accurately and efficiently - thank you!). §Please note our clients are unable to provide sponsorship for this role therefore candidates need to be eligible to work in New Zealand.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of recruitment experience do you have?§§§

jobText: TXT/50661850.txt	§Recruitment Facilitator §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Facilitator §§Advertiser: §Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Recruitment Facilitator §      §        §          §Passionate about making a real difference to people's lives?§          §Proven experience in recruitment?§          §Advocate of the trades as a sustainable career choice§          §Full time position - Auckland Central City based   §          §Salary range $91K - $113K depending on experience§        §        § §        §As the Recruitment Facilitator§        §TXT and Skills Hubs have been included as one of a package of initiatives in a government wide initiative called the Construction Skills Action Plan. §        §Construction is a key industry for the delivery of the Government's priorities and currently the construction industry does not have the skilled domestic workforce needed to build at pace and scale.  §        §TXT and Skills Hubs are one response to addressing labour and skills shortages.  By siting themselves close to large scale construction projects or clusters of projects, Hubs seek to    unlock the potential of tapping into a long term stream of employment and career opportunity for communities close to projects, thereby improving inter-generational economic and social wellbeing in those communities.§        §As the Recruitment Facilitator this role plays a key part of the wider TXT and Skills Hub and operates under the Hubs vision and values alongside a variety of key stakeholders.  This role will be a key pillar for a 'one stop shop' service approach for industry in relation to on-site training, promoting the investment in industry training and being a voice for trainee and employer needs. With a focus on individuals who are at various stages of seeking employment, this role is to oversee, facilitate and co-ordinate recruitment activities to ensure workforce development needs are met. There is a clear focus on remaining learner and employer centric in delivery and support including alignment to pastoral care of learners.§        §This also is a fantastic opportunity to truly collaborate with numerous organisations that contribute to a TXT and Skills Hub, all sharing the passion to tap into employment and careers offered by Auckland's major construction developments   and connect and support local jobseekers into those jobs and careers. §        §This role is part of the Sector Workforce Engagement Programme (SWEP) which supports businesses to invest and grow through better ways of accessing reliable, appropriately skilled staff at the right time and place.  The intention of SWEP is for government and industry partners to work together to identify and develop solutions that achieve both business and government objectives.§        § §        §Skills and experience required:§        §We are keen to hear from you if you have:§        §          §Proven recruitment experience§          §A passion for recruitment and getting  people connected to jobs and careers they can thrive in §          §Detailed knowledge and experience in working with a range  of recruitment applications and services§          §Strong relationship management skills; builds and sustains relationships  with job seekers and employers through respect for individuals, open communication and displaying sensitivity towards people§          §Sound writing and verbal communication skills, including well-developed presentation skills§          §Experience working with a wide range of job seeking candidates to support them in to employment k including young people entering the workforce and people looking to change careers paths or  re enter the work force§          §Demonstrates initiative and ownership, taking action before being asked and proactively makes suggestions on how to improve things at work§          §High level of attention to detail with the ability to maintain focus on priorities and work well under pressure§          §Able to embrace change and deal with ambiguity and uncertainty§          §Clean driver's license§          §Good level of IT  literacy and skills§          §Must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand§        §        § §        §Why work for us?§        §Developing our staff is a key focus for MBIE.  We aim to create a culture where staff are empowered to bring fresh perspectives to issues and to think outside the box.  Being the largest policy shop in NZ, MBIE offers significant opportunity for developing experience across a broad variety of areas. We encourage excellence and proactively support development through on-the-job learning, training courses, conferences and seminars, development programmes, secondments, rotations to other branches and study opportunities.§        § §        §About MBIE:§        §The purpose of the Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment (MBIE) is to Grow New Zealand for All.  Our goal is to create a strong and high-performing economy by creating an environment that supports businesses to become more productive and internationally competitive.§        §Our way of working is guided by our values which shape our behaviours. §        §          §Mahi Tahi - Better Together§          §Maia - Bold and brave§          §Pae Kahurangi - Build our Future§          §Pono Me Te Tika - Own It§        §        § §        §How to apply:§        §Click on the APPLY button below in order to be directed to our on-line careers website.  You may view a position description at this site, as well as complete the on-line application, and upload a CV and cover letter. For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§        §Email Jo Smith at §joanne.smith@mbie.govt.nz§ quoting ref MBIE/1470556 if you have any further questions.§        §Applications close at 5pm on Sunday 11th October 2020.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Passionate about making a real difference to people's lives?§§Proven experience in recruitment?§§Advocate of the trades as a sustainable career choice§§Full time position - Auckland Central City based   §§Salary range $91K - $113K depending on experience§§ §As the Recruitment Facilitator§TXT and Skills Hubs have been included as one of a package of initiatives in a government wide initiative called the Construction Skills Action Plan. §Construction is a key industry for the delivery of the Government's priorities and currently the construction industry does not have the skilled domestic workforce needed to build at pace and scale.  §TXT and Skills Hubs are one response to addressing labour and skills shortages.  By siting themselves close to large scale construction projects or clusters of projects, Hubs seek to    unlock the potential of tapping into a long term stream of employment and career opportunity for communities close to projects, thereby improving inter-generational economic and social wellbeing in those communities.§As the Recruitment Facilitator this role plays a key part of the wider TXT and Skills Hub and operates under the Hubs vision and values alongside a variety of key stakeholders.  This role will be a key pillar for a 'one stop shop' service approach for industry in relation to on-site training, promoting the investment in industry training and being a voice for trainee and employer needs. With a focus on individuals who are at various stages of seeking employment, this role is to oversee, facilitate and co-ordinate recruitment activities to ensure workforce development needs are met. There is a clear focus on remaining learner and employer centric in delivery and support including alignment to pastoral care of learners.§This also is a fantastic opportunity to truly collaborate with numerous organisations that contribute to a TXT and Skills Hub, all sharing the passion to tap into employment and careers offered by Auckland's major construction developments   and connect and support local jobseekers into those jobs and careers. §This role is part of the Sector Workforce Engagement Programme (SWEP) which supports businesses to invest and grow through better ways of accessing reliable, appropriately skilled staff at the right time and place.  The intention of SWEP is for government and industry partners to work together to identify and develop solutions that achieve both business and government objectives.§ §Skills and experience required:§We are keen to hear from you if you have:§§Proven recruitment experience§A passion for recruitment and getting  people connected to jobs and careers they can thrive in §Detailed knowledge and experience in working with a range  of recruitment applications and services§Strong relationship management skills; builds and sustains relationships  with job seekers and employers through respect for individuals, open communication and displaying sensitivity towards people§Sound writing and verbal communication skills, including well-developed presentation skills§Experience working with a wide range of job seeking candidates to support them in to employment k including young people entering the workforce and people looking to change careers paths or  re enter the work force§Demonstrates initiative and ownership, taking action before being asked and proactively makes suggestions on how to improve things at work§High level of attention to detail with the ability to maintain focus on priorities and work well under pressure§Able to embrace change and deal with ambiguity and uncertainty§Clean driver's license§Good level of IT  literacy and skills§Must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand§§ §Why work for us?§Developing our staff is a key focus for MBIE.  We aim to create a culture where staff are empowered to bring fresh perspectives to issues and to think outside the box.  Being the largest policy shop in NZ, MBIE offers significant opportunity for developing experience across a broad variety of areas. We encourage excellence and proactively support development through on-the-job learning, training courses, conferences and seminars, development programmes, secondments, rotations to other branches and study opportunities.§ §About MBIE:§The purpose of the Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment (MBIE) is to Grow New Zealand for All.  Our goal is to create a strong and high-performing economy by creating an environment that supports businesses to become more productive and internationally competitive.§Our way of working is guided by our values which shape our behaviours. §§Mahi Tahi - Better Together§Maia - Bold and brave§Pae Kahurangi - Build our Future§Pono Me Te Tika - Own It§§ §How to apply:§Click on the APPLY button below in order to be directed to our on-line careers website.  You may view a position description at this site, as well as complete the on-line application, and upload a CV and cover letter. For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§Email Jo Smith at §joanne.smith@mbie.govt.nz§ quoting ref MBIE/1470556 if you have any further questions.§Applications close at 5pm on Sunday 11th October 2020.§§§§

We require someone that has the ability to manage confrontation, or stop dangerous practices, in a firm yet respectful manner.§  §If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for then please apply.§  §Applications close at 5.00 pm on 14 October 2020.§  §Applications should be made online via § the careers section of Marlborough District Council’s website§ where you will find full information on the vacancy and how to apply.§  §For further information you are welcome to contact Earle Williams (Senior Advisor HR and H&S) on §earle.williams@marlborough.govt.nz§§§§

jobTitle: Workforce Planning and Development Lead Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50663601.txt	§Workforce Planning and Development Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Workforce Planning and Development Lead§§Advertiser: §KiwiRail§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Workforce Planning and Development Lead §        §          §Your role:§          §KiwiRail is undergoing a period of significant growth and investment in rail and asset upgrades across our New Zealand networks and services. As a result of this, we have created a new position to take the lead in our workforce planning and development across operational workstreams and key projects to create an enterprise-wide strategic workforce plan to ensure we meet current needs and plan for the future. Working closely with senior leaders and key stakeholders, you will gain an in-depth understanding of the immediate, short and long-term resourcing requirements to deliver across the various projects and workstreams and collaborate with Talent, Learning and Development and HR on the strategic plan. In addition to this the role will act as a subject matter expert for the organisation in workforce planning, educating, coaching and mentoring key stakeholders and people/project leaders in workforce planning methodology and creating sustainable workforce frameworks and toolkits for the business.§          §Your skills:§          §To be considered for this role you will have solid demonstrated experience in workforce planning across multiple streams of work at an enterprise level. Ideally you will have knowledge and understanding of the complexities of infrastructure/rail construction projects and how to develop and execute sustainable resourcing plans to support delivery. You will be a strategic thinker who can challenge traditional resourcing methods and take an enterprise-wide view in creating workforce plans while carefully considering organisational design and business strategic objectives. Naturally you will be a connector, with the ability to build strong working relationships at all levels and become a trusted business partner to key stakeholders. A tertiary qualification in HR or equivalent will be essential, as will be excellent communication skills both written and verbal. This role is a two year, fixed term contract.§        §        §        §      §      §    §  §§§Your role:§KiwiRail is undergoing a period of significant growth and investment in rail and asset upgrades across our New Zealand networks and services. As a result of this, we have created a new position to take the lead in our workforce planning and development across operational workstreams and key projects to create an enterprise-wide strategic workforce plan to ensure we meet current needs and plan for the future. Working closely with senior leaders and key stakeholders, you will gain an in-depth understanding of the immediate, short and long-term resourcing requirements to deliver across the various projects and workstreams and collaborate with Talent, Learning and Development and HR on the strategic plan. In addition to this the role will act as a subject matter expert for the organisation in workforce planning, educating, coaching and mentoring key stakeholders and people/project leaders in workforce planning methodology and creating sustainable workforce frameworks and toolkits for the business.§Your skills:§To be considered for this role you will have solid demonstrated experience in workforce planning across multiple streams of work at an enterprise level. Ideally you will have knowledge and understanding of the complexities of infrastructure/rail construction projects and how to develop and execute sustainable resourcing plans to support delivery. You will be a strategic thinker who can challenge traditional resourcing methods and take an enterprise-wide view in creating workforce plans while carefully considering organisational design and business strategic objectives. Naturally you will be a connector, with the ability to build strong working relationships at all levels and become a trusted business partner to key stakeholders. A tertiary qualification in HR or equivalent will be essential, as will be excellent communication skills both written and verbal. This role is a two year, fixed term contract.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

with skills and performance expectations).§        §        §How to apply§        §Apply online with your CV and cover letter that outlines your experience and motivation for the role.  Also, you need jobTitle: Job Search Professional / Employment Coach for Skilled Migrants Job in Tasman - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50663984.txt	§Job Search Professional / Employment Coach for Skilled Migrants§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Job Search Professional / Employment Coach for Skilled Migrants§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Immigration Concepts§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§New Zealand Immigration Concepts was established in Nelson in 1994. Today we are one of New Zealand’s leading immigration consultancies with our head office in Nelson and a branch in Wellington. § §Our team of Licensed Immigration Advisers and Job Search Professionals provide a superior and unique level of immigration assistance to highly skilled migrants from all over the world, assisting them with obtaining the necessary visas and finding employment. § §We are now looking for an additional§ §Job Search Professional/Employment Coach/Candidate Manager§ §who can be a star at helping our clients understand and navigate the New Zealand job market – ultimately leading to their success in finding a role in New Zealand.§ §This is a very pro-active and hands-on role to provide support for our clients throughout their entire job search journey. § §The ideal candidate for this role will need to have: § § §Strong coaching skills, with the ability to build effective working relationships with clients, and to help them develop a strategy that suits their employment needs§ §a solid understanding of the New Zealand job/labour market and the job application process§ §sound CV and cover letter writing and proofing skills, plus knowledge of platforms, such as LinkedIn § §the ability to contribute content for and take part in webinars – teaching an array of job search skills to those currently overseas § §the ability to build rapport quickly and work comfortably with people from varied cultural backgrounds § §a genuine interest in providing an outstanding level of support and encouragement, with the capacity for patience and perseverance§ §highly-organised, with the ability to be a self-starter who can work independently, and as part of a wider team§ §high ethical standards and integrity.§ §The journey of migrating to New Zealand is challenging and can be daunting for our clients at times, as many hurdles have to be taken along the way, particularly in a Covid-19 world. To help our clients navigate these difficult times, you will need to be patient and persistent. § §Our new team member will work closely with our Licensed Immigration Advisers in our Nelson office. § §Please email us your CV and cover letter today and let us know why you think you are our ideal candidate and when you would be able to start working with us. § §We are excited to hear from you!§ §Martina Koennecke, Director§New Zealand Immigration Concepts ltd. §MK@new-zealand-immigration.com§§§§

If you have any questions, please call Amanda on 021 §0818 7342§ quoting reference #3202.§          §Not quite what you are looking for?§Please register for ongoing opportunities at www.edenfx.co.nz§          § §        §        §        §        §          §edenfx NZ:§ edenfx.co.nz § §info@edenfx.co.nz§ § Auckland §+64 9 424 8367§ §          §edenfx AUS:§ edenfx.com.au§ §info@edenfx.com.au§ Sydney §+61 280 892 451§ Melbourne §+61 391 338 979§          §        §      §    §  §§§ §Unique opportunity to develop and transform safety§ §Nationwide, established and sustainable company§ §Idyllic location§ §Seeking an experienced, forward thinking health and safety professional who enjoys the challenge of a varied and dynamic environment§ §A multi-site business, with varied environments, my client is seeking an experienced health and safety manager who is not afraid to get their hands dirty, to develop, implement, educate and mentor.§ §This is an exciting opportunity to develop strategy and procedure at grass roots level, and then use your technical expertise to implement solid and practical safety systems and process company wide. You will lead by example, creating a genuine understanding of safety and its impact amongst the workforce and management.§ § §Develop, implement and monitor an effective H&S strategic plan§ §Lead the performance and growth of our client’s safety culture§ §Manage site audit schedules in line with legislative requirements§ §Ensure group wide reporting is developed and upheld§ §Develop, review and maintain all safety documentation§ §Manage return to work and injury management programmes§ §Guide and refocus health and safety committees§ § § §The successful candidate will have the necessary experience in developing, implementing and overseeing all facets of a practical, user friendly safety management system. jobTitle: Work Broker (Taumarunui) Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50665476.txt	§Work Broker (Taumarunui)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Work Broker (Taumarunui)§§Advertiser: §Ruapehu Recruitment Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Salary§§No§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Other§§§§§§Job Description – Work Broker§  § §About Ruapehu Recruitment§ Ruapehu Recruitment was established in February 2015 as part of the Ruapehu Whānau Transformation plan. Our creation was a response to the need for proactive connection between local workers and local employment opportunities, and the need for targeted training to lift the skill-base of the local population. We initially serviced the Raetihi, Ohakune and Waiouru communities, and now services the entire Ruapehu district. §  § §Our Strategy§ The first four years of our development focused heavily on employment outcomes. To keep serving the needs of our people in innovative and responsive ways, we are now focusing on directly developing the skill base of the district’s talent pool. Additionally, we know that there is an opportunity to grow an outdoor based environmental workforce. This future aim aligns with the iwi aspirations of having our own uri looking after, working within, and protecting, our local taiao/environment. Te Ara ki Te Moungaroa 2020 -2025 provides the overarching strategic guidance to the entire Ngāti Rangi Group.§  § §Staff§ This role requires a proactive individual who has strong networks amongst the Taumarunui businesses and community to support local people into local employment predominantly in the Taumarunui area. This role, from time to time, will be required to work within the southern area of the district, to support the overall operations of the entity. The applicant will be given rein to make the role their own, while growing, maintaining and protecting the credibility and high-trust in the brand and business. They will report to the Business & Recruitment Administrator. The business is also run in close association with the sole shareholder - Ngā Waihua o Paerangi Trust, as a part of the new Ngāti Rangi Group.§  § §Key Aspects of the Role§  § §Purpose§      ·       Provide all in-house administration requirements for the Taumarunui location§ ·       Support recruitment functions, predominantly in Taumarunui area§ ·       Support on-hire client contracts and candidates§ ·       Maintain and use strong communication tools of the business§ ·       Maintain strong relationships within the Taumarunui area§      § §Location §      The role is based at 153 Hakiaha Street, Taumarunui 3920§      § §Responsible to§      Business & Recruitment Administrator§      § §Responsible for§      Nil§      § §Term§      Fixed term- 2022§      § §Relationships Internal§      All Ngāti Rangi Group governors and staff. Strong communication with Ruapehu Recruitment staff.§  §      § §Relationships external §      -          Ngā Waihua o Paerangi Trust, as a part of the new Ngāti Rangi Group.§ -          Ngati Haua Iwi Trust§ -          Iwi§ -          Clients§ -          Local community§ -          Employers§ -          Training Providers§ -          Funders§ -          Other Partners§      § §Qualifications §      Business, Administration, Human Resource or other related area/s§  §      § §Personal Attributes – Essential §      -          §A passion for the development of people:§ An understanding of, and the ability to, effectively operate in a community focused and iwi owned organization, with a natural interest in helping others.§ -          §Efficient Wizard:§ Significant, demonstrated business administration experience with proven ability to develop and maintain admin systems. High attention to detail. Excellent time-management skills and ability to multitask with focus. Outgoing and self-motivated with a strong desire to excel.§ -          §Relationship Builder:§ A strong listener, skilled at building and continuously growing strong and trusted relationships externally and internally.§ -          §Agile:§ Ability to be proactive and reactive, managing multiple priorities and able to eliminate roadblocks and not be deterred by the unexpected or ‘never been attempted before’.§ -          §Tech and Communications star: §Extraordinary and modern communication skills and awareness; both written and verbal communications a strength. Proven ability to utilize technology and IT systems, and a natural ability to easily learn new systems. Exceptionally proficient in Microsoft office suite.  §      § §Personal attributes – desirable §      -          §Ruapehu Pride:§ An affinity for the Ruapehu area and an understanding of the opportunities provided within our socio-economic climate.§ -          §Te Reo: §confidence, ability or strong interest in Te Reo Māori.§ -          §Tikanga:§ Candidate inspired by history and legacies of the diverse populations of the Ruapehu area. An understanding of local tikanga.§      § §  § §Role Specification(s)§      § §  § §Key Accountabilities of Role: §  § §Administration Management               25%§      §Means§      § §  Lead all administration of the Taumarunui office to support delivery of the business strategy and operational targets§ §  Support/complete internal business reporting functions as required§ §  Compile all financial information and documentation to support accurate timely pay runs§ §  Manage all administrative requirements at location to meet contractual obligations, business planning targets§ §  Support co-ordination of training and development courses/opportunities.§      §  Internal reporting produced at agreed frequency§ §  Financial obligations of the business continue to be met§ §  Effective management and co-ordination of location§ §  Positive stakeholder feedback§      § §On-hire contract management         15% §      §Means§      § §  On-hire client requests are scoped and appropriate paperwork generated§ §  Candidate scheduling for on-hire works is completed and well managed§ §  Contractor service/supply agreements current and well managed§ §  Ensures all paperwork is completed and all new hires pre-screening testing and preparation is complete; background checks as required§ §  Support team to ensure accurate completion of external contractual obligations in relation to on-hire management eg. employment placement and confirmation report; monthly summary report’ service withdrawal report§ §  Maintain robust time tracking systems of any on-hire staff§      §  Templates maintained§ §  Candidate reports completed§ §  On-hire contracts monitored and maintained§ §  Collect data§ §  Administration requirements of on-hire thoroughly complete; required screening protocols complete incl. drug tests / background checks§      § §Recruitment and Work Placement          40%§      §Means§      § §  Ensure (temporary and permanent) employees recommended completely satisfy client requirements (ie. Seek candidates, interview, assess, reference check)§ §  Support the building and maintaining of a pool of qualified/talented candidates§ §  Maintain all database records, ensuring integrity.§ §  Conduct follow-up meetings with clients evaluating recruitment plans and implementation§ §  Conduct regular follow-up with candidates including the provision or facilitation of pastoral care as required§ §  Ensure all hiring paperwork is filled out thoroughly and all required screening protocols are completed for all new hires as well as, drug tests and background checks when required by the client§ §  Communicate with clients for job orders, and all candidate matters§      §  Placement of 50 clients per year§ §  Engage in the evaluation system in place to inform improved delivery of recruitment service, including a focus on pastoral care§ §  Collect data and information§ §  Positive stakeholder feedback§      § §Relationship Management         10%§      §Means§      § §  Cultivate relationships with local/central government, iwi, industry and businesses, and any other stakeholders§ §  Work with Te Pae Tata or other entities to establish a pathway of learning and development for locals entering the workforce or pursuing career change/s§ §  Support the development of the growth and training pathways of the business§ §  Build and maintain working relationships with clients and candidate base.§      §  Stakeholder/Client contacts database§ §  JobAdder up to date; local candidate base always available§ §  Collect data§      § §Health & Safety             10%§      §Means§      § Comply with the organisations Health and Safety Management system, including statutory obligations, within the workplace, including but not limited to:§ §  Identification and management of hazards and the associated risk.§ §  Ensure use of appropriate tools, equipment and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) to do the job(s) required.§ §  Ensure team members are competent and in a fit state to do the work they are asked to do.§ §  Initiate actions to prevent the occurrence of non-conformities in processes or systems.§ §  Verify and confirm the effective implementation of said solutions.§ §  Promote a positive health and safety culture in the workplace.§ §  Ensure audits are completed§ §   §      §  Compliant with Health & Safety management system audit requirements§      § §Additional Duties§      § Carry out any other duties reasonably requested from time to time.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§§§

jobText: TXT/50665984.txt	§Administrator People & Culture§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administrator People & Culture§§Advertiser: §NOVA ENERGY LIMITED§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Todd Corporation – Downstream Division§   § The family owned Todd Corporation is one of New Zealand’s largest and most successful companies. With a family and business history dating back to 1884, the Company has interests in hydrocarbon exploration and production, electricity generation, energy retailing, property development, minerals, healthcare and technology. The Downstream Division of Todd Corporation consists of four entities; Nova Energy, megaTel, Synergise and Todd Generation. We have office locations in Auckland, Wellington, Tauranga, Whakatane, New Plymouth and Christchurch.§ § § § §People & Culture Administrator§ § § § Changes within the People & Culture team have opened up a vacancy for an Administrator. Reporting to the Business Partner, People & Culture, this is a great opportunity for a new graduate to be developed into a generalist. We have some flexibility as to whether this is a full time or part time position depending on your level of previous experience.   § § § § §About the Role§ § §The People & Culture Administrator will work closely with the two Business Partners and Advisor to support the People strategy. Day to day, the role will provide administrative support to the team including managing our on and offboarding, employment letters, pulling reports and supporting the advisor with recruitment.§ § §About You§ § §Ideally you will have a Human Resources Management Degree or related Qualification§ §Excellent computer skills with a high standard of proficiency in Microsoft Office§ §Well-developed verbal and written communication skills§ §Ability to work accurately, with attention to detail§ §Flexibility and willingness to learn§ §Adept at developing and maintaining effective working relationships with personnel and stakeholders§ §Ability to prioritise and manage time effectively and demonstrate a well-organised and systematic approach§ § If you are a team player with a great attitude and passion for people, please apply to be a part of our close-knit high-performance team. Apply directly via the applicable link. For more information you can visit our website at www.novaenergy.co.nz  and follow this link to review the position description https://www.novaenergy.co.nz/position-description  § § Applications close §11 October 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Early in Career Partner - Recruitment - Oranga Tamariki Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50666608.txt	§Early in Career Partner - Recruitment - Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Early in Career Partner - Recruitment - Oranga Tamariki§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§Early in Career Partner - Recruitment - Oranga Tamariki  §12 month maternity leave cover Auckland/Wellington based§This is an exciting opportunity to work across the Recruitment and Professional Development teams and various front line managers to assist, create and implement an attraction and talent strategy to ensure there is a consistent approach to attracting and recruiting graduates and student placements across Oranga Tamariki. If you have experience managing graduate and/or intern recruitment programmes we want to hear from you! This is a unique opportunity for you to contribute to the attraction, selection, retention, and development of talent in the early stages of their career.  §What we need you to do?§Partner with business managers, the Organisational Development team and Professional Development team to embed the Early in Career Talent strategy§Working closely with the Recruitment Manager to, design, implement and manage the recruitment process for graduates and student placements for early in career recruitment§Build strong relationships with tertiary institutions§Support the Recruitment Manager to drive continuous improvement§Improve understanding of recruitment practices and lift the capability of others in the team§Help build the recruitment capability of our hiring managers§What you will bring to the role?§An understanding of end-to-end recruitment and experience managing graduate recruitment programmes in government or the private sector§Ability to work under pressure and a good multitasker§High level of communication skills and a strong customer service ethic§Familiarity with social networks, professional sites and resume databases§Ability to coach and mentor people leaders§Energy and excitement knowing you will be a key member of the team that will evolve the way Oranga Tamariki recruits talent§About us§At Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children we're on a journey to ensure that all tamariki are in loving whānau and communities. Our vision is that New Zealand values the wellbeing of tamariki above all else. We believe that in the right environment, with the right people surrounding and nurturing them, any child can and should flourish.§How to apply?§Apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal. If you want to have a chat to someone first, you are welcome to reach out to §kate.scott@ot.govt.nz§Applications close Sunday, 18 October 2020.§Position description: §https://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/mvcot/early-in-career-partner-position-description-june-2019.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Our purpose is to bring great people to great organisations across New Zealand.§        § §        §Born through the fifty-year experience of The Adecco Group, Spring Professional supports businesses in the search and selection of professionals. ​The recent years has led our team of over 1500 consultants in 22 countries, to work closely to guide, manage and successfully bring professionals and organizations together.§        § §        §The experts at Spring Professional are close to the market and fully empathise with the needs of our clients. The consultant will then support you for the face to face interviews, and all the process with the client, until the hiring.§ §The successful applicant will display:§ §Willingness to build the foundation of his/her career in the HR / Recruitment industry, with the world's leading provider of temporary staffing, permanent placement, career transition and talent development§Consideration, as much as we do, quality, service excellence and long-term relationships with candidates and clients.§Self-confidence to target and convince talents, and then create an exclusive and rewarding partnership.§Enthusiasm to participate actively in the new team organisation and to the development of a champion's mindset.§ §At Spring Professional, we strive to create an outstanding working environment and career experience for our team.§ §What do we offer?§Second to none L&D opportunities§Flexibility of working hours§'Great Place to Work' certified environment§A global company with ongoing benefits§Opportunity to transform that non-paid voluntary contract to a permanent role inside the Adecco Group, in NZ§ § § §§§§

jobTitle: Union Organiser - Hamilton - 0.8 FTE fixed term Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50666896.txt	§Union Organiser - Hamilton - 0.8 FTE fixed term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Union Organiser - Hamilton - 0.8 FTE fixed term§§Advertiser: §NZ Nurses Organisation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Industrial & Employee Relations§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Union Organiser - Hamilton - 0.8 FTE fixed term §      §        §New Zealand Nurses Organisation (NZNO) is the lead professional nursing organisation and union for nurses. NZNO represents more than 50,000 nurses, midwives, students, kaimahi hauora and health workers of which 3,600 are Māori members in Aotearoa/New Zealand. We represent the interests of nurses on professional and employment related matters. NZNO is a progressive organisation which works to improve the health status of all people of Aotearoa/New Zealand through participation in health and social policy development.§        §NZNO now seeks applications for the role of Organiser (0.8 FTE - 32 hours per week), fixed term to cover the work of a person who has been seconded to do other work until 31 March 2021. Based in our Hamilton office, this role is responsible for providing employment advocacy and industrial support to NZNO members.§        §The successful candidate will:§        §          §have a sound understanding of industrial and employment matters, good negotiation and interpersonal skills and a commitment to and affinity with the trade union movement or community activism.§          §be informed on the significance of Te Tiriti o Waitangi for NZNO and the health of New Zealanders.§          §have well developed communication skills (written and verbal) and have the ability to build rapport and problem solve.§          §understand the importance of building membership, organising NZNO members and developing delegates.§          §ideally have first-hand knowledge of the health sector and/or previous trade union organising experience.§          §have flexibility around the hours of work as some travel will be required.§          §have good IT skills.§          §work well as part of a team.§          §hold a full, clean drivers licence.§        §        §This is an exciting opportunity for a positive, enthusiastic and politically aware person to join a dynamic, high performing team.§        §Applications addressed in confidence to Glenda Alexander, Manager Industrial Services close at 12 midday on Wednesday 14 October 2020 and must include §both§ a cover letter and a current curriculum vitae. Please submit your application by email to the address below. It is provisionally intended that interviews for this position will take place the week 19 - 22 October 2020.§        §You will find a position description at https://tinyurl.com/y9q95y4z.§        § §        §Please send your application to §nina.pennycuick@nzno.org.nz§ (noting that receipt will not be acknowledged until 13th October).§      §      §      §    §    §www.nzno.org.nz§  §§§New Zealand Nurses Organisation (NZNO) is the lead professional nursing organisation and union for nurses. NZNO represents more than 50,000 nurses, midwives, students, kaimahi hauora and health workers of which 3,600 are Māori members in Aotearoa/New Zealand. We represent the interests of nurses on professional and employment related matters. NZNO is a progressive organisation which works to improve the health status of all people of Aotearoa/New Zealand through participation in health and social policy development.§ §NZNO now seeks applications for the role of Organiser (0.8 FTE - 32 hours per week), fixed term to cover the work of a person who has been seconded to do other work until 31 March 2021. Based in our Hamilton office, this role is responsible for providing employment advocacy and industrial support to NZNO members.§ §The successful candidate will:§ § §have a sound understanding of industrial and employment matters, good negotiation and interpersonal skills and a commitment to and affinity with the trade union movement or community activism.§ §be informed on the significance of Te Tiriti o Waitangi for NZNO and the health of New Zealanders.§ §have well developed communication skills (written and verbal) and have the ability to build rapport and problem solve.§ §understand the importance of building membership, organising NZNO members and developing delegates.§ §ideally have first-hand knowledge of the health sector and/or previous trade union organising experience.§ §have flexibility around the hours of work as some travel will be required.§ §have good IT skills.§ §work well as part of a team.§ §hold a full, clean drivers licence.§ §This is an exciting opportunity for a positive, enthusiastic and politically aware person to join a dynamic, high performing team.§ §Applications addressed in confidence to Glenda Alexander, Manager Industrial Services close at 12 midday on Wednesday 14 October 2020 and must include §both§ a cover letter and a current curriculum vitae. Please submit your application by email to the address below. It is provisionally intended that interviews for this position will take place the week 19 - 22 October 2020.§ §You will find a position description at https://tinyurl.com/y9q95y4z.§ § § §Please send your application to §nina.pennycuick@nzno.org.nz§ (noting that receipt will not be acknowledged until 13th October).§§§§

jobText: TXT/50667240.txt	§People & Culture Manager AU/NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & Culture Manager AU/NZ§§Advertiser: §Naumi Hotels§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §People & Culture Manager AU/NZ §      §        §We are bold, enthusiastic and quirky! Each Naumi Hotel aims to represent the highest standard of hospitality that is passionate, enthusiastic and intuitive, and the personality of each of the hotels is brought to life by each of our amazing team members. At Naumi Hotels, your individuality is embraced, and the guest experience is maximised.§        §Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, you will provide effective HR leadership, sound advice and assistance to Managers in the areas of recruitment, performance management, training and development, Employment Relations and Engagement and will be the go to person for our Senior Leaders across New Zealand and Australia.    You must be capable of holding your own around the leadership table, presenting to teams, as well as driving training sessions and feedback sessions from our teams.§        §You will be outgoing, have a passion for human resources and be totally committed to providing excellent customer service to our internal customers.  §        §Your part to play!§        §          §Support  change management with the CEO & COO§          §Support the COO in communication & driving a supportive and engaging environment for all§          §Champion and drive culture and engagement across all locations§          §Support managers to resolve employment relation issues, providing appropriate advice and support on issues as it arises§          §Prepare HR related documentation for the Hotels§          §Coordinate recruitment processes§          §Own the employee rewards and recognition programme§          §Manage the performance management and remuneration review cycle§          §Maintain employee files and ensuring compliance.§          §Manage and drive Health and Safety across New Zealand and Australia, ensuring the Hotel minimizes risk at each location.§          §Develop and lead training as appropriate§          §HR projects as required throughout the year§          §Focus on integrating new systems and ways of working across all teams with the COO to ensure team member engagement is strong and we are efficient as possible§        §        §Our ideal candidate will also have . . .§        §          §Experience in a similar role preferred - ideally within hotels or a related field§          §High integrity and not afraid to challenge and drive feedback§          §Good relationship building skills and a high level of confidentiality§          §Good understanding of Employment Legislation within New Zealand and Australia§          §Well-developed organisational and administrative skills§          §A high level of computer literacy and attention to detail§          §Excellent time management and prioritising skills§          §A flexible and creative approach to problem solving§          §Initiative and drive to see work carried through to a conclusion§          §Ability to work independently and effectively in a fast-moving, multi-tasking and multi-cultural environment§          §A relevant qualification is preferred and you must already be in an HR Manager or higher role to be considered as this is multi site and is a multi-faceted role§        §        §The Perks!§        §          §Competitive salary & parking§          §Complimentary staff meals (when onsite at a hotel)§          §Supportive and encouraging leadership§          §Great growth and development opportunities§          §Discounts at our hotels and partner hotels and businesses across Asia Pacific§          §A genuinely friendly Executive Team, all working hard to grow our wonderful (and still growing) brand§        §        §If this sounds like the role you have been waiting for, we'd love to hear from you – apply now!§        §Please submit your Curriculum Vitae along with a Cover Letter both in PDF format. Attn: Chris McIntosh, Chief Operating Officer. Detail is everything for us so please follow this simple request.§        §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand. §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§We are bold, enthusiastic and quirky! ideally within hotels or a related field§ §High integrity and not afraid to challenge and drive feedback§ §Good relationship building skills and a high level of confidentiality§ §Good understanding of Employment Legislation within New Zealand and Australia§ §Well-developed organisational and administrative skills§ §A high level of computer literacy and attention to detail§ §Excellent time management and prioritising skills§ §A flexible and creative approach to problem solving§ §Initiative and drive to see work carried through to a conclusion§ §Ability to work independently and effectively in a fast-moving, multi-tasking and multi-cultural environment§ §A relevant qualification is preferred and you must already be in an HR Manager or higher role to be considered as this is multi site and is a multi-faceted role§ §The Perks!§ § §Competitive salary & parking§ §Complimentary staff meals (when onsite at a hotel)§ §Supportive and encouraging leadership§ §Great growth and development opportunities§ §Discounts at our hotels and partner hotels and businesses across Asia Pacific§ §A genuinely friendly Executive Team, all working hard to grow our wonderful (and still growing) brand§ §If this sounds like the role you have been waiting for, we'd love to hear from you – apply now!§ §Please submit your Curriculum Vitae along with a Cover Letter both in PDF format. jobText: TXT/50667813.txt	§Senior Recruitment Advisor - Hourly Contracts§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Recruitment Advisor - Hourly Contracts§§Advertiser: §Niche Consulting Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §    §      §Senior Recruitment Advisor - Hourly Contracts §      §        §          §Senior internal recruitment contracts§          §Are you a senior recruiter seeking your next contract opportunity? We have two fantastic hourly rate contract opportunities available now - start ASAP for at least six months.  §          §The role§          §You will be working autonomously as a trusted partner to senior leaders to support the building out of new teams and functions of a large public sector organisation. This will include scoping the requirements of newly created positions; sizing and developing position descriptions using in-house tools; and running end-to-end recruitment campaigns for large numbers of specialist and professional roles.§          §About you§          §You will need to be a seasoned recruiter who has the ability to gain the trust and confidence of senior stakeholders through the provision of sound and insightful advice and the successful delivery of recruitment services.§          §Your background may include public or private sector experience, in-house or agency; you will be an expert on talent sourcing strategies beyond beyond the traditional; and will have an in-depth understanding of professional recruitment and selection practices and disciplines. You will also be adept at managing recruitment systems and reporting. §          §The culture is highly collaborative, fast-paced and rapidly evolving. So you will need to be able to thrive in this kind of fast moving environment. §        §        §          §For more information contact Jane Temel on 021 499 902 or APPLY NOW!§          §Established in 1994, Niche has been a premier provider of specialist talent to the New Zealand market for over twenty-five years in the legal, policy, human resources and communications career verticals, from entry level to executive positions.§        §      §      §Jane Temel§021 499 902§jane.temel@nicherecruitment.co.nz§ §    §  §§§§Senior internal recruitment contracts§Are you a senior recruiter seeking your next contract opportunity? We have two fantastic hourly rate contract opportunities available now - start ASAP for at least six months.  §The role§You will be working autonomously as a trusted partner to senior leaders to support the building out of new teams and functions of a large public sector organisation. This will include scoping the requirements of newly created positions; sizing and developing position descriptions using in-house tools; and running end-to-end recruitment campaigns for large numbers of specialist and professional roles.§About you§You will need to be a seasoned recruiter who has the ability to gain the trust and confidence of senior stakeholders through the provision of sound and insightful advice and the successful delivery of recruitment services.§Your background may include public or private sector experience, in-house or agency; you will be an expert on talent sourcing strategies beyond beyond the traditional; and will have an in-depth understanding of professional recruitment and selection practices and disciplines. You will also be adept at managing recruitment systems and reporting. §The culture is highly collaborative, fast-paced and rapidly evolving. So you will need to be able to thrive in this kind of fast moving environment. §§For more information contact Jane Temel on 021 499 902 or APPLY NOW!§§Established in 1994, Niche has been a premier provider of specialist talent to the New Zealand market for over twenty-five years in the legal, policy, human resources and communications career verticals, from entry level to executive positions.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50668636.txt	§HR and Training Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR and Training Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Beaurepaires§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§The opportunity § §Looking for a career choice and not just a job? Beaurepaires is a tyre retailer with 55 stores Nationwide and a Head Office located in Hamilton. We have a rare opportunity for someone to join our human resources department in a fun and supportive environment.§ §The role§ §This is a mid-level role that works closely with the Human Resource Manager to fundamentally support the business to optimise their people capability and overall performance.§ §You’ll be involved in a diverse range of human resource administration and coordination duties, while also supporting the generation of training material and maintaining LMS systems.§ §Day to day activities include:§ § §End to end recruitment for Head Office and supporting recruitment of 55 nationwide stores;§ §Preparation of variations and employment agreements;§ §Coordination of onboarding and induction processes;§ §Supporting the VISA application process;§ §Creating training material, maintaining the LMS system, and track progress completion by generating reports;§ §Review policies and procedures in line with current legislation and work with the HR Manager to update;§ §Assist with employment relations meetings when required;§ §Organise regular Store Manager training sessions and assist with the organisation of the annual conference;§ §Organise staff functions and monthly incentives;§ §Managing employee data and general HR administration;§ §Assisting with ad-hoc queries from employees and managers.§ §What we’re looking for§ §To be successful in this position, you will be able to demonstrate high attention to detail and accuracy. This is a deadline driven environment, so time management and ability to multitask is essential. As standard within the Human Resources industry, you must be able to uphold confidentiality and manage sensitive information.§ §The ideal candidate will have a tertiary degree in Human Resources, and a minimum of 1 years’ experience within an HR environment.§ §If working with people is a passion of yours – we’d love to hear from you – apply today!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

§Ensuring production and equipment housekeeping is maintained to standards set§          §          §            §Ensuring hazards are identified within the operational areas of the business and        §            §Tertiary qualification in Science (Microbiology, Chemistry), Engineering (Mechanical, Chemical, Pharmaceutical) &/or Diploma in Health, Safety, Environmental or related
