§Our Manufacturing & Supply Division is committed to be the most trusted supplier of bio-pharmaceuticals worldwide. Our facilities, along with our external contractors, suppliers, and partners, create an interdependent global manufacturing network that’s committed to delivering a high quality, reliable supply to customers and patients on time, every time.§        § §        §Who we are…§        § §        §Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA is known as “Merck” in the United States, Canada & Puerto Rico. We are known as “MSD” in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Latin America & Asia Pacific. We are a global biopharmaceutical leader with a diverse portfolio of prescription medicines, oncology, vaccines and animal health products.§        § §        §We are driven by our purpose to develop and deliver innovative products that save and improve lives. jobText: TXT/50670091.txt	§People & CultureOps Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & CultureOps Lead§§Advertiser: §Roam§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §People & CultureOps Lead §      §About Roam§Roam builds exceptional digital businesses and products for clients around the globe. Started in 2013 we now have studios in Auckland and Sydney with more on the way. We craft experiences for companies like Google, EBay, Giant, ASB, Spark, Westpac, The Warehouse Group, Mercury and many more, including startups in Silicon Valley and the UK. § The core mission of our People & CultureOps Lead is to build the support functions needed to enable Roam to scale successfully. From recruiting and onboarding, to ongoing training, culture-building, and human resources. This role will partner closely with the VP of Operations and Roam leadership team to develop and implement our Culture Ops strategy initiatives. §   §   § §Your core responsibilities will include:§        §          §            §Establish a trusted People & CultureOps function that serves as an advisor and partner to leaders throughout the organisation, and build a team that can support our rapid growth with the expertise and empathy needed throughout hyper-growth. §            §Make our vision around what it means to work at Roam happen across all our employee touch-points and rally the team around that vision.§            §Build and implement programs across recruiting, onboarding, ongoing training, feedback and culture-building to reinforce our values and vision at Roam.§            §Collect business and people data through user research, design thinking and customer experience methods to inform initiatives and decisions. §            §Manage human resources needs across the organisation, including payroll and benefits, in partnership with Finance and Operations team.§            §Managing the People & Culture Ops team§          §        §   § §Skills and experience§        §          §            §8+ years of experience in People or Customer Experience Leadership roles §            §Consulting, design thinking, software development and/or CX experience is a plus§            §Experience working in an entrepreneurial and fast-paced environment, with the ability to lead and adapt in a changing business environment§            §Experience recruiting and managing people, including diverse teams (different locations, employees/contractors/agencies/ levels of experience, etc.)§            §Exceptional communication & collaboration skills, particularly with people who have different skill sets and are from different areas of the business§          §        §   § §Who you are§        §          §            §You live and breathe the qualities of an Exceptional Roamer - you’re curious, passionate, honest, humble, empathetic and pursue excellence everyday§            §You’re pragmatic, logical, measured and can solve any problem that gets thrown at you in a way that gets others excited to help§            §You are a strong, positive, optimistic leader with a resilient attitude, and have experience making things happen in fast growing companies§            §Continuous optimiser - you’re always looking for ways to make things better, faster, more efficient§            §Flexible and excited to work on whatever will drive the most impactful and immediate results against what the company currently needs§            §Get sh*t done attitude, tenacious and willing to do whatever it takes to deliver better experiences§            §Relentless focus on results§            §Willing to tackle the big and the small§            §You understand the importance of design and technology on improving peoples’ lives§          §        §   § §Why work with us?§        §          §            §Awesome location in a beautiful workspace 2 minutes from Britomart, Downtown Auckland§            §Birthday Leave, monthly company BBQs, an active social club, bustling lunch room & more§            §Working with genuinely awesome, ambitious and humble people. A combo that is hard to find and we have over 100 of them!§          §        §      §      §      §    §  §§§About Roam§Roam builds exceptional digital businesses and products for clients around the globe. Started in 2013 we now have studios in Auckland and Sydney with more on the way. We craft experiences for companies like Google, EBay, Giant, ASB, Spark, Westpac, The Warehouse Group, Mercury and many more, including startups in Silicon Valley and the UK. § The core mission of our People & CultureOps Lead is to build the support functions needed to enable Roam to scale successfully. From recruiting and onboarding, to ongoing training, culture-building, and human resources. This role will partner closely with the VP of Operations and Roam leadership team to develop and implement our Culture Ops strategy initiatives. §   §   § §Your core responsibilities will include:§ § § §Establish a trusted People & CultureOps function that serves as an advisor and partner to leaders throughout the organisation, and build a team that can support our rapid growth with the expertise and empathy needed throughout hyper-growth. § §Make our vision around what it means to work at Roam happen across all our employee touch-points and rally the team around that vision.§ §Build and implement programs across recruiting, onboarding, ongoing training, feedback and culture-building to reinforce our values and vision at Roam.§ §Collect business and people data through user research, design thinking and customer experience methods to inform initiatives and decisions. § §Manage human resources needs across the organisation, including payroll and benefits, in partnership with Finance and Operations team.§ §Managing the People & Culture Ops team§ § §   § §Skills and experience§ § § §8+ years of experience in People or Customer Experience Leadership roles § §Consulting, design thinking, software development and/or CX experience is a plus§ §Experience working in an entrepreneurial and fast-paced environment, with the ability to lead and adapt in a changing business environment§ §Experience recruiting and managing people, including diverse teams (different locations, employees/contractors/agencies/ levels of experience, etc.)§ §Exceptional communication & collaboration skills, particularly with people who have different skill sets and are from different areas of the business§ § §   § §Who you are§ § § §You live and breathe the qualities of an Exceptional Roamer - you’re curious, passionate, honest, humble, empathetic and pursue excellence everyday§ §You’re pragmatic, logical, measured and can solve any problem that gets thrown at you in a way that gets others excited to help§ §You are a strong, positive, optimistic leader with a resilient attitude, and have experience making things happen in fast growing companies§ §Continuous optimiser - you’re always looking for ways to make things better, faster, more efficient§ §Flexible and excited to work on whatever will drive the most impactful and immediate results against what the company currently needs§ §Get sh*t done attitude, tenacious and willing to do whatever it takes to deliver better experiences§ §Relentless focus on results§ §Willing to tackle the big and the small§ §You understand the importance of design and technology on improving peoples’ lives§ § §   § §Why work with us?§ § § §Awesome location in a beautiful workspace 2 minutes from Britomart, Downtown Auckland§ §Birthday Leave, monthly company BBQs, an active social club, bustling lunch room & more§ §Working with genuinely awesome, ambitious and humble people. A combo that is hard to find and we have over 100 of them!§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Health and Safety Advisor - Central Region Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670587.txt	§Health and Safety Advisor - Central Region§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Advisor - Central Region§§Advertiser: §Department of Corrections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Hands-on H&S partnership and advisory role supporting our people §Fixed term opportunity to 25th June 2021 covering our Central Region§Flexibility to be based in Hamilton, Rotorua or any other Central regional office§Salary starting from $77,346 up to $109,194 based on skills/experience§§'Kotahi anō te kaupapa, ko te oranga o te iwi'  -  ‘There is only one purpose to our work:  the wellness and wellbeing of our people.§§Led from our Chief Executive, we're embedding a culture of continuous improvement and capability across our unique operating environment at Ara Poutama Aotearoa.  Nowhere else is quite the same - we have over 10,000 people at 100's of sites across Aotearoa with over 80% who work directly with the people in our care.  We also deliver instructional and rehabilitation programmes in high-risk industries, such as construction, engineering, construction, and agriculture - it's a diverse, interesting and complex portfolio to manage safety across.§Mō te tūnga | About the role§We have a fixed term opportunity for a Health and Safety professional to join our recently expanded Safety & Wellbeing Function and provide proactive health and safety advice and support to sites, leaders and teams across our Central Region.  Your key focus in this role is to support these teams to improve their health and safety performance and ensure that health and safety become core considerations throughout their business-as-usual ways of working.  This involves supporting sites, teams and projects to effectively apply a range of health and safety policies, procedures and protocols, supporting and guiding the completion of H&S Learning Reviews/investigations, undertaking critical risk and system assurance checks across teams and projects, and providing technically accurate and constructive advice to improve the H&S performance of business areas.§There is an expectation that the role holder can commit to regular regional travel, therefore a full driver's licence is essential.§Ngā pūkenga e kimi ana mātou | Skills we look for§To be successful, we are looking for evidence of the following key skills and experience within your written application:§§Experience in a similar role providing health and safety advice and guidance, ideally across large and complex organisations;§Demonstrated understanding of health and safety legislation;§Proven knowledge and understanding of incident investigation techniques;§Experience in delivering activities that improve awareness, knowledge and application of health and safety policies, procedures and protocols;§Excellent collaboration skills with an ability to develop strong relationships to drive culture change with key stakeholders;§Good technical experience, ideally with a background in a high-risk industry;§Knowledge of applied best practice in health and safety business partnering, including health and safety assurance and Learning Review/investigation activities; and§A full (clean) drivers licence§§Tono ināianei | Apply now§To apply online, submit your §CV and a tailored cover letter§ §(PDF)§ describing your motivation for wanting to join our whanau at Ara Poutama Aotearoa and outline your relevant skills, experience and personal qualities essential to this role. §Applications will close 9pm on Thursday 15 October.  Shortlisted candidates may be invited to take part in a pre-interview online competency assessment and video screening.§The salary range for this role is $77,346 up to $109,194 based demonstrable skills, experience and expertise relevant to the role.§§§§

We exist to support our medical industry by placing doctors into hospitals and clinics. The demands on the medical industry have never been higher, and we anticipate them to get even busier so we need you now.§ §For over 14 years we’ve been at the forefront of doctor placement in hospitals and clinics. We pride ourselves on our superior service to both our doctors and hospitals and we’re committed to excellence.§ §About the role:§ §To begin you’ll have a full induction with your highly experienced Country Manager. You’ll learn everything there is to know about the medical recruitment industry and our world class solutions focused approach.§ §You will be given a portfolio of doctors and hospitals and before you know it you will be up and running.§ §You will be provided with the tools of the job, a fantastic office environment, and a brilliant culture.§ §Your feedback and ideas will be taken on board and we’re always committed to improving, so we’re looking for someone who thinks the same…That the status quo is something to be challenged.§ §This role is based in our beautiful Queenstown office and your package will include a base salary and an uncapped commission structure.§ §Who we’re looking for:§ §To make the most of this opportunity you need, as a minimum, sales experience in a services environment. Ideally you will have worked with Doctors in the past, in a Business Development, Sales or Recruitment scenario.§ §On top of this we want to know that you are a self-starter; who knows that your success is in your own hands. Every day you strive for better. You are solutions focused and know that there is always a way.§ §Do you have recruitment experience? Are you driven by business development? Perhaps you’ve been a recruiter for a couple of years, or have experience in selling services? Are you ready to step into one of the world’s busiest industries? § §What to do next:§ §To apply, please follow the two steps below:§ § §Copy the below link into your web browser and then submit your CV and Cover Letter.§ §https://medworld.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=39§ § §In addition, please also follow these instructions: §We have a short questionnaire that we would like you to complete as part of your application. Please copy the below link into your web browser to complete the questionnaire.§ §https://survey.harrisonassessments.com/bdzs-uvy7-u2nf§ §Please note that we will only accept applications that are received via the above channel (and not via Seek) and that we will not consider applicants who do not complete the questionnaire. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a recruitment consultant?§How many years' experience do you have in a client services / account management role?§§§

jobTitle: HR Advisor - Auckland Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50675800.txt	§HR Advisor - Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Advisor - Auckland§§Advertiser: §rhipe§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§The role:§Reporting to the Group Executive, HR in Melbourne, the HR Advisor will have a passion for people and workplace culture and will work closely with the NZ business to provide generalist HR support and lead post-acquisition people integration.§The autonomous role has a broad remit encompassing policy, employment legislation and compliance, recruitment and onboarding, employee relations and management development, training delivery as well as the roll out of cross-Company programs.§The team:§The Global HR Team looks after people matters from recruitment and on-boarding to performance management and learning and development.  They are responsible for ensuring we have relevant HR infrastructure and frameworks in place, along with people strategies, policies and initiatives to enable a safe, happy and productive workforce.§Key responsibilities include:§Provide general HR support to the NZ office including employment legislation, employee relations and performance management advice§Lead post-acquisition integration from a people perspective including employment documentation, Group policies, processes and systems and cultural synergies§End to end recruitment involving advertising, screening for cultural fit and ideal team players, interview support, reference checking, offer and employment contracts§Deliver best practice on-boarding and inductions (F2F and Virtual Teams) for new staff to ensure an excellent employee experience§Support payroll additions, exits and accuracy each month and any Kiwis-Saver administration§Help drive Development plans and Performance Management and support employees in HRM system§Drive cross-company cultural programs including teamwork development, rhipe Values§Contribute to HR team to build in-house soft skills training and deliver training §Keep accurate records of training delivered, training plans, attendance and feedback§Ensure adherence to workplace relations requirements, labour law and OH&S§Experience, education and skills§:§To be successful in this role the incumbent will have the following attributes and experience:§Self-starter, able to work autonomously with strong mindset for continuous improvement§The ability to listen and interpret our clients' needs, engage with people, create, develop and maintain long-term partnerships§A track record in dealing with a variety of situations and the ability to be organised and solutions focused.  §High levels of clarity, accuracy and confidence in communication§Excellent organisational and time management skills§Experience in a similar HR generalist role§Managing HR systems and payroll, HRMS and/or LMS§Well-practised in on-boarding and presentation techniques and delivery§Good understanding of NZ employment legislation and ER capability§Highly desirable - experience in acquisitions and people integrations, payroll§To be eligible for this opportunity, candidates must hold valid working rights.§Why rhipe§?§Rhipe is a market leader for cloud and service provider software licensing in the APAC region.  We help businesses build, transform and accelerate their journey to the Cloud and our employees are at the heart of what we do.§We support equal opportunity and aim to provide a dynamic, inclusive and friendly work environment. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. With our flexible and diverse culture, we encourage candidates who may be seeking a flexible working arrangement or require reasonable work adjustments, to apply.§Our benefits§We offer an attractive remuneration package along with ongoing career opportunities, technological and professional development and support. We have a culture that empowers our people, promotes teamwork, flexibility and work-life balance.  §Some of our perks include an Employee Assistance Program, paid parental leave, employee 'Me day', Cultural Leave Day swap, CSR initiatives, regular social events.....plus, the added advantage of working with top-notch technology and colleagues that are passionate about what they do.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What is your expected annual salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many weeks' notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Recruitment Consultant | Immediate start | Part-time/home based Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50679899.txt	§Recruitment Consultant | Immediate start | Part-time/home based§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Consultant | Immediate start | Part-time/home based§§Advertiser: §The Recruitment Alternative§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Agency§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Recruitment Consultant | Immediate start | Part-time/home based §        §          §            §              §                §                  §Enjoy a career with genuine family, work & life balance§                  §Part-time opportunity working from home§                  §Professional training & career progression opportunities§                  §Fabulous commission structure for the driven recruiter!§                § §About The Recruitment Alternative§The Recruitment Alternative is one of Australia and New Zealand's leading, permanent recruitment agencies. Established for over 11 years, we are proud of the exceptionally high standard recruitment service that we provide our clients, at very competitive rates. We are an award-winning agency and our staff enjoy the rewards of a truly, modern and innovative business structure. §We are currently expanding our business and looking for sharp, passionate, Recruitment Consultants to join our successful team. As a growing business, we are looking for consultants who can work independently from a home-based office, who are seeking work life balance but at the same time want to earn a high income via the application of steady hard work.  We provide thorough training, ongoing support and provide our consultants with all the tools necessary for success.§About the role§This is a unique, part time opportunity for an experienced and professional §Recruitment Consultant§. Working on permanent recruitment, across a warm desk of clients, you’ll be based entirely from home. This opportunity requires entrepreneurial recruiters, who thrive on working autonomously, and who are happy to self-manage their own workload. You will have a genuine passion for sourcing the best talent, and a demonstrated ability to achieve stand-out results. With a solid background in agency or internal recruitment, you will enjoy working on a broad range of placements. §  §Our flexible business model provides our consultants with genuine alternatives in how they work. You can focus all your energies on conducting recruitment campaigns for clients that are given to you or you can select an alternative option wherein your primary function will mainly be reverse marketing pre-screened candidates.  Which model you choose will determine your earnings.§ § §Key responsibilities will include:§                §                  §Providing high quality professional, recruitment services to suit each client’s specific requirements§                  §Management of client relationships§                  §Compiling detailed job briefs§                  §Creating targeted, advertising and launching the ad across various online platforms§                  §Performing candidate screening and interviews§                  §Compiling and sending / following up on application submissions§                  §General administration and invoicing tasks§                § §To be successful for this role you must have the following:§                §                  §An ability to work in a flexible capacity mostly anytime business hours Monday to Friday§                  §A solid history of work in internal or agency recruitment§                  §Genuine dedication to providing clients with high quality placements§                  §Excellent capacity to build great professional relationships§                  §Adaptability, flexibility and the ability to manage multiple and competing deadlines§                  §High level communication skills, both written and verbal§                  §Experience in the use of computer systems and web-based technologies§                  §Capacity to maintain yourself, working part-time, on a commission basis§                  §A home office, computer and reliable internet connection§                  §A commitment to best practice and continuous improvement§                § §This is an excellent opportunity for work, family and life balance, together with a competitive commission structure. This opportunity requires entrepreneurial recruiters, who thrive on working autonomously, and who are happy to self-manage their own workload. Servicing over 400 clients across the country, we are one of the top 50 fastest growing companies in New Zealand. §  §At CMOS we have a clear goal - we want a better experience for our customers and a better working environment for our cleaners and support staff.§To help us reach this goal, CMOS is looking for a creative and innovative Recruitment Specialist to join the team. §  §The role is permanent part-time with 20 hours a week from Monday to Friday. We would prefer someone who could work 4 hours a day. Start time is slightly flexible, anytime before 10:00am would suit (Our office opens at 8:00am).§  §Perks of the job:§ § §Great hard working team with a sense of humour§ §Modern newly renovated central offices§ §Mac computer and iPhone§ §Constant improvements of systems and processes§ §An awesome work culture with everyone working towards the same goals§ §Reporting to the HR Advisor and working closely with operations, you will be responsible for delivering effective staff recruitment practices which you will develop together with the HR Advisor. Your natural ability to communicate effectively with people from all kinds of cultures and backgrounds will allow you to deliver a positive candidate experience and employee satisfaction and retention in the commercial cleaning industry. §  §This role includes valuable exposure to fast-paced volume recruitment up to executive-level roles which will need to be recruited in a wide variety of ways such as headhunting, job listings, relationship building, and other creative ways. §Role responsibilities:§ § §Recruitment and selection of all new employees§ §Onboarding of new employees & conducting H&S training§ §Assist the HR Advisor in delivering and innovating creative attraction strategies§ §Recruitment administration§ §About you:§ § §You are a creative problem solver and an innovative self-starter.§ §You are tech-savvy and pick up new systems easily.§ §You have great time management and organisation skills.§ §You are an exceptional communicator both written and verbally.§ §You focus on the big picture and have an understanding of the follow-on effect of your actions.§ §You are positive, confident and solution-focused with a desire to work with a like-minded team.§ §You have experience in innovative recruitment and networking.§ §Favourable:§ § §Volume recruitment or entry-level role recruitment experience§ §Experience dealing with a workforce who work at night§ §A role like this one doesn’t come around often so apply now to be considered.§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of recruitment experience do you have?§§§

jobText: TXT/50680943.txt	§Organisation Development Consultant (Full Time, Fixed Term), Organisational...§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Organisation Development Consultant (Full Time, Fixed Term), Organisational...§§Advertiser: §Counties Manukau District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Organisational Development§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Organisation Development Consultant (Full Time, Fixed Term), Organisational... §    §      §Full Time§Fixed Term until April 2021§        §People matter at Counties Manukau Health and we need someone who wants to be part of an Organisation Development team helping to drive better patient outcomes through better people practices, and better management and leadership. We currently have a full-time, fixed term role from now until around April 2021.§        §About us:§Counties Manukau Health is the largest employer in South Auckland employing over 8,000 staff spread across 23 different sites, working within a complex environment providing the best care for the community we serve.  Our vision is to work in partnership with our communities to improve the health status of all, with particular emphasis on Maaori and Pacific peoples and other communities with health disparities.  §        §About you:§This OD role presents an opportunity to partner with OD and HR colleagues to influence management and leadership capability, and to contribute to a positive, people centred culture. As an OD practitioner, you will bring expertise in OD disciplines, including organisational assessment, facilitation, training delivery, and content improvement.  You will need to act as the lead person on OD related projects.§        §We have recently initiated a range of bite-sized sessions (1-2 hours long) relating to team effectiveness and to management skills. All our OD team members therefore need to be comfortable “on our feet” facilitating team effectiveness workshops and delivering some management skills training.  §        §You are a confident communicator who can engage effectively with senior leaders, staff, unions, and colleagues. You will have the confidence to have bold conversations and build strong relationships especially with HR Business Partner colleagues. You will thrive on making things better, understanding the root cause of an issue and solving immediate problems. It’s important to us that you understand and relate to our values.§        §What we can offer you:§        §          §A fast paced environment where ‘doing it’ is more important than talking about it§          §An OD team where the focus has changed in recent months, and where we are trying new things§          §5 weeks annual leave (pro rata)§        §This role is based at Middlemore Hospital and the train stops outside our front door!§If this role sounds like you, apply at §www.countieshealthjobs.com§ or §click here§ for the job description.§        §For more information please contact Amy Lin in the Recruitment Centre §09 276 0044§ ext 58680 or email §amy.lin@middlemore.co.nz§        §Position Number: CMH§20203537§Closing Date: 12 October 2020§§ At Counties Manukau Health people and their lives matter to us. We are a values based and inclusive organisation that is committed to delivering the best health outcomes for our community. To help us achieve this we need a workforce that reflects the population we serve. We strongly encourage applications from all backgrounds who share our values and have a passion to work in our community and would greatly value seeing applicants from our Maaori and Pacific communities. We are also committed to our Disability Strategy, which focuses on people with disabilities; they are our patients, whaanau, community and our staff - all carefully considered in our action plan. Together we will improve the accessibility needs for everyone who has a disability. Our values are Valuing Everyone- Whakawhanaungatanga , Kind –Manaakitanga, Together –Kotahitanga, Excellent- Rangatiratanga. If these are your values too, then join us today.§ §        § § § §        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Full Time§Fixed Term until April 2021§People matter at Counties Manukau Health and we need someone who wants to be part of an Organisation Development team helping to drive better patient outcomes through better people practices, and better management and leadership. We currently have a full-time, fixed term role from now until around April 2021.§About us:§Counties Manukau Health is the largest employer in South Auckland employing over 8,000 staff spread across 23 different sites, working within a complex environment providing the best care for the community we serve.  Our vision is to work in partnership with our communities to improve the health status of all, with particular emphasis on Maaori and Pacific peoples and other communities with health disparities.  §About you:§This OD role presents an opportunity to partner with OD and HR colleagues to influence management and leadership capability, and to contribute to a positive, people centred culture. As an OD practitioner, you will bring expertise in OD disciplines, including organisational assessment, facilitation, training delivery, and content improvement.  You will need to act as the lead person on OD related projects.§We have recently initiated a range of bite-sized sessions (1-2 hours long) relating to team effectiveness and to management skills. All our OD team members therefore need to be comfortable “on our feet” facilitating team effectiveness workshops and delivering some management skills training.  §You are a confident communicator who can engage effectively with senior leaders, staff, unions, and colleagues. You will have the confidence to have bold conversations and build strong relationships especially with HR Business Partner colleagues. You will thrive on making things better, understanding the root cause of an issue and solving immediate problems. It’s important to us that you understand and relate to our values.§What we can offer you:§A fast paced environment where ‘doing it’ is more important than talking about it§An OD team where the focus has changed in recent months, and where we are trying new things§5 weeks annual leave (pro rata)§This role is based at Middlemore Hospital and the train stops outside our front door!§If this role sounds like you, apply at §www.countieshealthjobs.com§ or §click here§ for the job description.§For more information please contact Amy Lin in the Recruitment Centre §09 276 0044§ ext 58680 or email §amy.lin@middlemore.co.nz§§Position Number: CMH§20203537§Closing Date: 12 October 2020§§ At Counties Manukau Health people and their lives matter to us. We are a values based and inclusive organisation that is committed to delivering the best health outcomes for our community. To help us achieve this we need a workforce that reflects the population we serve. We strongly encourage applications from all backgrounds who share our values and have a passion to work in our community and would greatly value seeing applicants from our Maaori and Pacific communities. We are also committed to our Disability Strategy, which focuses on people with disabilities; they are our patients, whaanau, community and our staff - all carefully considered in our action plan. Together we will improve the accessibility needs for everyone who has a disability. Our values are Valuing Everyone- Whakawhanaungatanga , Kind –Manaakitanga, Together –Kotahitanga, Excellent- Rangatiratanga. If these are your values too, then join us today.§ § § § §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50681483.txt	§Lead People Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead People Partner§§Advertiser: §Kiwibank§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Lead People Partner §      §        §          §Auckland or Wellington based opportunity with Kiwibank§          §7-month Fixed Term Contract§          §Join our fun, diverse and dynamic People team§        §        §Kiwibank is the New Zealand owned bank that's helping make kiwis better off. Never has this been more important. If you're going to join a bank, make it the local bank that cares about Kiwis. Kiwibank started out by challenging the Aussie banks, and now we're big enough to make a difference.§        §We have a fantastic opportunity for a Lead People Partner (aka HR Business Partner*) to join our busy People team on a 7-month fixed term contract. The HR Business Partner is a key strategic advisor to Enterprise Leaders and their management teams at Kiwibank. You will be partnering with them to provide strategic and commercially savvy thought leadership, advice and guidance across all aspects of human resources to solve business problems and enable success.§        §In order to be successful in this role, you will:§        §          §Have extensive strategic business partnering experience in human resources, with a track record of developing highly effective relationships with senior leaders and executives in a range of organisations and industries§          §Have demonstrable experience in successful people change execution and organisational design§          §Have proven experience in the development and implementation of people strategies and policies, including talent and capability management§          §Have deep experience in employment relations and a strong working knowledge of both employment legislation and case law, coupled with a demonstrable track record in mediating or negotiating successful outcomes to complex employment issues§          §Have sound knowledge across a broad range of people disciplines, including organisational development, learning, employment relations, remuneration, recruitment, talent management and succession§          §Have broad understanding of people-related data and the ability to identify and understand trends and communicate these with business stakeholders§          §Have strong influencing and communication skills and experience with the ability to communicate and influence using a range of methods and across different audiences§          §Have proven experience in influencing at a senior or executive level§          §Have proven relationship management skills with the ability to quickly build trust and maintain strong positive relationships with internal and external contacts§          §Have a tertiary qualification, preferably in HR or similar discipline.§        §        §This is a great opportunity to join a team who are supporting a huge amount of exciting change across the business. We're looking for someone who can share their experience, and who enjoys a challenge. If you want to combine hard work with a sense of fun, then apply for this role today!§        §At Kiwibank we're all about making Kiwis better off. That means for our customers, our communities, and our own people. We are continuously striving for an inclusive culture where everyone has the opportunity to thrive. We are committed to providing a workplace that is safe, accessible, and representative of our customers and communities. As part of our commitment to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace, we're happy to consider flexible working arrangements.§        §Applications close §Monday 19th October 2020 at 9 pm§, so §APPLY NOW§, although we reserve the right to remove the ad at any time.§        §We want you to have what you need to do the best job possible. We will provide reasonable accommodations to make sure regardless of accessibility needs, disability or individual situation people can participate in the job application/interview process and during their employment with Kiwibank. We're looking for someone who can share their experience, and who enjoys a challenge. If you want to combine hard work with a sense of fun, then apply for this role today!§At Kiwibank we're all about making Kiwis better off. That means for our customers, our communities, and our own people. We are continuously striving for an inclusive culture where everyone has the opportunity to thrive. We are committed to providing a workplace that is safe, accessible, and representative of our customers and communities. As part of our commitment to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace, we're happy to consider flexible working arrangements.§Applications close §Monday 19th October 2020 at 9 pm§, so §APPLY NOW§, although we reserve the right to remove the ad at any time.§We want you to have what you need to do the best job possible. jobTitle: Business Partner  People & Culture Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681781.txt	§Business Partner  People & Culture§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Partner  People & Culture§§Advertiser: §Regional Facilities Auckland (RFA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Business Partner People & Culture §      §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§With the exciting merger between RFA and ATEED, our passionate and creative teams are coming together! We are striving to create rewarding visitor experiences and positive outcomes for all Aucklanders. §To help us with our transformation and journey, we have an exciting opportunity for an exceptional Business Partner, People & Culture to join our team. §In this critical role, you will partner with senior leaders across the business to provide a generalist HR. You will be responsible for identifying and developing HR strategies with leaders, ensuring the needs of the BU and wider teams are considered throughout. You will cover end to end HR requirements and oversee the effectiveness of the HR operation whilst working closely with functions across the Council family.§        §He kōrero mōu: About you § §        §You will have significant HR experience working in a complex organisation with an ability to get things done.  You will bring proven experience with leadership teams on all levels as a trusted advisor and subject matter expert. § §        §Tertiary qualified, you will have demonstrated experience in a number of different areas in HR such as engagement strategy and execution; talent management, change, ER, and performance management; and experience negotiating with unions. Naturally, you will have political and business acumen and a collaborative working style.§You will bring exceptional relationship management skills, and familiarity working with and influencing a diverse range of stakeholders.  You will help lead and shape our culture by developing and delivering strategic people initiatives and programmes, and role-modeling the RFA values. You will motivate and inspire optimism in others in a way that inspires people. § §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§ §        §Our diverse, creative team of people work together to create unique experiences for people living in and visiting our city. §You will be part of a team making a valuable contribution to our city and to every occasion. Our passion for what we do breathes life into our vision to enrich and enhance life in Auckland.If you feel you can contribute to this outcome through your experience, excitement, and ingenuity please take up our invitation to apply. Come join us and have the satisfaction of knowing you’re contributing to Auckland’s economic growth.§ §        §For a confidential discussion or detailed PD, please contact Jess Rohr, Talent Acquisition Consultant §jess.rohr@aucklandcouncil.govt.nz§.  §        § §        §Applications close 11th October 2020§        §Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§He angitūtanga: The opportunity§With the exciting merger between RFA and ATEED, our passionate and creative teams are coming together! jobText: TXT/50681802.txt	§Talent Acquisition Business Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Talent Acquisition Business Partner§§Advertiser: §Vodafone New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Talent Acquisition Business Partner §      §        §§        §Tihei mauri ora! Tēnā koutou katoa.§        §“Behold, there is life! Acknowledgement to all.”§        § §        §At Vodafone, we’re committed to providing you with a friendly workplace environment where you can manage home and work balance through our leading flexible working practises. We value the diversity of thought, perspective and backgrounds our people bring to work with them every day. We support our communities through the Vodafone New Zealand Foundation with an ambitious goal to halve the number of disadvantaged young people in Aotearoa by 2027.§        § §        §Reporting to the Talent Manager, the Talent Acquisition Business Partner will be responsible for end-to-end proactive recruitment across the Vodafone NZ business.  This is a fast paced industry, where we are looking for experienced in-house recruitment consultants who are interested in bringing their innovative and continuous improvement approach, excellent relationship building and exemplary customer experience focus to a new industry.§        § §        §We are a small, tight team that will be looking to continue to build Vodafone’s talent capability and service offering since our new ownership last year, delivering best practice and ensuring we have fun along the way. §        § §        §What Will I Be Doing?§        § §        §Business partnering with key stakeholders to deliver within a large corporate environment. Agency environment will be considered if individual has corporate experience also.§          §Either generalist experience or a technology background§          §Strong relationship management – ability to influence and have a ‘voice at the table’§          §Strong delivery focus, ability to juggle many things at once and work both autonomously and collaboratively§          §Innovative, future thinking approach as it relates to talent/ recruitment – i.e. gamification, tools and efficiencies, products§          §It goes without saying that you opportunities you’ve been seeking to expand your career. There is no better time to join Vodafone NZ and be an integral part of our digital transformation and Remarkable Simplicity strategy. §        § §        §Me mahi tahi tātou mo te oranga o te katoa. §        §“We work together for the benefit of all”§      §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Tihei mauri ora! Tēnā koutou katoa.§ §“Behold, there is life! Acknowledgement to all.”§ § § §At Vodafone, we’re committed to providing you with a friendly workplace environment where you can manage home and work balance through our leading flexible working practises. We value the diversity of thought, perspective and backgrounds our people bring to work with them every day. We support our communities through the Vodafone New Zealand Foundation with an ambitious goal to halve the number of disadvantaged young people in Aotearoa by 2027.§ § § §Reporting to the Talent Manager, the Talent Acquisition Business Partner will be responsible for end-to-end proactive recruitment across the Vodafone NZ business.  This is a fast paced industry, where we are looking for experienced in-house recruitment consultants who are interested in bringing their innovative and continuous improvement approach, excellent relationship building and exemplary customer experience focus to a new industry.§ § § §We are a small, tight team that will be looking to continue to build Vodafone’s talent capability and service offering since our new ownership last year, delivering best jobTitle: Safety & Sustainability Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50682054.txt	§Safety & Sustainability Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Safety & Sustainability Coordinator§§Advertiser: §GSF Fresh New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Safety & Sustainability Coordinator – GSF New Zealand                § §The Company§ §Established for over 70 years, Golden State Foods (GSF) is a global player in the food processing and distribution industries with customers in more than 40 countries on five continents. GSF Fresh New Zealand has become a leader in manufacturing and distribution of fresh-cut produce and salads to the retail and foodservice industry in New Zealand.  Groenz a wholly owned subsidiary of GSF, provides high quality sauces and condiments to QSR’s, hotels, restaurants and cafes across Oceania. As a leading global supplier, these GSF businesses are necessarily quality focussed whilst striving for a culture of Safety where everyone takes responsibility for their own safety as well as those around them. To capitalise on significantly improved Safety results in 2020, the business is looking to further enhance its goal of an incident free and safe home everyday culture. Our Sustainability goals require utilisation of our ISO 14001 certified EMS to further reduce our environmental footprint and anticipate benefits through reduction in energy, water and waste whilst improving our community reputation and recycling initiatives. To this end we are further investing in Safety and Sustainability resources in all our Asia Pacific markets.§ §The Role§ §New Role. Start January 2021!§ §We need a hands-on §Safety & Sustainability Coordinator§ who will passionately lead and develop the next phase of our Safety and Sustainability journey. Reporting to the Technical Director Asia Pacific, your role will be to provide leadership and expertise in areas of environmental, occupational health and safety (EHS), risk management, and workers compensation/loss control management to our NZ business units. § §More specifically you will:§ § §Develop ownership of Safety and Sustainability tasks into site management and supervisory teams’ duties through annual and monthly tasks planning and allocations.§ §Lead development of guidelines, assist in implementation and monitor comprehensive safety processes and management practices to meet all applicable company policies. § §Implement initiatives to reduce and prevent accidents, occupational illnesses, and exposure to long-term health.§ §Work with facilities in Auckland and Wellington to assure training of all associates in general safety and environmental awareness and specific programs (e.g. Social workplace accountability (SWA), Incident management, manual handling, risk management, LOTO, confined space, personal protective equipment (PPE), powered industrial vehicles, EMS, tradewaste, chemical management, stormwater, spill response).§ §Identify and interpret regulatory standards that impact operational exposures and business activities and guide needed plans to ensure compliance.§ §Collaborate with GSF corporate and APAC peers in identifying sustainability priorities, strategy and action planning and development of sustainability goals and metrics for GSF Fresh and Groenz.  § §Coach sites on ongoing collection of information and managing KPI’s for sustainability and working towards sustainability improvement plans.§ §Lead development of guidelines, assist in implementation and monitor comprehensive environmental processes and management practices to meet all applicable environmental policy requirements and ISO 14001.§ §Lead investigations and improvements in recyclables, water, energy, wastewater discharge, solid waste disposal, hazardous waste, air emissions, spill prevention control, stormwater pollutant discharge elimination system, ozone depleting substances, fuel, and community donations.§ §Conduct periodic EHS inspections and behavoiral observations and coach, direct site teams to do the same.§ §Administer EHS system in Intelex. Develop users and super users to improve and sustain effective use of intelex.§ §Collaborate with procurement teams to design and implement supplier engagement programs to encourage reduction in supply chain emissions, waste, and water use.§ §Manage weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual safety and sustainability reporting with site teams.§ §About you§ §To be considered for this position you must possess the following:§ § §Bachelor’s degree in Science/Technology/Engineering, Life Science, Safety, Environmental, or Risk Management.§ §3 to 5 years of relevant work experience within the food manufacturing, warehousing, and distribution environment.§ §Internal / External audit qualifications.§ §High level of attention to detail and strong communication skills.§ §Self-motivated, enthusiastic and a care factor to drive improvements.§ §Highly organised and strong administrative skills.§ §Intelex or other similar Software platform experience for EHSQ management systems.§ §Willing to travel between Auckland and Wellington on a regular basis.§ §Be able to spend at least 5 - 10 days per month in Wellington.§ §Our Values§ § §Treat others like you want to be treated§ §Make the best product§ §Give the customer a fair deal§ §Maintain the highest standards.§ §If you believe you have the experience and skills, and our values align with your personal values, please apply on-line now!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Human Capital Senior Consultant Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50682058.txt	§Human Capital Senior Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Capital Senior Consultant§§Advertiser: §Deloitte - NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§ §Join an award-winning consulting practice with global reach§ §Build your career with unlimited learning opportunities working alongside high-performing people§ §Give back to your community by helping kiwi businesses deliver transformational change for their people§  § §The Opportunity§ §Deloitte’s Human Capital Consulting practice works closely with business leaders to deliver people projects focused on transformational change, leadership development, culture, and organisation and operating model design. § §As a Senior Consultant in our Organisational Transformation team, you will be a key contributor to high quality project deliverables on a variety of client engagements, with support of your peers, Managers, Directors and Partners who will support your development with guidance and direction.§ §The broad nature of our client base means that you will have the opportunity to gain exposure to a range of industries and to continue to learn every day, developing your core capabilities, which might include:§ § §Your role will focus on utilising your skills and experience from an HR and talent development background to help create people strategies, research, analytics, and industry insights to help design and implement programmes that aims to maximise capability and performance for people.§ §Compile and analyse data through workshops, interviews, questionnaires and other methods to find insights and pain points that addresses client needs.§ §Play an active part in creating of talent development and people strategies, and taking it through to the design and implementation people and talent programmes.§ §Collaborate with the broader Human Capital and Consulting Practice to deliver change management, learning and development, organisation design and other Human Capital capabilities to ensure transformation initiatives are fit for purpose and exceed client expectations.§ §Manage users and stakeholder expectations, own change management issues and escalate as required to appropriate channels to ensure full user adoption and delivery commitments are met.  § §Connect with team members to share knowledge and develop new capabilities and competencies with respect to the latest industry trends and insights.§  § §About you§ § §2 – 5 years’ experience in an HR/People/Talent Development role. Experience in a Consulting/Professional Services environment is highly advantageous.§ §Subject Matter Expertise in best practice Human Resources Business Processes and practices. This includes experience designing and delivering organisation operating models, change management, learning and development strategies and succession planning.§ §Strong quantitative and analysis skills, able to uncover the heart of problems, identify root causes and offer clear solutions in a constructive and logical sequence.§ §Sound interpersonal skills, able to gain the trust and confidence of those you collaborate with.§ §Fluent (close to native level) of English language skills is essential, both written and spoken, as is the ability to engage a range of users at all organisation levels.§  § §About the team§ §We are an award winning Consulting practice, where we are comprised of over 300 professionals nationwide, amongst a wider 1400 within the Deloitte New Zealand network. We continue to grow as a most respected professional services firm and now our Human Capital Practice are looking for talented person like you to working alongside a diverse team of specialist in our Wellington office..§ §At Deloitte, the success of our business is our people. We want people who share our values and relish the opportunity to embrace change, making a difference on every engagement. Our team have all come from a variety of backgrounds and experiences, but all share a common purpose of making an impact that matters to our community.§ §We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture. We are fair in our behaviour and our policies promote equal opportunity for all.§ § §Interested?§ §If you have a passion for learning from talented people and would like to benefit from the support of a global organisation and network, apply now or contact Gracie Wang, Senior Talent Acquisition Advisor, on §+64 (9) 303 0775§ for any questions regarding this role.§ §Deloitte is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.  If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process. §§§§

They shape and influence the way we make decisions, interact with each other and ultimately, they drive us to get things done.§        §For our people§        §When you join us at Kiwibank, you'll be given the support you need to succeed. This means to helping manage any People related queries that cannot be solved through self-serve and/or delegated from the Lead People Partner or Head of roles.§ §What we're looking for:§ § §Knowledge of HR practices and processes and relevant legislation§ §Proven ability to work through people issues in a logical and systematic way and to juggle and prioritise competing deadlines under pressure§ §Able to recognise and balance needs of employees and the organisation§ §Demonstrates an active commitment to continually improving yourself - know your own personal strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and limits, seeks and open to feedback§ §Confident relationship management skills with the ability to quickly build trust and maintain positive effective and collaborative relationships with internal and external contacts and stakeholders§ §Demonstrates discretion and the ability to maintain confidentiality§ §You are a customer advocate with proven ability providing high levels of service in a proactive way§ §Excellent effective verbal and written communications§ §Experience working within teams and across diverse business groups, including the ability to influence other people to get results using a range of methods suitable for the audience§ §Ability to keep various colleagues, customers and stakeholders up to date through appropriate and timely communications.§ §A relevant tertiary qualification and experience in the financial services industry is preferred.§ §We think you'll have around 2 to 3 years' experience in HR so far. This is a true advisory role, but you'll have plenty of support to help you along your HR career path. Have a read of the job description attached and if this exciting role sounds like you, §Apply now!§ §Applications close §Monday 19th October 2020§ (although we reserve the right to withdraw the ad at any time).§ §At Kiwibank we're all about making Kiwis better off.§ §As New Zealand's largest homegrown (and owned) bank, we strive to create an inclusive culture where everyone - our customers, communities, and people - has the opportunity to thrive.§ §It starts with our values§ §Our values - §GUTSY§, §SIDE BY SIDE§, §KEEP IT REAL§ - sit at the heart of our culture. They shape and influence the way we make decisions, interact with each other and ultimately, they drive us to get things done.§ §For our people§ §When you join us at Kiwibank, you'll be given the support you need to succeed. Our work environment is safe, accessible, and representative of our customers and communities. We're proud to have the rainbow tick, and we were the first bank in NZ to get the gender tick.§ §Our great range of benefits include health and life cover, discounted banking, insurance products and an incredible package for new parents. We're also an accredited Living Wage employer.§ §We want you to get the most out of work and life, so you'll have the option to explore flexible working arrangements that suit both your needs and ours.§ §For New Zealand§ §We have a unique opportunity to make a meaningful contribution to a more sustainable Aotearoa. This commitment to growing and transforming our business for the better underpins everything we do.§ §For you§ §We welcome applications from people of all ages, nationalities, cultures, and abilities. We'll do everything we can to ensure your employment journey with us is as easy as possible.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50682664.txt	§Safety and Wellbeing Business Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Safety and Wellbeing Business Partner§§Advertiser: §Ara Institute of Canterbury§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Safety and Wellbeing Business Partner §        §          §Madras Street City campus§          §Permanent, Full-time§          §            §Exciting new role - come and make it your own!§            §Bring your safety expertise and grow your wellbeing knowledge§            §A great blend of coaching, operational work and challenge – we’ve got pretty much every industry on campus!§          §          §Our Health and Safety Manager is retiring after over 25 years’ service and will leave a legacy of sound Health & Safety systems and procedures. We have recently recruited a Safety & Wellbeing Manager who has strength in the wellbeing arena and now we are looking for a Safety and Wellbeing Business Partner to round out the team. You’ll be strong in your safety knowledge and keen to learn more about wellbeing from our very experienced Manager. . You’ll support the new Safety & Wellbeing Manager operationally in coaching and advice to portfolio managers to develop the safety and wellbeing cultures in their teams. We’ve just implemented a new reporting tool and you’ll work with teams to embed it into practice. Each day will be different with the variety of industries and associated risks keeping you on your toes. You’ll be continually learning and growing as you add value to our leaders and their teams.§          §Ara Institute of Canterbury Ltd is a vibrant and progressive tertiary institute providing world-class, tertiary-level education throughout the Canterbury and Waitaki region. Our talented colleagues, innovative business collaborators and supportive community partners are passionate about the role they play in our students' success. Every day we are privileged to be able to see our purpose realised – “Transforming Lives Through Education”. This is a unique opportunity to join us as we ready ourselves to support NZ to invest in training and skills to respond to the post Covid-19 environment.§          §The People and Culture Division, where this role sits, comprises P&C services (e.g. administration, HRIS), business partners and specialist functions including Employment Relations, Safety and Wellbeing, Employee Experience and Capability Development. The mission of the division is to partner with leaders to continually lift our employees’ experience and capability at work and build on our engaging culture so that individuals and the organisation can deliver outcomes beyond their expectations. A number of our areas of work are part of Ara’s Transformation Programme and this very much includes the changes we have been making in Safety and Wellbeing. We are committed to continuing that transformation as it is one of Ara’s Strategic Focus Areas and Priorities.§          §The Role§          §The Safety and Wellbeing Business Partner provides operational support and advice to managers and teams to continually improve the Safety and Wellbeing of people (colleagues and students) in our Ara community. This role partners with managers, teams and the student body to continually build an enduring safe and well culture. This role will integrate the health, safety and wellbeing frameworks and systems (critical risk management, data capture, policies, procedures, measurement) into the organisation and assists their portfolio areas to learn how they are keeping people safe and well and explore what else could be done.§          §The role also provides operational support to the Safety and Wellbeing Manager, ensuring Ara is legislatively current and is reporting and learning from its health, safety and wellbeing performance as well as implementing and improving practices in relation to colleague rehabilitation, psychological safety wellbeing (e.g. bullying and harassment), annual risk reviews, internal audits and the Ara wellbeing programme.§          §Skills/Experience§          §            §Demonstrated awareness of equity, cultural and bicultural issues and a commitment to biculturalism and the ability to translate these into action§            §A tertiary qualification in Health, Safety and Wellbeing or equivalent (or actively working towards one)§            §Minimum of 4 years’ experience in a similar role, with a working knowledge of building culture around health, safety and wellbeing in teams§            §Evidence of keeping up to date with health, safety and wellbeing technical requirements, legislation and practices§            §Proven track record of transferring knowledge into action§            §Experience of developing and maintaining effective relationships internally, across the organisation and externally§            §Current Drivers licence (travel required to our different campuses)§            §Excellent problem solving, analytical, ‘root cause’ exploration skills§            §Team player: collaborative ability with a sense of humour and a proactive approach§            §Preference will be given to candidates with a working knowledge of large and complex organisations and how that might be applied in a public sector organisation.§          §          §Benefits§          §Enjoy excellent employment conditions, professional and skill development, a great central city location and access to modern on-site facilities including Gym/Recreation Centre with free yoga and group fitness sessions for colleagues, a Library and Visions our on Campus Restaurant, two Childcare Centres and a Health Centre.§Click here to view the role description§          §To Apply§          §We accept applications via our online application system. For a job description and/or to apply online please visit §https://careers.ara.ac.nz§          §If you have any queries in relation to the vacancy or application process, please contact the People and Culture team via §PeopleandCulture@ara.ac.nz§ or §03 940 8623§.§          §Applications close – Monday 19th October 2020§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§Madras Street City campus§Permanent, Full-time§Exciting new role - come and make it your own!§Bring your safety expertise and grow your wellbeing knowledge§A great blend of coaching, operational work and challenge – we’ve got pretty much every industry on campus!§Our Health and Safety Manager is retiring after over 25 years’ service and will leave a legacy of sound Health & Safety systems and procedures. jobText: TXT/50684272.txt	§Kairuruku Rauemi Tangata - People and Culture Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kairuruku Rauemi Tangata - People and Culture Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Culture and Heritage§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$50,628 [85%]- $$59,562 [mid-point]§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §        §Kairuruku Rauemi Tangata - People and Culture Coordinator §        §        §        §          §He ngākau titikaha, he hononga tangata§          §Promoting a confident and connected culture§          §Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the role§          §Reporting to the Manager, People and Culture, this role is core to our P&C team, providing co-ordination, admin and project related support across the employee lifecycle (e.g. recruitment, onboarding, employment relations, learning and development and coaching for success).§          §Kōrero mōu - About you§          §You will have a good grasp of Microsoft Office and pick up new systems with ease. Remaining calm when busy, you will have a natural bent for organising yourself and others, with the ability to switch priorities to get both the urgent and important tasks completed on time.§          §Putting people at the heart of everything you do, you will have a genuine interest in learning and will have (and continue to build) a good understanding of generalist people practices and policies in the Ministry so you can answer all types of people related queries that come your way.§          §As you grow into the role you will be supported to pick up and run project related work with cross-organisational impact. Current projects on the go include improving our induction, introducing a flexible working toolkit and coordinating a diversity and inclusion audit.§          §Key things we are looking for from you include:§          §            §An interest in the people and culture profession with a passion for helping others§            §The ability to juggle demands and deliver on time and with accuracy§            §Sound ability in the Microsoft Office suite of programs including Word, Excel & Outlook§            §A commitment to developing knowledge of te reo Māori, tikanga and the Treaty of Waitangi§            §Great use of initiative alongside your ability to think pragmatically§            §Professional integrity to process highly confidential information§            §Outstanding communication skills - both written and oral§          §          §Ko wai mātou - About us§          §Manatū Taonga has a broad mandate and wide reach across a complex system. With around 140 staff, we operate a lean and flat structure, with the added advantage of knowing everyone by name. We embrace diversity and inclusiveness, are passionate about our mahi, and welcome experiences from diﬀerent sectors to strengthen and support the pou of our whare.§          §We work in a sector that contributes $11 billion to New Zealand's GDP and over 90,000 jobs, ranging from screen production to symphonies, broadcasting to ballet, kapa haka to heritage, and more. Our mahi helps the government promote Aotearoatanga, our unique cultural identity - from policy to programme delivery. With our partners - Māori, public sector agencies and our funded agencies - we connect local communities to cultural experiences to enrich our mātauranga. Our sector funds and tells stories reﬂecting who New Zealanders are today, helping us to navigate our future and building the inclusive and cohesive country we want our tamariki to grow up in and call home.§          §Check us out here: §https://mch.govt.nz/about-ministry/jobs-and-careers§          §Te Mahi Hangore - Working flexibly§          §Manatū Taonga embraces flexible working. Our mahi helps the government promote Aotearoatanga, our unique cultural identity - from policy to programme delivery. With our partners - Māori, public sector agencies and our funded agencies - we connect local communities to cultural experiences to enrich our mātauranga. Our sector funds and tells stories reﬂecting who New Zealanders are today, helping us to navigate our future and building the inclusive and cohesive country we want our tamariki to grow up in and call home.§Check us out here: §https://mch.govt.nz/about-ministry/jobs-and-careers§Te Mahi Hangore - Working flexibly§Manatū Taonga embraces flexible working. We're open minded about how you can be your best both inside and outside work so please tell us what working arrangements might suit you.§Me pēhea te tono - How to apply§A position description for this role is attached. For enquiries please contact Jane: §jane.ransfield@mch.govt.nz§To apply please click apply now§If you are not a New Zealand citizen, you must hold current eligibility to work in New Zealand in order to work for Manatū Taonga. Please refer to the §New Zealand Immigration Service§ for further information.§Click here to view the role description§§Applications close 5pm Sunday, 11 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

This role based in the South Waikato region has everything in it that will appeal to a seasoned HR professional who enjoys challenge and working in partnership with managers, employees and their representatives.§        §In this role, your key responsibilities will be to provide HR services across the site and be a key member of the leadership team. You will provide generalist HR services; developing and delivering solutions and advice; coaching and mentoring Managers; project work as required and be part of the wider regional based HR team.§        §To be successful in this role you will have had exposure to the full breadth of HR generalist practices and be passionate about the delivery of HR services that demonstrate best practice.§        §We are looking for someone who has:§        §          §A tertiary qualification in HR;§          §Exceptional  relationship management and influencing skills;§          §A record of success in the provision of generalist HR advice and support to both Managers and employees in a medium to large organisation;§          §Experience in a manufacturing environment ideally and/or a manufacturing ‘mind set’;§          §Solid numeracy skills and the ability to use metrics to identify and drive forward on opportunities and create business cases;§          §Communication skills that are highly developed which are used to persuade, negotiate and influence the business;§          §Exposure to working closely with unions; §          §Strategic agility and future orientation;§          §Commitment to and proven ability to develop and implement quality service improvement processes to foster strong working relationships and employee engagement.§        §        §In return this role offers the opportunity to work in a complex and changing business; a solid remuneration package including enhanced superannuation and benefits; and the chance to grow your skillset and career in a dynamic environment.§        §We look forward to hearing from you if you are interested in a role that will shape your career and allow you to work in an environment where you will be tested yet give you the chance to sharpen and hone your already strong skill set and experience.§        §To find out more about this role please contact Sandra Diekerhof, Director at HR Connect on 027 52 666 99 for a confidential discussion, or simply apply below.§      §      §      §      §    §    §www.hrconnect.co.nz§  §§§   §  §Dynamic complex environment §  §Tokoroa location§Our client, has a significant presence in the manufacturing sector in New Zealand, producing a range of speciality products for customers based throughout the Asia-Pacific region.
