jobTitle: Experienced HR Specialist Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50685187.txt	§Experienced HR Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced HR Specialist§§Advertiser: §Sorted HR§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$75,000 - $84,999§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§About us§ § § §SortedHR is a new, locally grown player in the outsourced HR market in Auckland. We will navigate between the huge-scale automated suppliers, and the boutique firms. We will build trusted relationships with a wide variety of small and medium sized businesses, supplying quality, tailored documents and offering ongoing support to the degree to which our clients need and use us. Our pitch is prevention (always better than cure) and our service will be second to none.§ §SortedHR prioritises our staff's professional and personal growth, knowing that investment in the roots of a business leads to lasting fruitfulness. If you are looking for the opportunity to get in on the ground floor of something remarkable, we want to hear from you.§ §PLEASE NOTE applications close 20 October, 5pm.§ § § §Qualifications & experience§ § § §Proven experience managing disciplinary actions, redundancies, restructures and performance management processes.§The ability to provide professional, commercially sound, client-centred advice to organisations from a wide variety of industries.§First-class written and verbal communication skills, and up to date knowledge of the national employment relations framework.§Qualifications in law, industrial relations or human resources preferred.§ § § §Tasks & responsibilities§ § § §Tailor HR tools of the trade for business owners from a wide variety of industries, whose expertise generally lie elsewhere.§Hold professional face to face meetings with our clients to prepare a suite of documents, and return to introduce this material to the organisation.§Guide and advise our clients on how to implement their new ER management system in order to strengthen their business.§Respond efficiently and commercially, usually by phone and/or email, as our clients face employment relations issues.§Monitor changes to legislation and key court cases to help prepare industry updates for clients and prospects.§ § § §Benefits§ § § §Home office and tools of the trade (computer, iphone, uber card for Auckland wide business travel).§Flexible hours Mon-Fri, starting with 24 hours per week with potential to grow.§Additional leave after one year.§Profit share after first year for the right candidate.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of employment & workplace relations?§How many years' experience do you have in industrial relations & employment law?§§§

jobTitle: People + Culture Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50685696.txt	§People + Culture Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People + Culture Coordinator§§Advertiser: §ezyVet Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§Do you get fired up about EVP, align with our values and seek out challenge when others run for cover?  Well, here's an opportunity to feed that ambition while growing your career at pace! You’ll get the chance to shape P+C services for our global teams who are hell bent on making a difference to the animal health industry. With customers in over twenty countries, 140+ staff now and offices in London, Dallas and Auckland, there’s no better time than now to join the ezyVet journey.§What you’ll be doing as our People & Culture Coordinator§§ §Be a      champion of ezyVet’s culture and values and an awesome ambassador for the      People & Culture team.§ §Drive a      seamless employee experience and slick processes around the provision of      core P&C life-cycle activities.§ §Responding      to employee queries regarding P+C processes, systems, leave, benefits and      allowances taking into account legislative and company policies and      practices, or escalating queries as appropriate.§ §Collaborate      and partner with specific business areas (Finance, Marketing etc) to      deliver projects, process improvements and innovative solutions into the      business.§§You'll support the development, administration and coordination of P+C tools, processes and programmes within the following core areas:§ §Recruitment      - this is a biggie!§ §Induction and on-boarding of      ezyVet’s new joiners§ §Employment documentation and ER§ §Performance, reward and benefits§ §Learning and development§ §Systems and reporting§ §Health and safety management§§About you and what type of skills you need§§ §Bachelor’s      degree and/or functional HR knowledge and experience§ §Relentless      pursuit for exceptional customer service§ §Tech savvy      and passion for building efficiency using it § §Confident,      super organised, accurate and articulate§ §High      energy, positive and truly enjoy the pressures of achieving hard      things § §Potentially      a handy indoor netballer…..§§ezyVet is growing at a fast pace, no two days are the same and no manual exists that will tell you what to do. If you’re a self-starter, team player and want to be a part of building something great, then we’d love to hear from you.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50685924.txt	§Health and Safety Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Advisor§§Advertiser: §Hill Laboratories§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Health and Safety Advisor §      §        §We have an exciting opportunity for a Health and Safety Advisor to join our newly established BOP Branch providing fruit maturity testing services to the kiwifruit industry. Reporting to the Branch Manager - Bay of Plenty based in Mount Maunganui, you will be responsible for advising our team of Fruit Sample Collectors and the local branch laboratory on all aspects of Health and Safety.§        §As a key member of our Health and Safety team you will be supported in this role by our organisations Health and Safety Manager (based in Hamilton). You will have experience and knowledge of both health and safety and quality management systems and will be based in our Bay of Plenty office.§        §We are seeking an experienced Health and Safety professional who is confident in their knowledge of legislation.§        §Key tasks and responsibilities include the following: §        §          §Advising on operational health and safety in both a laboratory and field context§          §Establish a safety culture and awareness for the branch§          §Participate in health and safety initiatives§          §Be an active participant in industry health and safety groups actively seeking continuous improvement§          §Complete health and safety inductions for branch employees and sub-contractors§          §Provide onsite training and education to branch employees and contractors, as required§          §Assist with and coordinate quality related audits and accreditation/certification processes where required§        §        §About you:§        §          §A tertiary level qualification, science or occupational health sciences or equivalent§          §Minimum of three-five years experience within a health and safety role§          §Sound knowledge of health and safety legislation§          §Experience working with casual/seasonal staff or the kiwifruit industry an advantage§          §Experience in auditing and documentation functions§          §Excellent communication skills with a focus of establishing a strong health and safety culture§          §Excellent organisational skills and high personal work standards§          §Proven ability to work in a demanding environment, dealing with conflicting priorities that require initiative, agility and adaptability§        §        §We provide an excellent environment for fostering and developing talent and enabling innovation in a family-friendly, supportive and mature New Zealand owned business which continues to grow.§        §What we offer§        §We are offering a competitive package for the right candidate.§        §At Hill Laboratories, we believe in looking after our people. That's why the P in our PIHA values stands for 'People are valued and we enjoy our work'. jobTitle: Health and Safety Programme Manager Job in Taranaki - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50688287.txt	§Health and Safety Programme Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Programme Manager§§Advertiser: §Port Taranaki Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§Port Taranaki, as the only deep-water harbour on New Zealand’s west coast, is strategically important to the economic development of the Taranaki region.  To achieve our vision of being “The Pride of Taranaki”, we have set out a strategic direction that focuses on improvement and excellence. This role will support the achievement of this through delivery of initiatives focused on strategic health and safety priorities.§The Role§This role provides the opportunity for a skilled senior H&S practitioner to combine their technical expertise with their proven leadership and coaching skills to make a real difference at Port Taranaki. Reporting to the GM People and Safety, you will bring deep practical HSE knowledge and leadership to the business. The role is responsible for influencing and engaging the team to ensure everyone is safe at work, a positive safety culture is in place and people hold themselves and others to account for health, safety and wellbeing. The role will also develop and strengthen our safety systems and policies and lead the implementation of H&S programmes. A key focus for this role is building the safety leadership capability of senior leaders, line managers and supervisors through coaching and support. §Skills and Experience§To be successful in this role, you will have significant experience (5-10 years) in a senior H&S role along with a relevant formal qualification in occupational or process safety or a related discipline.  You will be able to demonstrate competence in designing and implementing safety management systems and risk management practices.  This role is about leading and engaging people, so you will be an exceptional communicator with proven leadership experience in developing and coaching others at all levels across the business.§You will also be resilient, have excellent attention to detail and be able to hold yourself and others to account. Demonstrated programme management and facilitation skills would also be to your advantage.§We offer a friendly and welcoming workplace environment and place a strong focus on supporting our staff to grow their talents and capabilities. §If you can demonstrate that you meet the above key selection criteria, have a positive can-do attitude and are motivated to contribute to the overall success of Port Taranaki, then apply online now.§Please apply online with your CV and covering letter§Applications close 5pm, 18th October 2020 §For a copy of the Job Description visit §PD-HS-Programme-Manager.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50692616.txt	§HR Services Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Services Manager§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §HR Services Manager §      §        §Downer New Zealand is a leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment to building long-term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions; the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart. §        §We have a fantastic opportunity for an experienced HR professional to join our team in the role of HR Services Manager!§        §In your role, you will lead the HR Services function delivering expertise, leadership and guidance around our people management practices, policies and procedures.   This role is responsible for our HR master data & reporting, day-to-day management of our core HR systems and management of our remuneration, benefits & recognition.  HR Services provides core HR delivery both directly to the business and through supporting the other parts of HR.§        §This role reports to our Executive General Manager People & Culture, and plays an active role as part of our wider HR Leadership team.§        §We are looking for an experienced HR practitioner who lives and breathes what they do.    You will bring a breath of knowledge across all areas of HR, with particular expertise in HR analytics / data, policies and processes improvement, generalist HR, prior exposure managing remuneration & benefits combined with proven leadership skills.  Ideally, you have experience working within larger or complex organisations.§        §This is an outstanding opportunity to work in our diverse business. The environment is challenging and rewarding. We offer the opportunity to join our diverse and inclusive culture, and be part of a great team working in a collaborative environment. We offer a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, and our focus for our people is training and development, so this gives excellent opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.   §        §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 573934 to apply.  For an initial confidential conversation, please don’t hesitate to contact Natalie Yakas, National Recruitment Manager – §Natalie.yakas@downer.co.nz§. §        §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§ §      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§  §§§Downer New Zealand is a leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment to building long-term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions; the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart. §We have a fantastic opportunity for an experienced HR professional to join our team in the role of HR Services Manager!§In your role, you will lead the HR Services function delivering expertise, leadership and guidance around our people management practices, policies and procedures.   This role is responsible for our HR master data & reporting, day-to-day management of our core HR systems and management of our remuneration, benefits & recognition.  HR Services provides core HR delivery both directly to the business and through supporting the other parts of HR.§This role reports to our Executive General Manager People & Culture, and plays an active role as part of our wider HR Leadership team.§We are looking for an experienced HR practitioner who lives and breathes what they do.    You will bring a breath of knowledge across all areas of HR, with particular expertise in HR analytics / data, policies and processes improvement, generalist HR, prior exposure managing remuneration & benefits combined with proven leadership skills.  Ideally, you have experience working within larger or complex organisations.§This is an outstanding opportunity to work in our diverse business. The environment is challenging and rewarding. We offer the opportunity to join our diverse and inclusive culture, and be part of a great team working in a collaborative environment. We offer a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, and our focus for our people is training and development, so this gives excellent opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.   §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 573934 to apply.  For an initial confidential conversation, please don’t hesitate to contact Natalie Yakas, National Recruitment Manager – §Natalie.yakas@downer.co.nz§. §§Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§ §§§§

We deliver recruitment and career services to organisations and individuals across the employment life cycle.§        §About the Opportunity§        §We are seeking a strong experienced people leader to manage our Penrose branch, this is a role for someone who not only enjoys leading and empowering others to be the best they can be but also someone who is not afraid to roll up their sleeves and get stuck in with their team and fill those job orders or answer the phones when the pressure is on.§        §You will be a strategic thinker, with an ability to future proof the strategy for your branch; ensuring we are ahead of the game when it comes to market intel, talent sourcing and mapping, troubleshooting and managing multiple client solutions.§        §Although this branch is one of four in Auckland, it is the only branch that is dedicated and focussed on delivering to the Civil and Construction industry, and with a very strong client base to service and a talent pool of 200+ trade qualified and skilled employees, you will have a solid and well-appointed foundation to continue the development and growth of our vision for our New Zealand business.§        §To succeed and hit the ground running you will have prior experience in the Civil & Construction Industry, either from within the recruitment industry or direct from the industry itself. jobTitle: Health and Safety Manager Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50694015.txt	§Health and Safety Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Manager§§Advertiser: §SILC Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§For over 25 years, The SILC Charitable Trust has been partnering with disabled people and their whānau to live their best lives.§ §We walk alongside the people we support to facilitate a sense of belonging and independence.§The Role:§Reporting to the CEO, this is a leadership role with accountability for creating a positive health and safety culture across the organisation. This role is a real mix of strategic/operational and you will lead the review and refresh of H&S strategies and policies that will drive continuous improvement within the organisation. §Responsibilities:§  §Champion a culture that promotes a safe working environment and a culture of safe behaviours.§  §Review, refresh and implement H&S policies and procedures.§  §Develop and establish a H&S audit system using participative approach and involving all stakeholders.§  §Evaluate health and safety practice and procedures for risk assessment. §  §Provide sound advice on H&S to stakeholders and escalate areas of noncompliance. §  §Suggest solutions, improvements and prevention steps for safety issues.§  §Work closely with stakeholders to respond to any H&S issues to ensure that risk assessments are undertaken across all activities, included in policy, and reviewed on a regular basis.§  §Ensure staff are trained and compliant to Infection Control and Personal Protection Equipment protocols, procedures and policies.§  §Understand the United Nations Convention on the Rights of Person with Disabilities and apply these principles to all H&S policies and procedures ensuring a least restrictive response.§  §Report on H&S to encourage engagement throughout the organisation.§  §Co-ordinate the Emergency Management Team and manage emergency response plans.§  §Manage worker engagement and participation practices by ensuring that workers views on matters that could affect their H&S are asked for, considered, and that there are clear, effective and ongoing ways for workers to raise concerns or suggest improvements on a day-to-day basis.§ §Skills & Experience Required:§  §A tertiary qualification in H&S and/or significant experience in a H&S role (minimum 3-5 years) in a medium to large size organisation.§  §Charity sector or public benefit entity and/or experience and a high level of knowledge of compliance in the health and disability sector OR a willingness and desire to understand compliance in the health and disability sector.§  §Thorough knowledge of health and safety laws and guidelines with experience in development of H&S Systems, Policies and Procedures.§  §Passion for quality improvement and change processes bringing a collegial transformational approach to change rather than a punitive model.§  §Sound understanding of Risk Management and its application.§  §Identifying risk and safety hazards devising elimination or minimisation procedures. §  §Monitoring metrics and detailed reporting on health and safety performance and strategic plans.§  §Investigative skills to conduct enquiries on serious health and safety events and notifiable events. §  §Ability to work in a complex work environment and deal with ambiguity and across functions.§  §Intermediate to Advanced Microsoft Excel skills §Ability to work within the Trust’s values of:§  §Building a strong collaborative relationships throughout the organisation.§  §Operating in a transparent and pro-active manner, sharing knowledge and your experience with the team.§  §Supporting the wellbeing of colleagues through team work.§  §Taking responsibility for your own wellbeing.§  §Communicating openly and honestly and in a manner that both values and respects all people. §  §Being committed to continual professional development.§  §Having a genuine desire to make a positive difference to people's lives.§Why Apply?§It is a great time to join us! We remain committed to our strong history but at the same time we are introducing a number of exciting initiatives that are driving change in the organisation and you will have the opportunity to influence this change. In addition, we offer a flexible working environment, with a supportive team and with this newly created role, you will have the chance to carve your own path.§Does this opportunity sound like you?§ §If so, please click the Apply button.§ §Or if you would like a confidential chat about this role, please call Heather Hoskins on 029 9289012.Applications Close 22nd October 2020.§ §§For a copy of the Job Description visit §Health-Safety-Manager-Job-Description.docx§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Our aspiration is that our health, safety, security and wellbeing practices are comparable with the best and most responsible organisations.§Our People and Culture group work in partnership across Council to create a high performing, safe, happy and healthy workplace for all, enabling our people to deliver great services to our communities. We are embarking on a journey where we practice with kindness and are committed to being insightful, unattached, focussed, connected and authentic in our approach to best partner with our customers. As a group we are committed to collaboration and continuous improvement and it is an exciting journey to be part of and you will thrive here if you enjoy challenging yourself and can embrace a changing environment.§In this role, you will partner with the business to implement the safety management system and deliver on key outcomes. You will play an important part in assisting with reporting and metrics to inform good decision making for the wellbeing of our people. Our ideal person will be highly organised, empathetic and proactive more so than reactive, so you are able to plug any gaps. What will really set you apart will be your strong interpersonal and relationship management skills. Most importantly, we're looking for a someone with a real belief that the health, safety and wellbeing of all our workers matters..!§In exchange for your skills, you'll work for an organisation that really values its people. Since 1998, we have provided proven cost-effective billing and customer management solutions to our clients in Australasia, the Middle East and North America.§ We have a diverse mix of highly talented folks, ranging from keen, fresh graduates to domain and technology experts with decades of experience to draw on. We take pride in our energetic, enthusiastic and sociable company culture. We work hard but we don't take each other too seriously either. At the end of the day you've got to enjoy what you're doing and who you're doing it with!§   § §About the Role§   § Are you passionate about providing an excellent candidate experience? Committed to building strong relationships and achieving results?§   § If this sounds like you, a fantastic opportunity for a Talent Acquisition Consultant with some HR support has arisen within Agility CIS.§ § We are seeking someone who is switched on and flexible to support our high volume recruitment process.  Reporting into HR, you will be responsible for end to end recruitment of mostly technical and some corporate positions.§   § You will have proven experience as an internal recruiter as well as excellent stakeholder management. You will be agile, adaptable and flexible, plus have exceptional communication skills. Whilst not essential it would be advantageous if you had previous experience recruiting IT and or Technical positions, and exposure to JobAdder.§   § In return you will have the opportunity to improve the recruitment experience as well as work within a great team that is growing.§   § This is a six month fixed term contract role, though there may be scope to extend that as we move forward.§   § §Key responsibilities include§        §          §Proactively sourcing candidates to fill vacancies, and talent pooling for future resourcing§          §The end to end recruitment process from advertising, to interviews, to placement and more.§          §Proactively sourcing and recruiting new university graduates via Uni Careers Hubs, this includes attending the annual Careers fairs in the regions§          §Maximising LinkedIn, Google searches and sourcing tools to support the business in sourcing industry talent§          §Work effectively and collaboratively with other Teams to §§§We are looking for a skilled Talent Acquisition Consultant to join us in our Auckland office as we recruit to a number of key positions to help facilitate our ongoing transformation! §  § §Who is Since 1998, we have provided proven cost-effective billing and customer management solutions to our clients in Australasia, the Middle East and North America.§ We have a diverse mix of highly talented folks, ranging from keen, fresh graduates to domain and technology experts with decades of experience to draw on. We take pride in our energetic, enthusiastic and sociable company culture. We work hard but we don't take each other too seriously either. At the end of the day you've got to enjoy what you're doing and who you're doing it with!§   § §About the Role§   § Are you passionate about providing an excellent candidate experience? Committed to building strong relationships and achieving results?§   § If this sounds like you, a fantastic opportunity for a Talent Acquisition Consultant with some HR support has arisen within Agility CIS.§ § We are seeking someone who is switched on and flexible to support our high volume recruitment process.  Reporting into HR, you will be responsible for end to end recruitment of mostly technical and some corporate positions.§   § You will have proven experience as an internal recruiter as well as excellent stakeholder management. You will be agile, adaptable and flexible, plus have exceptional communication skills. Whilst not essential it would be advantageous if you had previous experience recruiting IT and or Technical positions, and exposure to JobAdder.§   § In return you will have the opportunity to improve the recruitment experience as well as work within a great team that is growing.§   § This is a six month fixed term contract role, though there may be scope to extend that as we move forward.§   § placement and more.§ §Proactively sourcing and recruiting new university graduates via Uni Careers Hubs, this includes attending the annual Careers fairs in the regions§ §Maximising LinkedIn, Google searches and sourcing tools to support the business in sourcing industry talent§ §Work effectively and collaboratively with other Teams to support the achievement of recruitment goals§ §Maintain jobTitle: BEST RECRUITMENT JOB IN THE WORLD - BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU READ - APPLY NOW! Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50697392.txt	§BEST RECRUITMENT JOB IN THE WORLD - BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU READ - APPLY NOW!§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§BEST RECRUITMENT JOB IN THE WORLD - BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU READ - APPLY NOW!§§Advertiser: §Recruitment Expert§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§I KNOW YOU WANT TO - SO GO ON...APPLY!§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §BEST RECRUITMENT JOB IN THE WORLD - BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU READ - APPLY NOW! §    §      §        §          §Outstanding opportunity for people looking for §flexibility & great earnings but want to work hard§          §Profit share potential & Uncapped Commissions§          §Flexibility - §Work from home§ and be your own boss (min 4-5 days p/w) working from anywhere in Australia or New Zealand. If you ever wanted to feel like you're §running your own business§ - this is the opportunity for you (without risking your house or savings and making money from the get go while working from home) while being supported by an experienced mentor. §        §  §We are a growing Recruitment Agency with §big dreams, a solid vision and a track record of success§ - and we would love to have interesting, loyal and hard working people come along on the journey to success. At the moment we recruit in the most exciting niche ever - ACCOUNTANTS (they're not that bad...really!) on a national scale and are growing quite rapidly and will be expanding to other service lines – MEDICAL (Doctors, Physios, Radiologists), FINANCIAL PLANNING, LEGAL (so if you have experience in these sectors either from there or B2B then reach out) etc...§  §We operate a no nonsense approach by doing the right thing by our clients and candidates, hard work and sincerity.§  §Ideally, you want to be able to work from home full time with flexibility, have full management support but also have a lot of autonomy and you thrive on success - we're building a culture of success and want to be surrounded by people that are driven, fun and intelligent and those that understand that §success breeds success.§  §We are looking for individuals that are:§  §1.     Prepared to §enjoy life§ while §making great money§ and §looking after their families§2.     Very §success driven and goal oriented§ - we want a culture of success and we are only prepared to hire winners§3.     You know how to build rapport and §consult in an honest and engaging way §that adds value§4.     Have high levels of §Attention to Detail§5.     Must have a track record of success in your life and ability to execute and get $##t done no matter what. §6.     Genuinely want to be involved in building the business and make it better every year - §proactive individuals§ that strive for personal improvement§7.     §Loyal§ & §Intelligent§ - we want people that will be the fabric of this organisation for many years to come and if you want to be involved in the management of the company then even better. Recruitment is not something you give a go, unless you’re prepared to put in the hard yards and make it a career for at least 4-5 years – don’t bother applying – it’s too hard of a job to just “give it a go”§8.     Open minded, tough, very intelligent, resilient, curious and lots of fun§9.     People with high commercial acumen that know how to consult not just hard sell.§10. §Ideally (bonus but not necessary):§- You have a §Recruitment Agency/Sales/Accounting/Medical/Legal/Management background§, where you have used your outstanding communication skills to build strong relationships and achieve sales targets§ - If you have an §Accounting/Medical/Legal/FinPlan/Corporate§ background in Australia - even better. §- §Ability to create quick and strong rapport with clients over the phone §and a willingness to contribute as part of a collaborative and dynamic team.§- You have some §extra skills to bring to the team§ - such as digital marketing, copywriting, website development etc...§               § ***100% Fluency in English is a must***§Once you prove yourself as a capable Recruiter that can bill and train other recruiters and earn their respect as a Manager and then you’ll be promoted to Director to grow and lead the company further into different markets (niche and geographic) – if you wish, if not, I’m more than happy for you to remain an excellent recruiter. §  §What you're going to get:§  §• A lot of §training§ but also a lot of being thrown in the deep end§• Ability to §work from home§ (part time or full time) but still be part of a team (for those in Capital Cities can arrange an office)§• Have a §lot of fun doing an amazing job§• §Earning great money§ - way above industry average - at the same time not interested in people that expect high base salaries - this is sales - this will be a low base or §COMMISSION ONLY role§ to begin with (depending on your experience) and if you perform well then a base determined by the billings of your previous two quarters, which you'll earn after you qualify for it - the rest you actually have to earn (like close a sale - you know the fun part!).§• Involved in the decision making of the business and if you're up for it - the management & potential ownership of the company down the road§• Lots of bonuses and incentives§  §Ideal for people tired of the corporate environment §wanting to be financially independent or spoil the family with some extra holidays and toys...but also be there for your kids at school events, sports events and watch them get a medal in their 100m race at the athletics carnival (even if there are only 3 kids in the race!). If your kids are at school and you have time to work hard during school hours and watch your kids grow up and be there for them when they come home from school then this is for you. But this is not a 9-5pm job - in recruitment you always have to be available for your clients and candidates by phone or email. §This role §WILL NOT WORK§ for you if: §        §          §You DON’T have solid corporate experience (i.e.: you’ve never worked in an office environment unless you were a doctor).§          §You DON’T have a stable job history (i.e.: your CV looks worse than a that of a job-hopping kangaroo)§          §You're AFRAID of working hard - the role requires discipline and hard work to begin with, afterwards gets much easier, you will be doing long hours, your candidates are sometimes only available after hours – so you need to be available when they are.§          §You're AFRAID of picking up the phone and speaking to strangers on a daily basis and using your skills and intelligence to influence them§          §You're NOT WILLING TO COMMIT 3-5 years to this because this role takes time to master and pay growing dividends the longer you're in it§          §You are NOT COACHABLE & INTELLIGENT - there is a lot of training provided so you need to want to learn and more important implement§          §You're NOT A TEAM PLAYER - this is a team effort and will require everyone to contribute to the success of the business§          §You are NOT COMMITTED TO YOUR SUCCESS, LACK DRIVE IN LIFE and HAVE OTHER BUSINESSES OR PRIORITIES on the side that will distract you. §          §You are NOT AN HONEST & TRUSTWORTHY INDIVIDUAL - you will get full transparency, honesty, and integrity from me with a lot of support and training - but I expect honesty and integrity from you as well. §        § That's it!§ (Can’t believe you’ve read this far) §The rest is up to you. But we want winners on board. If you're interested (and you should be - I mean §WHO wouldn't want to recruit accountants from home and have fun doing that while making the big bucks!!!§)§  §Make sure you research and understand the challenges & realities of working in recruitment in an agency environment and you are §comfortable with a potentially commission only role§ to begin with (so we don't waste each other's time – otherwise I’m paying you to watch Netflix at home). This is not for everyone but is very rewarding for those that are prepared to work hard and make a career out of it. Most consultants make §six figure incomes§ (not bad when you're working from home). Also - this role only works if you can dedicate ideally 5 days (to begin with anyway) where you can be on the phone during working hours (i.e. in the range of 9-5 when your clients will be able to talk to you) but you can still organise your time as you wish but you will need an environment where you are not distracted by anything else and are available to work when your clients and candidates need you (because there are after-hours interviews when candidates are available only at that time). §Apply§ §ONLY§ §BY§ sending §Michael§ an §EMAIL§ with your CV to §michael@recruitmentexpert.com.au§, §with a cover letter§ explaining whatever you want to explain in relation to the above (why recruitment, and that you understand what's involved, how low base+commission structure will work for you financially, why you think you’ll make this work for you and you’ve done your research to understand what’s involved etc...) and you §have to use the word§ giraffe in your story.§  §Talk to you soon!§(We get 100’s of applications so only successful candidates will be contacted)§      §      §Michael Edelstein §    §    §The Experts you Trust§    §  §§§ §Outstanding opportunity for people looking for §flexibility & great earnings but want to work hard§ §Profit share potential & Uncapped Commissions§ §Flexibility - §Work from home§ and be your own boss (min 4-5 days p/w) working from anywhere in Australia or New Zealand. jobTitle: HR Analyst Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50697668.txt	§HR Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Analyst§§Advertiser: §Coca-Cola Amatil NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Salary + benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Other§§§§§§This is a newly created role that ensures our HR systems enable us to work efficiently and streamlines our HR functionality. You’ll be responsible for the regular maintenance of all HR systems and execution of systems changes and upgrades, with key responsibilities as follows:§ § §Supporting and maintaining our HR systems through§ testing, integrations, and enhancements, while identifying ongoing process improvement opportunities§ §Establishment of HR reporting and dashboards§, working with the different teams in HR to interpret their functional needs and maintain dashboards over time§ §Working closely with our HR department leads§, as well as with our Australian and Group Systems teams to develop systems that suit§ §Build relationships with external vendors§ to explore future opportunities for our business.§ §Support the delivery of the HR Systems roadmap§ through strong partnerships across the organisation§ §This role will see you working predominantly with SuccessFactors as well as a number of other peripheral systems.§  §About You:§  §With a strong eye for the details and a passion for data, you are an experienced HR analyst who can work independently and be a self-led high performer. You’ll bring strong communication skills with the ability to build rapport and communicate clearly with our people, partners, and process owners.  §  §You have knowledge of the science behind what we do in HR and the key HR processes and are enthusiastic about keeping up with new trends and innovations that allow our HR practices to evolve. You will also have:§ § §1-3 years previous experience in a similar role within a medium to large organisation§ §Advanced Excel skills and experience with data visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI etc.)§ §Experience with SuccessFactors is a huge advantage, but exposure to Workday or Cornerstone will also be considered§ §Exposure to PayGlobal, Pivot, CultureAmp, and Beakon would be an advantage§ §The Benefits:§  §Work within a dedicated team of 25 HR professionals - this is a permanent, full-time role in a flexible environment. You'll get a fantastic competitive salary, superannuation, and shares - not to mention plenty of complimentary product. We have fantastic health and wellbeing initiatives, and best of all you get access to our world-famous learning and development environment - who knows where your Amatil NZ career path will take you!§  §The Culture:§  §We are exceptionally proud to be recognised as one of NZ’s Best Employers four years in a row! If you ask our team what they love about working here, they will tell you it is our people, our brands, and our culture. Our vision and values are at the heart of everything we do, and we are committed to creating millions of moments of happiness and possibilities for our employees. Bring the real you and be part of a culture where we embrace equal opportunities and promote diversity and inclusion. We encourage you to bring your unique differences and perspectives to Coca Cola Amatil – apply now!§  § §  §Applications close 18th October 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Consultants Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50697727.txt	§Consultants§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Consultants§§Advertiser: §JacksonStone & Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §        §Consultants §        §        §        §        §        §          §            §Executive Search & Recruitment.§            §Opportunities for Senior Consultants.§          §Who are we? § A member of the AWF Madison Group, an NZX listed company, JacksonStone & Partners (JacksonStone) has become a well-regarded New Zealand agency since launching in 2011. JacksonStone specialises in executive search, recruitment, and top-level contracting assignments across New Zealand with its core business located in Wellington. With over 20 consultants, JacksonStone works across the private, public and NGO sectors, and appoints leaders in most professions. § §We are growing!§ Joining a close-knit, highly regarded team, these roles are suited to experienced recruiters or high-performing managers. Providing excellent opportunities to transition your career into executive-level search and appointments or the professional contracting environment learning from some of the best in the industry. § You will bring expertise in managing expectations, of clients and candidates. Driven and passionate with loads of EQ, you will be at the top of your game and ready to use your industry knowledge and networks to assist clients in finding and assessing the best national and international talent available. § These roles involve business development, sales, screening and identifying applicants, face-to-face interviewing, candidate care, and associated processes.§ §Is this you?§ Experience as a recruitment consultant would be an advantage, however, we will consider candidates with a background in any of the industries we supply to, or if you have a track record in sales or customer service. Most important is that you have the necessary skills, attributes, passion, and motivation for this role.§ §APPLICATIONS CLOSE:§ Monday, 12 October 2020§ §APPLY §OR VIEW THE POSITION DESCRIPTION§: § www.jacksonstone.co.nz§ §REFERENCE:§  7395§ §FURTHER ENQUIRIES: § David Hollander on §04 550 8000§        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Executive Search & Recruitment.§Opportunities for Senior Consultants.§Who are we? § A member of the AWF Madison Group, an NZX listed company, JacksonStone & Partners (JacksonStone) has become a well-regarded New Zealand agency since launching in 2011. With over 20 consultants, JacksonStone works across the private, public and NGO sectors, and appoints leaders in most professions. § §We are growing!§ Joining a close-knit, highly regarded team, these roles are suited to experienced recruiters or high-performing managers. Providing excellent opportunities to transition your career into executive-level search and appointments or the professional contracting environment learning from some of the best in the industry. § You will bring expertise in managing expectations, of clients and candidates. Driven and passionate with loads of EQ, you will be at the top of your game and ready to use your industry knowledge and networks to assist clients in finding and assessing the best national and international talent available. § These roles involve business development, sales, screening and identifying applicants, face-to-face interviewing, candidate care, and associated processes.§ §Is this you?§ Experience as a recruitment consultant would be an advantage, however, we will consider candidates with a background in any of the industries we supply to, or if you have a track record in sales or customer service. Most important is that you have the necessary skills, attributes, passion, and motivation for this role.§ §APPLICATIONS CLOSE:§ Monday, 12 October 2020§ §APPLY §OR VIEW THE POSITION DESCRIPTION§: § www.jacksonstone.co.nz§ §REFERENCE:§  7395§ §FURTHER ENQUIRIES: § David Hollander on §04 550 8000§§§§

jobText: TXT/50697956.txt	§Senior People, Culture & Payroll Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior People, Culture & Payroll Advisor§§Advertiser: §JacksonStone & Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §        §Senior People, Culture & Payroll Advisor §        §        §        §        §        §          §            §Great multifaceted HR generalist role.§            §Iconic Kiwi Brand.§            §Stunning waterfront location.§          § Loyalty New Zealand, along with the iconic Flybuys program, make it a goal to reward New Zealanders everyday – it’s what they love to do and that extends to their fantastic team.§ They have an exciting opportunity for an adaptable Senior People, Culture & Payroll Advisor, providing day-to-day operational advice and also supporting human resources activities aligned with the organisation’s strategic objectives§ This is a true ‘roll up your sleeves’ role, where you will embrace a broad range of general HR activities and projects including recruitment, remuneration, payroll, performance management, engagement, change management, training and development and organisational development but could also see you manning the bbq or leading the team to a gelato shout.  It will keep you on your toes so bring your flexible can-do attitude!§ The jobText: TXT/50700247.txt	§Learning and Development Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Learning and Development Manager§§Advertiser: §Gentrack Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Training & Development§§§§§§Gentrack enables the energy revolution by providing the software that manages the meter to cash process for energy companies. Access to affordable, reliable energy is front page news.  Our customers use our software to operate and grow in competitive energy retail markets. Our solutions are part of the new energy market, that integrates new sources of renewable generation such as rooftop solar and Electric vehicles.  § §We are currently seeking a proactive and self-motivated Learning and Development Manager on a 12 month fixed term contract to join our Human Resources team based in St Mary’s Bay.§ §Reporting to the Group Human Resources Manager, you will have the§ following key deliverables§:§ § §Execute the L&D strategy globally across the business§ §Evaluate the effectiveness of the current LMS and implement good practice (this may require a change in systems)§ §Sharing learning thought leadership and best practice with the organisation§ §Facilitating or coaching short workshops for leaders and employees§ §Curating great content to solve business strategies and problems§ § § §You will have experience in the following:§ § §Demonstrated professional experience as a L&D Manager or similar§ §Current knowledge of effective learning and development methods§ §Familiarity with e-learning platforms and practices§ §Demonstrated ability and knowledge in LMS systems§ §Ability to understand and support professional development needs of our business§ §Proven ability to deliver solutions that create value for our people§ §Exceptional communication, creative thinking and influencing skills§ §Excellent relationship management and interpersonal skills§ §An open-minded consultative approach§ §Analytical abilities and problem-solving skills § § § §We are very passionate about what we do and, therefore, the successful candidate will be driven, focused and capable of delivering in a fast-paced and time constrained environment. We are a great team to work with so why not come and join us!§ § § §Interested? Click the ‘Apply’ button now!§ §Want to know more about your next employer? - visit www.gentrack.com.§ §No agencies please.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50700975.txt	§Recruitment Facilitator (Manukau)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Facilitator (Manukau)§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Recruitment Facilitator (Manukau) §      §        §          §Proven experience in recruitment?§          §Advocate of the trades as a sustainable career choice§          §Full time position - Manukau based   §          §Salary range $91K - $113K depending on experience§ §        §        § §        §As the Recruitment Facilitator§        §TXT and Skills Hubs have been included as one of a package of initiatives in a government wide initiative called the Construction Skills Action Plan. §        §Construction is a key industry for the delivery of the Government's priorities and currently the construction industry does not have the skilled domestic workforce needed to build at pace and scale.  §        §TXT and Skills Hubs are one response to addressing labour and skills shortages.  By siting themselves close to large scale construction projects or clusters of projects, Hubs seek to    unlock the potential of tapping into a long term stream of employment and career opportunity for communities close to projects, thereby improving inter-generational economic and social wellbeing in those communities.§        §As the Recruitment Facilitator this role plays a key part of the wider TXT and Skills Hub and operates under the Hubs vision and values alongside a variety of key stakeholders.  This role will be a key pillar for a 'one stop shop' service approach for industry in relation to on-site training, promoting the investment in industry training and being a voice for trainee and employer needs. With a focus on individuals who are at various stages of seeking employment, this role is to oversee, facilitate and co-ordinate recruitment activities to ensure workforce development needs are met. There is a clear focus on remaining learner and employer centric in delivery and support including alignment to pastoral care of learners.§        §This also is a fantastic opportunity to truly collaborate with numerous organisations that contribute to a TXT and Skills Hub, all sharing the passion to tap into employment and careers offered by Auckland's major construction developments   and connect and support local jobseekers into those jobs and careers. §        §This role is part of the Sector Workforce Engagement Programme (SWEP) which supports businesses to invest and grow through better ways of accessing reliable, appropriately skilled staff at the right time and place.  The intention of SWEP is for government and industry partners to work together to identify and develop solutions that achieve both business and government objectives.§        § §        §Skills and experience required:§        §We are keen to hear from you if you have:§        §          §Proven recruitment experience§          §A passion for recruitment and getting  people connected to jobs and careers they can thrive in §          §Detailed knowledge and experience in working with a range  of recruitment applications and services§          §Strong relationship management skills; builds and sustains relationships  with job seekers and employers through respect for individuals, open communication and displaying sensitivity towards people§          §Sound writing and verbal communication skills, including well-developed presentation skills§          §Experience working with a wide range of job seeking candidates to support them in to employment k including young people entering the workforce and people looking to change careers paths or  re enter the work force§          §Demonstrates initiative and ownership, taking action before being asked and proactively makes suggestions on how to improve things at work§          §High level of attention to detail with the ability to maintain focus on priorities and work well under pressure§          §Able to embrace change and deal with ambiguity and uncertainty§          §Clean driver's license§          §Good level of IT  literacy and skills§          §Must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand§        §        § §        §Why work for us?§        §Developing our staff is a key focus for MBIE.  We aim to create a culture where staff are empowered to bring fresh perspectives to issues and to think outside the box.  Being the largest policy shop in NZ, MBIE offers significant opportunity for developing experience across a broad variety of areas. We encourage excellence and proactively support development through on-the-job learning, training courses, conferences and seminars, development programmes, secondments, rotations to other branches and study opportunities.§        § §        §About MBIE:§        §The purpose of the Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment (MBIE) is to Grow New Zealand for All.  Our goal is to create a strong and high-performing economy by creating an environment that supports businesses to become more productive and internationally competitive.§        §Our way of working is guided by our values which shape our behaviours. §        §          §Mahi Tahi - Better Together§          §Maia - Bold and brave§          §Pae Kahurangi - Build our Future§          §Pono Me Te Tika - Own It§        §        § §        §How to apply:§        §Click on the APPLY button below in order to be directed to our on-line careers website.  You may view a position description at this site, as well as complete the on-line application, and upload a CV and cover letter. jobText: TXT/50701164.txt	§Recruitment Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recruitment Coordinator§§Advertiser: §H & J Smith§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Southland§, §Invercargill§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Recruitment - Internal§§§§§§Join our H&J Smith Department store with a proud, local history & great team vibe. We bring a mix of tradition & innovation to the Southern Region. We employ over 200 staff in a range of roles: retail, hospitality, inwards goods, admin, buying, finance, web, marketing & IT. §  §H&J Smith Invercargill has it all under one roof, a store network of specialty areas: Outdoor, Paper Plus, Curtain Call, Copper Kettle & Mooch.§  §Are you an experienced recruiter? A positive people person? Role model leadership behaviours to motivate & inspire others? Let’s chat.§  §The purpose of this new in-house role is to ensure a consistently excellent experience for our People. You will be a motivated, relationship builder to:§ § §Deliver effective end to end recruitment practices developed with the Manager – People & Capability. Create adverts, screen candidates, co-ordinate & conduct interviews, support & upskill hiring leaders, reference checks. § §Prepare & distribute offer, contract & onboarding documents. Create & update employee files.§ §Co-ordinate & track induction of new employees, deliver content where appropriate. § §Data entry & support of Health, Safe & Well systems. § §Additional People focused admin tasks may be required e.g. training or project support.§ §You’ll §report §to the Manager – People & Capability. You’ll also work closely with our hiring leadership team.§  §Hours§: permanent part time, approx 20 hours/week, usually Mon-Fri, start time negotiable. Prefer 5 days/week and request your flexibility to cater for seasonal recruitment & project needs.§  §Non-negotiable§: recruitment passion & experience, dedication to candidate care, excellent communication skills, drive to continuously improve & a can-do attitude! Knowledge of retail & hospitality industries, plus generalist HR skills are advantageous.§  §Benefits§: Store network discount, friendly, hardworking team in a local, family owned business. Modern office space & ability to work from home, where appropriate.§  §Apply via SEEK§ with cover letter & CV. Or ring Meg for a confidential chat 027 208 7573. Applications will be considered as they arrive, so get in quick.§  §You must have the right to live & work in NZ to apply.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of recruitment experience do you have?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§Do you have HR experience in the retail industry?§§§

jobText: TXT/50705772.txt	§Health and Safety Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health and Safety Advisor§§Advertiser: §Alliance Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§About us§Alliance Group is a global leader in procuring, processing and marketing the world's best quality red meat products. We're becoming a food company with world-class processing and livestock capability and our products are enjoyed in more than 65 countries across the globe. As New Zealand's only 100% farmer owned red meat co-operative, our aim is to maximise returns to our committed farmer shareholders and support them to operate profitable and sustainable farms.§Alliance Group has an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Health and Safety Advisor. We are looking for an experienced person based in our Smithfield Plant to contribute to the implementation of the AGL Health and Safety framework and champion the health and safety culture by providing operational support across all Plant functions. This position reports into the Smithfield Plant Health and Safety Manager.§About you§To be successful in this role, you will have demonstrated success in promoting behavioural change with experience in operational health and safety in high risk industrial environments. The ability to analyse the current state of situations and introduce a cycle of continuous improvement is required, as well as excellent communications skills.§You will provide operational health and safety support across the functional areas of the Plant along with contributing to the wider business and assist with the improvement of safety and health performances across AGL. Project management, project engineering and/or project planning experience, such as scope, schedule, cost, quality, and stakeholder management are crucial attributes you will possess.§You will be proficient in the use of Microsoft Office suite, especially that of MS Project and have strong working knowledge of project management software.§Sounds like your kind of role?§If being encouraged to pursue excellence every day inspires you, you'll fit right in here. Not only do we strive to be the best in New Zealand's market, we're also a global brand with ongoing projects to keep us moving onwards and upwards. For someone with your motivation to succeed, it doesn't get any better than this.§If you believe you have the skills and experience to be successful in this role, we would like to hear from you.§With our ongoing commitment towards health and safety, you'll undergo a pre-employment drug test that will form part of your application.§Applications close on Sunday, 25 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: HR Coordinator Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50709316.txt	§HR Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Napier Port§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§\Napier Port is located in Hawke’s Bay and is New Zealand’s fourth largest port; providing a range of port and logistical services (marine, handling, and value add services). Our core revenue (of around $100m a year) comes from container services, bulk cargo and cruise. We receive nearly 700 ships a year, carrying over five million tonnes of cargo and over 100,000 cruise passengers. §At Napier Port we are clear about our purpose: Together, we build a thriving region by connecting our customers, people and community to the world. We understand our role in the region and within the national transport network. We know that by supporting a thriving regional economy, and by actively growing regional outcomes, our community, our country and our shareholders benefit. §We’re looking for a Human Resources Coordinator to join our Culture and Community team. Reporting to the Senior HR Advisor, the HR Coordinator is responsible for providing a high level of coordination services and advice to our wider management team.§Key priorities for the role include:§  §Recruitment and on-boarding processes e.g. advertising roles, managing the online recruitment system, interviewing and running pre-employment checks§  §Systems support - provide system administration support and development for our Human Resources systems (including our HRIS Bamboo HR and our  performance and engagement system)§  §Day to day HR coordination service and support to the HR team and managers §  §Contribute to ongoing development and improvement of the Port’s human resources processes§  §Self-development and growth in human resources and employment relations §  §Provide cover for Payroll§The successful candidate will have a relevant tertiary qualification (e.g. Management, Human Resources, Commerce) and 1-2 years’ experience in an HR related field, ideally in an operational environment. We are seeking a quick learner – someone able to multi-task and deliver in a busy environment, with strong attention to detail, internal service and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines. This person will be an excellent relationship builder with strong communication skills and a focus on continuous improvement. §This is a career opportunity to a person with potential to develop their HR career. If you think this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.§Applications close on the 23rd of October. §§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Workforce Planning and Development Lead Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50709407.txt	§Workforce Planning and Development Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Workforce Planning and Development Lead§§Advertiser: §KiwiRail§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Workforce Planning and Development Lead §        §          §Your role:§          §KiwiRail is undergoing a period of significant growth and investment in rail and asset upgrades across our New Zealand networks and services. As a result of this, we have created a new position to take the lead in our workforce planning and development across operational workstreams and key projects to create an enterprise-wide strategic workforce plan to ensure we meet current needs and plan for the future. Working closely with senior leaders and key stakeholders, you will gain an in-depth understanding of the immediate, short and long-term resourcing requirements to deliver across the various projects and workstreams and collaborate with Talent, Learning and Development and HR on the strategic plan. In addition to this the role will act as a subject matter expert for the organisation in workforce planning, educating, coaching and mentoring key stakeholders and people/project leaders in workforce planning methodology and creating sustainable workforce frameworks and toolkits for the business.§          §Your skills:§          §To be considered for this role you will have solid demonstrated experience in workforce planning across multiple streams of work at an enterprise level. Ideally you will have knowledge and understanding of the complexities of infrastructure/rail construction projects and how to develop and execute sustainable resourcing plans to support delivery. You will be a strategic thinker who can challenge traditional resourcing methods and take an enterprise-wide view in creating workforce plans while carefully considering organisational design and business strategic objectives. Naturally you will be a connector, with the ability to build strong working relationships at all levels and become a trusted business partner to key stakeholders. A tertiary qualification in HR or equivalent will be essential, as will be excellent communication skills both written and verbal. This role is a two year, fixed term contract.§        §        §www.kiwirail.co.nz §      §    §  §§§Your role:§KiwiRail is undergoing a period of significant growth and investment in rail and asset upgrades across our New Zealand networks and services. As a result of this, we have created a new position to take the lead in our workforce planning and development across operational workstreams and key projects to create an enterprise-wide strategic workforce plan to ensure we meet current needs and plan for the future. Working closely with senior leaders and key stakeholders, you will gain an in-depth understanding of the immediate, short and long-term resourcing requirements to deliver across the various projects and workstreams and collaborate with Talent, Learning and Development and HR on the strategic plan. In addition to this the role will act as a subject matter expert for the organisation in workforce planning, educating, coaching and mentoring key stakeholders and people/project leaders in workforce planning methodology and creating sustainable workforce frameworks and toolkits for the business.§Your skills:§To be considered for this role you will have solid demonstrated experience in workforce planning across multiple streams of work at an enterprise level. Ideally you will have knowledge and understanding of the complexities of infrastructure/rail construction projects and how to develop and execute sustainable resourcing plans to support delivery. You will be a strategic thinker who can challenge traditional resourcing methods and take an enterprise-wide view in creating workforce plans while carefully considering organisational design and business strategic objectives. Naturally you will be a connector, with the ability to build strong working relationships at all levels and become a trusted business partner to key stakeholders. A tertiary qualification in HR or equivalent will be essential, as will be excellent communication skills both written and verbal. This role is a two year, fixed term contract.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Occupational Health & Safety§§§§§§In 2008, a wild and rugged stretch of coastline on the north-eastern tip of New Zealand’s South Island became home to one of the most sustainable wineries in the world. §In just 12 years, Yealands has grown to be one of NZ’s most recognised wine labels with an award winning reputation.§The Opportunity §We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Health & Safety Manager to join our team to champion health, safety & wellbeing across the organisation.§We are looking for someone who will provide a proactive approach to health & safety across the business, identifying and implementing plans and strategies to address issues, ensure compliance and to minimize risk.§Reporting to the QSSE Manager, your responsibilities will include;§ §  §Leading the way in achieving our objective of 0 LTI’s §  §Advising and implementing legislative changes and practice guidelines in line with the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015§  §Providing leadership across the business by enabling a health & safety culture§  §Supporting and driving health and safety departmental sub-committees §  §Coordinating companywide health and safety training initiatives §  §Monitoring health & safety statistics and reporting across the business, including providing reports to The Board§  §Leading and assisting external audits §  §Maintaining and improving incident, accident and near miss reporting§  §Managing rehabilitation and return to work programmes§As you will be responsible for health & safety across all NZ operations as well as acting as providing support to our global staff, prior experience in a Health & Safety Manager role is a must.§Are you the right person for us?§  §Attitude is important – being a positive, team player, with a sense of humour §  §You will have a keen interest in §A great location – with an office based in our Seaview Winery§  §Competitive salary and wine allowance§  §Health insurance §  §A day off on your birthday! §  §2 weeks company paid parental leave§If applicant will be required to undergo a pre-employment drug & alcohol test.§Applications close 30 October 2020. §For a copy of the Job Description visit §2020-10-09-Health-Safety-Manager.pdf§§§§Right jobText: TXT/50709730.txt	§HR Business Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR Business Manager§§Advertiser: §Fire and Emergency New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Consulting & Generalist HR§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §HR Business Manager §    §    §      §        §Fixed-term until June 2021.§        §For more than 150 years, fire service organisations have been at the heart of New Zealand communities. Our vision is to build stronger communities and protect what matters most to the people within them.§        §We have a big job to deliver on our vision and need your support!§        §We are a new Directorate and we are in the process of developing our identity and defining how we combine our services to deliver workable solutions to our customers. This will be an evolving process and we are looking for an experienced HR Business Manager, to support this shift.§        §About you§        §We have an exciting opportunity for a seasoned HR professional, with broad depth of experience across people functions. You will work alongside the National Manager People Experience to develop and deliver work programmes, business cases, and policies. jobTitle: GM People, Safety and Engagement Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50711317.txt	§GM People, Safety and Engagement§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§GM People, Safety and Engagement§§Advertiser: §Brannigans Consulting Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§INVERCARGILL BASED§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Human Resources & Recruitment§, §Management - Internal§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §GM People, Safety and Engagement §      §        §HW Richardson Group Ltd§ is a family owned business proudly based in Southland. The HWR Group operates 50 companies in various areas of specialised transport, ready mix concrete, petroleum, distribution, contracting, aggregates and waste. With revenues in excess of $1.5bper annum, the HW Richardson Group now employs more than 2000 staff over 100 sites across New Zealand and Australia. For more information on the Group and their businesses visit § www.hwr.co.nz§. §        §Invercargill provides an excellent lifestyle location like no other; with Stewart Island, Queenstown and the greater Southland and Otago regions on your doorstep. For further information on the area, please visit §www.invercargillnz.com§        § §        §The Role§        §Reporting to the CEO, we are looking to appoint a General Manager People, Safety and Engagement to be based in Invercargill whose purpose is to lead the development and delivery of human resource, organisational development and safety and wellbeing practices that support and enable the senior leadership team and their teams to deliver strategic and day to day business outcomes.§        §The key responsibilities of this role will be to lead the HR and safety team to represent, drive and further influence the core values that guide the organisation across multiple industries and foster a collaborative and cross functional approach. You will have a true understanding of what success looks like for the organisation’s people leaders and support them to implement practices and frameworks that will help their teams realise success. You will oversee the effective recruitment, employee experience, engagement, performance management, remuneration structures and learning and development programmes. A key objective for the role will be in building culture across the group that meets the companies and the changing social expectations. Additionally, you will lead the industrial relations strategy, support negotiations and have strategic oversight of safety and wellbeing. Measuring and reporting on key human resource drivers will also be important to quantify the value within the Group.§        § §        §Skills and Experience§        §This role requires an experienced, down to earth and innovative human resource and safety leader who can authentically connect and build great relationships with the team and wider business. You will be a strategic and trusted advisor who supports the senior leadership team and their managers to foster an outstanding diverse and inclusive culture, and further build the capability within their teams. We are looking for someone who is future focused and has a track record of leading Future of Work change with solid experience supporting people through this change. A relevant qualification and experience in a similar role are essential.§        § §        §To Apply§        §Please submit your cover letter and CV by clicking the appropriate “Apply” button. Initial phone enquiries can be made to Lisa Wheeler on §03 345 8764§ or Sally Wynn-Williams on §03 345 8759§.§        §Applications for this role close 5pm Monday 26 October 2020§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§HW Richardson Group Ltd§ is a family owned business proudly based in Southland. You will oversee the effective recruitment, employee experience, engagement, performance management, remuneration structures and learning and development programmes.
